text: An interesting and unusual main character brings a comical and relatable touch to this good action sci-fi movie. The topic of time travel is tackled in a refreshing and fun way, with a pleasant emotional depth to the characters to make for a touching story.

title: Don't expect too much
text: The Adam Project is a comedy and science-fiction film. Adam (Ryan Reynolds) travels in time to look for his wife Laura (Zoe Saldana), and he appears in 2022 in where he finds the 12 year old Adam. During this, Maya Sorian (Catherine Keener) appears and battles against the old Adam and Laura. After this, both Adams decide to travel time in where his father was alive in order to destroy the time travel machine, which his father, (Mark Ruffalo) has created.Honestly, the film was entertaining, but although this I would not recommend it. It's good but it leaves out many things without being explained, or there are things that just don't make sense, it ends up being farcical.The battles are very unreal and don't generate anything, no adrenaline, no emotion, nothing. Don't expect this film to be catchy. Most of the scenes are short, it twists and turns at a whiplash speed. Cast is really good but is disregarded because of the poor plot of the film. There is a turmoil of events that makes the entire movie to be a mess.Although my critics, I will not lie, some parts were emotional. Just as when the old Adam gives some lessons about his treatment towards his mother. As well as all the mourning of the father. It's interesting the relation between the two Adams and how they give advice to each other.If you decide to watch the film, don't expect too much about it. And try not to give too much attention to each minimum detail of each scene.

title: A solid action comedy
text: I tend not to read too much into movies, cause thats what they are. Just movies 😊Sure this isnt the best movie, but i found it quite entertaining for what it was, a comedy action flick. Plus who doesnt like reynolds wittyness.So watch this movie with the heart of a kid, then you will surely enjoy it. I guarentee it 😊

title: Not worth recommending
text: Standard of projects Ryan seems to be taking up these days are reaching lower heights.Yes i was excited to watch for Ryan & concept of time travel.Its so disappointing without any content. Nothing in movie could really stick to you, you could leave halfway & not bother what happened next. Nothing too great in entertainment.Ryan brand of jokes are turning out to be quite monotonous, it's time he focuses on good story line.Rate 6, I feel it's high.Be bit repotting.

title: Why aren't there more movies like this?
text: Wow! Nice to see a light hearted, romantic, well-timed, less woke action comedy. Thank you! Ryan Reynolds remains perhaps the funniest guy in the industry. One negative is the prevalent foul language which does not enrich the story. .

title: Ryan Reynolds is an ingredient
text:
A fly on the wall of the creative team's room when putting together this movie heard the following:
Writer 1
"We need to a make a movie where Ryan meets a younger version of himself"
Writer 2
"Yea, so we will need to make it science fiction I guess - time travel"
Writer 1
"Yea, that's it, a witty snotty kids mets his grown up self... guess we need to fill in the rest of the movie"
Writer 2
"Lots of big special effects at the end, with a little soppy, cheesy emotional stuff to round this out"
Writer 1
"We have a script - what do you want to do for lunch?"Enough said.

title: Hold onto you seat viewers if you have a complicated family relationship or 2)
text: Now this is crazy, annoying, inane, unrealistic, loud, and cheesy but all put together to create magic - out and out emotional magic. Sad and devastating but quintessentially hopeful.Be prepared to find and accept yourself just a little more and to love your family a little harder after this movie about the devastating but endlessly powerful bonds of love we create with our family of origin and the life partner we choose. And then there is the lifelong journey we all traverse to value ourselves and to find our mojo in the world. Bravo all involved. An amazing and talented cast all round.

title: Shutdown Your Brain, Disregard Paradoxes and Enjoy the Entertainment
text: In 2050, a time-traveling pilot (Ryan Reynolds) fights another jet and is wounded, and he jumps to 2022. In 2022, the twelve-year-old boy Adam Reed (Walker Scobell) lives with his mother Ellie (Jennifer Garner) and misses his beloved father, the scientist Louis Reed (Mark Ruffalo), who has recently died. While his mother is working, Adam finds the pilot in the garage and soon he learns that the pilot is himself in 2050. Further, he intended to jump to 2018 to save his wife, Laura (Zoe Saldaña), who apparently died while investigating a confidential subject. The old Adam needs Adam to use his DNA to activate his jet plane since he is wounded, but is located by his enemies, Maya Sorian (Catherine Keener) and Christos (Alex Mallari Jr.). Out of the blue, they are saved by Laura, and flee to a house by the sea. She tells them that they must return to 2018 to meet Louis Reed and destroy his experimental time machine since Maya is returning to 2018 to provide information to herself to dominate the world in the future. The problem is that Maya Sorian is Louis' sponsor, partner and friend, and they have to convince him that she is a menace to the world."The Adam Project" is an enjoyable Netflix's film, with great cast and special effects, but a reasonable story. Walker Scobell is a promising actor, and the movie has names such as Ryan Reynolds, Jennifer Garner, Mark Ruffalo, Catherine Keener and Zoe Saldaña, among others in the cast. There are many paradoxes for a time traveling movie, but if you shut down your brain and disregard paradoxes, you will certainly enjoy the entertainment. My vote is seven.Title (Brazil): "O Projeto Adams" ("The Adam Project")

title: Cancer Causing
text: Like sucking on a spent fuel rod. A vile example of corporate movie making. Not funny, not moving, not exciting, not engaging. The level of stupidity on display is like staring at an oven and wanting to blow out the pilot and take a long nap.

title: Good Family Movie Night Film
text: Loved seeing Jennifer Garner and Mark Ruffalo share space onscreen again. Worth it for that but honestly a fun story and Ryan Reynolds's is always so relatable. He makes you laugh in this with his deadpan delivery and the whole family can watch. Really liked this.

title: How the hell they hired young Ryan Reynolds?!
text: If Ryan wasn't there i probably wouldn't even watch that, but it was watchable. The best part of the movie in my opinion is an actor playing young Adam, he is literally better Reynolds in this movie then actual Reynolds, i felt like he really understand his sense of humour. CGI in first part of the movie is awesome... Then it gets worse but it is not as bad as Josstice League. The whole plot with villain and villain herself is just boring and makes no sense to me (i can't say what exactly, because i want it to be spoiler free). The whole relation between the two Adams was just amazing. I guess that this is really first movie, where Ryan plays the serious one in the movie and see how annoying his younger version is. First part of the movie is something like 8/10 to me, but rest is hust decent 5/10, so i gave it 6,5.

title: Went on about 30 minutes too long...
text: I heard someone mention that Ryan Reynolds once again plays "Ryan Reynolds" here...but simply as another character. Welp, that was right on the mark.What we have is a slight rip off of Disney's "The Kid" concept where the older protagonist encounters his annoying younger, smart-aleck self...while also tossing in a time-travel element to the plot just to shake things up a bit. Ditch any form of plausibility and you might enjoy the ride. However for me, seeing this once was enough. The initial first act managed to hold my attention, even though I found the child-version of RR to be an irritating little snot. I know that character element was purposely woven into the film as a plot device, but the little kid still got on my nerves after a while. I got the feeling he was trying too hard. Then, of course, there was Catherine Keener's selection to play the antagonist, which...I'm sorry but I really couldn't buy. Perhaps she's been typecast in my mind as the sweet and mellow-like mom-next-door, so the sultry, evil Dr. No transformation here just didn't ring true to me. And even RR's supposed relationship with Zoe Saldana in the film just seemed forced. I couldn't swallow any of the chemistry between them. Their affection seemed tacked on rather than natural.All in all, take the movie at face value and don't try to dissect it on too many levels. At the end of the day, it's a kid's film, and I'm sure that's exactly who the producers intentionally targeted.

title: Why!?
text:
Why the little Adam talks just de same way than older sam, same entonación and words of an grown up sam...So many cliches...
This movie is made for kids...little ones...
Chevrolet sponsors the whole movie... and not subtlyAnd Ryan Raynolds is the same person in all of his movies,

title: It is a film that I like
text: A satisfactory flick featuring Ryan Reynolds.I got enough enjoyment from 'The Adam Project'. It isn't anything special as the film is missing a certain sort of spark to it, though the story is fun and allows for some interesting and rather sweet scenes; the latter is particularly true for the conclusion, which is well produced.Reynolds himself is solid in the lead role, his performance is more serious than funny but there are still a fair amount of amusing moments for him across the 100 or so minutes. Walker Scobell gives a good showing behind the main man, his comedic timing in the first few scenes really does mirror Reynolds'.Elsewhere on the cast, Mark Ruffalo, Zoe Saldaña and Jennifer Garner are decent. I will say that I found the antagonists a bit weak in this, I wasn't all that interested in them or their side of the plot. Better villains would've heightened my enjoyment, for sure.Still, it is a film that I like.

title: I tried to watch it but couldn't finish it... terrible!
text: This movie is so torturous to watch. Tedious. Cliché after cliché. Bad scripting, bad acting, bad CGI. It's all that's wrong with Hollywood these days. Sad.

title: A fun sci-fi for the entire family
text: I don't understand how some critics and reviewers thought the back and forth travel sequences had plot issues... they were actually spot-on and made more sense that some of these other twisted time travel movies. What I really enjoyed about this one is that is was for the entire family, and the all-star cast - especially Reynolds, just made it funnier and heartwarming, especially teamed up with the young and talented Walker Scobell.Sure the story has been similarly done before, but not with this much heart and soul to the story, as well as natural comedy (from Reynolds). It's an emotional fun ride that was perfectly cast and performed, with excellent directing, writing, cinematography, visuals and effects, and an amazing soundtrack to boot. I'll be seeing this one again for sure! It's a well deserved 8.5 from me, upped to a 9/10 to try and offset these 1/10 wannabe critics smh.

title: Funny and emotional popcorn movie
text: This movie relies on 2 things, a decent script and chemistry between characters. And both of these aspects work. If you judge this for what it is, I believe you will find it's an enjoyable, emotional, funny sci-fi aimed to a wide audience.If this is you thing, give it a go.

title: Below Average Time Travel Movie
text: The movie is very badly constructed and presented to the audience, the fake house set inside a fake forest location is non-sense. It breaks many rules of time travel and gets away with it, it doesn't make any sense. It isn't even comparable with a time travel movie.

title: Walker Scobell, this kid was a joy.
text: I loved this film and surprised the "major" critics undercut it the way they have. Starting to question their logic.There were laugh out loud moments and emotional provoking moments as well. The casting of this film was choice as well. Can't wait to see more from Walker Scobell.

title: Loved this movie
text: I love nearly everything about this film. I won't spoil it for others that have yet to see it, but there are a couple small goofs that I spotted.I wish the writers had given Zoe Saldana a bit more screen time, but I just happen to think that she is really hot along with being a great actress in my opinion. Always enjoy Ryan Reynolds regardless of the role. I liked Walker Scobell very much in this role...I have never seen him before. I think that the screenwriting is excellent, great casting, and, the locations are spectacular. I know from personal experience that this place is gorgeous although I was there nearly 25 years ago!

title: Awesome if you're younger
text: A time travel movie with potential. The movie has obvious short comings with the plot, it would have done much better as a limited series. There seemed to be a lot to unpack and there was no dialogue about the science behind the technology. The script tries to tie in a love story but you don't get attached to the relationship because it's not really portrayed in the movie.Ryan Reynolds never fails to make us laugh with his funny delivery and cross overs to his other movies. The younger Adam, the kid, did a great job. Between the two they create moments during that movie that are sentimental and enjoyable. I wish that carried through.This movie had potential of an A+,however, the faulty writing plot holes and poor science is the difference of a good movie vs a bad one.

title: The Adam Project Common Sense Review
text: I have been a big fan of Shawn Levy's work since Big Fat Liar, so when I heard he was once again teaming up with his muse @vancityreynolds I was excited to see what they would create. The Adam Project is a great, fun time with a heart of gold at the center. I will say, this film had flashes of Spielberg, child-like wonder at times and that only made it more enjoyable. Where it struggled was that the ending was somewhat weak and the villain's motivations were not the strongest, but despite its flaws, this film is a good time and definitely one families with teens can enjoy.What were your thoughts on the film?

title: Fun, heartwarming, sci-fi flick!
text: The Adam Project is easily one of the best film of the year, and the best Science Fiction movie that has been released in a very long time. Not only is the story completely captivating from the very start of the movie, it includes numerous elements from different genres that make it something for everyone. There is humor, heart, Science Fiction, time travel, nostalgia, important life lessons, a banging soundtrack, and way more action than I anticipated. Part drama, part comedy, part sci-fi, and all fun, The Adam Project is the must see movie of the year.

title: Can't put a finger on why kind of bored me
text: This is normally the type of movie I'd really enjoy. Always love Ryan Reynolds and Mark Ruffalo and Garner. But something felt either cheap or missing. I liked the emotional parts and disliked the Sci fi. And i normally like a good sci fi movie. This part felt cheap in a way. Again not sure why, but just felt could and should have been SO much better!

title: Much ado about nothing
text: Time travel movies are working with a 1 in 100 average. The bad ones rely mostly on the technical part of the story like this one. Something felt off the whole time so I paused at the midpoint of the movie and asked my partner if they knew what the characters objectives were. Neither of us had a clue.Good time travel movies aren't about the time travel. They are about people. I had no idea who these characters were except for stunt casted famous people.I like giving the films I'm supposed to watch a try every once in a while. They should have put their advertising budget into the script writing. But then again, they wouldn't be green lit for the next populist film so they have to rely on bells and whistles. Even Ryan Reynold charm was not enough to keep me.

title: A true Sci-fi film
text: This was a sweet film on father and son...the music was beautiful the acting was just like how u would meet your older self, a story of love, friendship and family with a shot action from Troy legacy, star trek and star wars films.👍👍 a pure 10/10 stars 🌟

title: An Honest Review - The Amazing and The Bad!
text:
What was AMAZING:
1. CGI
2. Sound effects
3. The fighter jets' fight on Earth (I love it that sometimes when they fly by they make sounds similar to Star Wars TIE fighters)
4. The jokes were good actually, nothing cliche, all pretty original material.5. Actors actually did pretty amazing job with the script they were given. (except Sorian)
6. Great time waster, wasn't bored even for a minute, time passes very fast with this movie.What was BAD:
1. Plot holes and especially Time Travel plot holes!2. Script development is pretty pretty childish, if I was 10-13y old this movie would be 9/10 for me.3. The bad guys in the metal suits are just as worse as Imperial Stormtroopers. They are just like an annoying background, helpless and easy dying and never causing any real damage 😅
4. The main antagonist is like...not very smart, not very determined, makes questionable moves. Her methods are best suited for a child movie. I mean...even the actress playing her...I just can't take her as evil. It's like an average business woman in her 50s who decides to take over the world, yey.This movie could have been something really big, it just needed a more mature script, a deeper one, a more engaging one.It's just feels shallow and rushed. My analytical side, my scientific side, my mature side, they all were quite disappointed.My childish side, my big boom effects side, my I don't care whatever side were super happy!

title: How to make a good movie
text: ... or how to at least make the list, as in deserving better than a 1/10 .It's 2022, most people can read between the lines by now .

title: Proper popcorn movie
text: Fun, entertaining nonsense.Put your brain in neutral and enjoy a charismatic fun film. I'd rather watch this of an evening than the majority of boring and pretentious Oscar winners.The performances are ideal for this type of film. It has a few surprisingly heartfelt moments and some cracking one liners. The pacing is reasonable throughout and as a refreshing change it's under two hours long!Ok so now I'm just making up the required character length (who can't a review be precise and to the point?) with a conclusion that this film was fun and a proper old school enjoyable romp. No need to be the best film in the world just a need to be enjoyable!

title: Great Time travel but Same Ryan Reynolds
text: I wish Ryan tries for new roles rather than doing same Deadpool adapted characters.Some change is necessary.But the movie is great. Could have been more into science rather jokes but a nice entertaining one.

title: Fun, worth the watch
text: This movie is a fun, comedic ride with decent acting and some nice visual effects. Classic action comedy type movie that tries to have some serious moments and plays off the rest with comedy, which works well for the most part, but mighy leave some movie fans cringing a little. Overall, not going to win any oscars, but worth the watch. It might make some boys want to hug their parents. 7/10.

title: A surprisingly fun time travel movie from Netflix
text: This is a typical Reynolds movie it's fun it's action packed and it's family friendly.This is a straight to Netflix movie and it obviously is a mid budget movie relaying on Reynolds screen presence, Zoe Saldana plays his wife and Ruffelo cameos as his father.The screen play is lacking any character development but even at 105 minutes the story is thight.A good sci-fi I'd recommend to anyone.

title: Great!
text: I enjoyed this, from start to finish - a well paced enjoyable story. Moments to laugh and moments to shed a tear, all wrapped up in one. This movie didn't leave me hanging in any way, it just felt complete.

title: Kid got the bat
text: A fun colorful time travel adventure filled with some actions and good visuals, The chemistry between young Adam and grown ass Adam was perfect and the humor they both make to mock on each other was good either, The family sentiment also worked well Jennifer garner and Mark Ruffalo made some good parental scenes, The time travel plot is not so complicated everyone can easily understand it, Never got bored anywhere, An enjoyable one.

title: Super boring and lightweighter than an pigeon feather
text:
I'm not sure what other people see in this movie.And I'm unhappy that I also saw it.Boring, boring, boring. Can be a good plot for a 3 years old but for grown-ups.... weak dew.No more please!Just compared to the Terminator when they quoted it..
Very bad movie.

title: Best movie I've seen in a few years
text: Best movie I've seen in a few years, Funny movie, action like Star Wars but better, great soundtrack, good acting. True Love. The opposite of everything else that Netflix is putting out these days in a good way.

title: Great movie! Language is NOT family friendly
text: This would be a great movie to watch through VidAngel to take out the foul language. My son was interested from the description and my daughter was enthralled within the first 15 minutes.

title: Not the best not the worst
text: It was an ok movie to watch. Like to whole time travel part in the movie. The special effects are nice. The lightsaber joke is funny :) Ryan Reynolds acting and jokes are always the same but fit this movie. The boy is ok but gives the movie more of a childish vibe. If you say this is a Disney movie I will believe you. The story is a bit predictable and script seems a bit rushed but overall watchable movie.

title: It was good but that's it
text: Got some funny lines there and uhm yeah that's all it was fun watching it tho, the fight scene was good they did a great job and uhm yeah? That what I think? Lol.

title: OK as long as you don't mind plot holes
text: Walker Scobell is going to go far, such a great little actor. He really pulls of the Reynoldisms. The action is well shot and the comedy element is ok-ish. Unfortunately it all got let down at the end by several gapping holes in its own lore.

title: One of the better Netflix films
text: A large amount of Netflix films seem to disappoint audiences but this film is one of the better Netflix films that Netflix has released. I was surprised by the performance from Walker Scobell playing the younger version of Adam. I haven't seen many people his age pull off such a great performance of a character, he really fit the character and really pulled me into the story. The film has a pretty interesting storyline and it was an enjoyable film to watch. The film is something new to watch, has great actors and it isn't so predictable like I find with some other films.

title: Thank you Levy
text: Keep taking us back bud. The '80s were a magical place for 90 minute adorable movies. And you keep taking us back. So what I'm saying is, I love everything you're doing.This movie was so so SO cute. The perfect blend of sci-fi and comedy. I even had a few tears at the end.Please. Keep. Making. These. Movies.

title: Ryan Renolds can't do no wrong
text: Just movie, watched a great one. Seriously thinking Ryan Renolds can do no wrong. Kinda sorta corny but strong action and acting by RR. Little Walker seems like a natural. Sorta thinking it has the makings of a trilogy of sme sort. But can been be left all alone, next story. ET kinda beginning.

title: Unique Story, Great Cast, & Hilarious
text: Awesome movie. Great for family night, date night, or going solo movie.Storyline is something we would all love to see become a reality. Whether we are running out of it, running late, wishing we could go back or jump ahead... time is so elusive and unrepeatable.It is just one of those movies you can see that the cast had a chemistry that really drove the movie to another level. While Ryan Reynolds and Walter Scobell are truly amazing and replicating their pairing would be next to impossible, this was an all star cast.

title: Riddled with plot convenience and paradoxes
text: Besides the story not making too much sense, it is an enjoyable film...There's a lot of good. The acting, the cinematography, fight choreography, the music and even the sfx. But none of it matters if the story isn't good.The Adam Project 2022 is a good first watch... If you don't want to use your brain. The movie glosses over important information necessary for character development and the cohesivenessimo it should have been about the father making a choice between his project and his son.

title: Enjoyable on a surface level
text: Ok so firstly, I'd like to say I really liked the movie. I enjoyed it. It was fun on a surface level. Secondly, technically speaking, it sucked. Plot holes galore, CGI was mediocre in most of it, the idea was for sure unoriginal, but it's kind of just one of those movies where you're just supposed to sit down and enjoy everything on a surface level. Watching it, I did enjoy the movie, but only because of certain characters' actions or lines by themselves. The actual plot of "omg time travel is ruining the world, evil character is causing it, let's go save everyone" doesn't really matter as much as what the individual characters are doing, because the plot is overused, inconsistent, and poorly set up. The movie had some really cute moments and messages, was pretty amusing overall, and I was glad to see that the parent figures weren't just some dumb people who didn't understand and only got in the way, but were actually kind of realistic and relatable (as average movie characters can get).If you start questioning the plot at all, it all falls apart. The movie directly contradicts itself a bunch of times. But Ryan Reynolds is just really good at playing a character that consistently amuses you throughout the movie until it ends, and the kid playing his past self was really good at matching his energy. The emotional parts are just emotional enough to have you kind of invested in the characters and what happens, but not so much that you start digging really deep or, again, thinking more than surface level.The movie wasn't a masterpiece, I don't think it'd be anyone's favourite, but it's just a fun and enjoyable film. I really liked it.I do think it's interesting that they named a couple famous people who were hardly in the film at all as if they were a large part of it, and how (probably due to covid) there seemed to be hardly any actors. Like, usually there are quite a few scenes where a large group of people are together in relatively close groups, either in the background or in the main focus of the scenes, but there just wasn't in this film. Even most of the scenes where they had a larger group of people, they were basically all spaced out for most of it. I'm glad they stayed safe if Covid is why, but it's just kinda funny.

title: Please stop digitising faces
text: A good film and yet another great "Deadpool sequel" as Ryan plays the same character we know and love from all his other films. But please stop with the god awful CGI-attempt on human faces.It was dreadful 2 decades ago and still is. I would have happily given a 9 if it wasn't for being constantly jarred away from the story with one character's awful computerised face.Watch it in profile shots, her nose actually keeps changing shape! Also irked me that whoever was wearing the green suit, has a smaller skull than the actor she was supposed to be a younger version of. Clearly visible in the side by side shot.I normally don't like kids in movies, but this one was great. He had clearly studied Ryan intensely, or rehearsed scenes together, as I could easily believe it was a young Ryan most of the time.Fun film, but like most time travel movies, best turn your brain to the entertainment setting and don't dissect the science too hard.9/10 with -1 for the horrific CGI face.

title: Its a decent family flick
text: It's a fairly decent but average flick. It definitely feels like a mismash of various other films like Star Wars, Star Trek, Frequency etc and while it can be fun at times, it never really feels like it's own thing.I don't care whether or not "the science" of the film makes sense. Suspension of disbelief and all that. And it was easy to follow along. My complaint storywise is I felt that outside the 2 Adam's and their dad played by Mark Ruffalo, none of the other characters had much development. Even the villain just kind of felt like a generic villain but with no build up. I think it would have helped introducing her to the audience in 2022 first or at least earlier in the film. But like Jennifer Garner doesn't really get much to do. Zoe Saldana is in the film maybe 15 min. And while she does have 2 action scenes, she doesn't really do anything else except deliver some exposition and serve as a way to flesh out Ryan Reynold's version of Adam more. I mean Mark Ruffalo isn't in a lot of the movie. He's only in the third act, but his character is so much more important and feels self actualized than the rest of the supporting cast.It is a bit predictable at times. But it is also fun and there's some cool special effects and action sequences with a couple of touching scenes thrown in. It didn't make me cry, so it didn't fully get me. But I still think it's overall a decent family flick. Emphasis on family.

title: Entertaining and heartfelt, but awkward and not that funny.
text: A heartfelt but awkward time travel story with Reynold's signature humour. The story and special effects are good but the focus on emotional drama makes it a bit boring at times and the whole delivery, including some of the acting, felt a bit off. It's entertaining enough, but nothing special.

title: Enjoyable
text: I actually decided to see it only because of its interesting cast and as someone who's not into this genre Im glad at least I didn't hate it or feel bored. It's cheesy, messy and has an unoriginal repetitive idea but it's still a fun and heartfelt movie. It's light, enjoyable and has some emotional moments.

title: Amazing Family Movie
text: I watched this with my family and I still can't believe that it had the same effect as watching back to the future 30+ years ago. Ryan Reynolds is an incredible actor.

title: Loophole, but entertaining
text: The usual enjoyable acting by Ryan Reynolds. Decent movie, don't expect much, just watch to enjoy.Spoiler hintThe Only thing is the usual dilemma with time travel. If past was altered, then the future changes, accordingly what changed the past does no longer exist, hence, past wont be altered.

title: Unless you are 12 years old or under give it a miss
text: I think the script was probably written by a 12 year old too who thinks he's Sheldon because it involves time travel. Big stars but big disappointment.If you are under 12 reading this and you might find this movie interesting for the special effects and time travel plow line but this is no Back to the Future which this movie references.

title: First half is fun, second half is predictable
text: I'm a big fan of time travel movies and this one has a very fun / enjoyable start. It shows great potential with the chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and the kid. It sets up what you would hope would be a plot / mission that's equally as good.However it eventually fails to live up to the charm of the first 40 or so minutes, as it falls into a typical cat-and-mouse plot with clichéd chase scenes and a mission that you've seen million times before in other movies.It has a few nice moments in terms of relationships between characters, but ultimately, it fails to offer any unique / clever aspects to it. And thus provides for a predictable viewing where you'll be clock-watching towards the final third.

title: Predictable yet nicely executed
text: Storyline is simple and predictable. Actually, there is nothing unique. I watched this because of Ryan that's it. If you looked into it for a amazing time travel or a great storyline into it then you will be greatly disappointed . However,it watchable just don't keep your expectations high.

title: Another modern masterpiece of ordinary film making
text: Poorly directed. Poorly written.An empty exercise in modern filmmaking that brings nothing to the sci-fi / time travel genre.And is it just me or is Ryan Reynolds schtick getting a bit tiring.Anyway, this film is not very good. Watch something else.

title: Another Fun, Solid Outing for Director Shawn levy
text: I'm a huge fan of director Shawn Levy. Has he ever directed anything that was award-worthy? No, but the majority of the time his movies either tug at my heartstrings (which I'm always up for) or at the very least, get a laugh out of me. Whether you're talking about his work on Real Steel or even as far back as Big Fat Liar, I've always been impressed. Having recently done Free Guy, which I quite enjoyed, I was very much looking forward to a sci-fi outing with him teaming up once again with Ryan Reynolds. While this film is far from perfect, Netflix's release of The Adam Project is heartwarming and a sheer joy to watch.Adam, a young, confident boy who just can't seem to keep from either getting bullied or suspended from school, receives a major wake-up call when himself from the future shows up. Needing to work together to stop an impending threat, as well as try and prevent things that may happen in the future, this film becomes a big, fun joy ride. With that said, the story of this film isn't even what hooked me. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell was off the charts amazing. The way he portrays a younger version of Reynolds was terrific. Even down to how Reynolds interacts with their mother was incredibly good. There are multiple emotional scenes that had me wanting even more.If I had to complain about something, this film started to lose me was in the third act. When the film really dives into the reasoning behind why Adam has travelled back in time, the story begins to feel jumbled and almost too simplistic. There were multiple times when I found myself wishing it was going somewhere different. The way the film concludes is simple, confusing, and satisfying all at once. If it wasn't for the messiness of where it all goes and how it all concludes, I may have been raving about how much I loved it.To be completely truthful, I was in love with the first 30 minutes of The Adam Project. The character development, along with the performances (which also lasts throughout the film) and the sense of awe and wonder all worked for me. It really just came down to the fact that it left a little to be desired for me. Shawn Levy proves once again that he works very well with actors and this brought me back to the early 2000s in terms of sci-fi, family-friendly storytelling. I had a blast watching this film even though I have a major complaint about it. I recommend checking out The Adam Project, now streaming on Netflix.

title: Good Light hearted Science Fiction
text: The screenplay is the major factor that makes this one a good movie. The emotional interaction between characters and the perfect casting choices lands this flick in a quite comfortable zone. Zoe Saldana steals the show with her short but effective part where her performance is top notch. Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell play different ages of the same character quite perfectly, their interactions are fun to watch. Visuals they managed to create using the vfx deserve praise. Especially, the action sequences are a delight to watch. Felt Shawn Levy's direction played a key part in improving the movie to a great extent.Still the movie has problems of its own including the same old storyline, rushed development due to its short runtime. Moreover all the unnecessary jokes felt absurd.Apart from all these flaws, Adam Project still can be clasaified as an good experience delivered by Shawn Levy.

title: I feel like people are too harsh on this movie.
text: Yes, you kind of need to turn off your brain during this, but I would say that's expected, just like for most of the time traveling movies.People either like Ryan Reynolds or hate him. I live in the first camp. Most of his movies are good in my opinion.I didn't know Jennifer Garner and Zoe Saldana were in this. That was a nice surprise.Overall, it's an enjoyable movie, if you like Ryan Reynolds and know what to expect from him, and from the time travelling plot.

title: That's weird, it farts when I cough...
text: Absolutely fantastic. I enjoyed this film from the very second it started. Ryan Reynolds is as always hilarious and the concept of the film is really great. Set aside all the malarky about time travel and blah blah blah and just enjoy the hilarious and wonderful performances of everyone in this wonderful touching and fun film.

title: A Good Fun Sci-Fi Film
text:
This film came to Netflix last week and I have finally had a chance too watch it and here is my review for the film The Adam Project. The premise of the film sees a time traveller having to team up with his younger self in order to create a better future.Main Character
Ryan Reynolds plays the lead character Adam and he is exactly what you expect and I actually think it really worked for this film. I think Reynolds flourishes when he is just being himself and this film is one of those, he is funny, charming and actually quite heartfelt as the older version of Adam. Youngster Walker Scobell plays the younger version of Adam and he was great and I think the future is very bright for him. The chemistry between Reynolds and him really carries this film and their performances are quite joyful to watch.Supporting Characters
Mark Ruffalo & Jennifer Garner play the parents of Adam and I really liked watching them. They just felt like really fun parents, seeing these top class performers having plenty of fun with their roles but also have depth in their characters makes them a great addition to this film. Zoe Saldana has a smaller role here but it was really impactful, she is also really fun on screen and adds some life to the film when it really needs it. But I must admit, I wasn't a huge fan of Catherine Keener as the villain, she was just pretty cliché and dull which is completely in contrast to the rest of the film and made it feel awkward and out of place.Story
The story is fun, seeing two versions of the same character interacting does provide some great entertainment and the film keeps you invested throughout. There are thoughtful character moments and development which is more then I expected from this film. But this film just struggles with the fact that it feels a bit cliché with its storytelling, we have seen so many time travel films by now that it doesn't bring that much new to the table.Script
The script is pretty good, there is plenty of humour and for the most part it delivers and had me chuckling throughout. But as I mentioned before, there was a surprising amount of heart and drama too which rose this above just an average comedy. Though, this film struggles with exposition dumps and it wasn't handled in a very clever way and I think that held the film back, especially in the first act.Style
The film also looks great, the style of the film is fun and exciting. The action scenes are well crafted and the future technology does enough to make it feel unique and adds plenty to this overall product. But the film does have a little bit of a pacing issue, the first act felt a bit slow and like it was taking its time building the world and then the later acts are so quick that it feels non stop.Overall
Overall, The Adam Project is a good film that would be a pretty fun watch for anybody. The combination of Ryan Reynolds and director Shawn Levy hits the spot and I cannot wait to see their work together on Deadpool 3.

title: Bad, the worst time travel movie I've ever seen
text: Really bad plot, the movie doesn't progress naturally. Worst sci-fi movie I've ever seen. The 2 stars I've given are for the cast, but the dialogues given to them are rubbish too. Complete waste of time, do not watch.

title: Slick Syfy Schtick With No Substance
text: Ok, so, The Adam Project, let me see ...... Well, the best thing I can say about it was that the actor who plays the kid was actually pretty good. Ryan Reynolds was his usual goofy charming self, and the rest of the actors were also good. Super slick CGI and lots of zesty fight scenes, but the entire time continuum plot was completely implausible. Lots of scenes of soul searching family values and the pros and cons of playing God during which the action took a back seat that required yet another heavy handed SFX spaceship chase or quantum core meltdown to remind us that we were supposedly watching a Syfy action flick. So, not a total gag me with a proton torpedo movie, but maybe just enough of a premise to make you wish time travel was real so you could reset the last one hour and forty-six minutes to rewatch (insert your favorite Syfy movie here) instead.

title: When you're just out of ideas...
text: The most generic movie I've ever seen.Adam travels to the past with the objective to destroy the invention of time travel to prevent a dystopian future. Of course, something went wrong during the mission and of course he meets his younger self. Of course, his father plays a huge role in this project and yeah, the Adam Project is the time travel project. They give us some generic and meaningless CGI fights and some super generic phrases like that they want to destroy some mathematical formula at which I as a mathematician just shake my head.Every part of the movie was predictable and generic and the humor didn't really cut it. It is really disappointing.

title: Entertaining Timey Wimey stuff
text: It was only last year that director Shawn Levy and Producer-Star Ryan Reynolds collaborated with Free Guy, Netflix's latest The Adam Project sees the two join forces again. Whereas the former was a mostly original, sometimes over the top yet really entertaining video game based sci-fi romp, this time is a fully original really entertaining yet largely forgettable sci-fi romp. The film opens like most sci-fi films - in space, Reynolds plays Adam a pilot who messes with time travel to fix something in the past. That bit isn't fully original - Terminator comes to mind or any other sci-fi that dabbles into time travel. He goes to the past to save his younger self played by Walker Scobell, who even throughout the film sounds like Reynolds, and even though the film is largely original as it deals with different elements of time, it's also largely forgettable. But Reynolds and his smaller much younger twin's quips help keep the film alive through it's 106 minute runtime. Albeit the film does suffer, with it's thin script, a forgettable villain and the innocuous and yet contagious Reynolds, can even be too much for the film to handle, a sort of too much Reynolds to handle. The action set-pieces are entertaining too, in fact that is where the film shines, the sparkly, through the wibble wobble time-wimey stuff Reynolds shines it's clear here that the cast and crew had a lot of fun making as the villain's crew are launched like lemmings through Star Wars like set-pieces.Admittedly you'll watch this, you'll probably enjoy it and why wouldn't you? There's a lot to enjoy, The Adam Project is funny, fast-paced and quick on it's quips and whims, though it's a largely forgettable film and it suffers from too much Reynolds, it's a slickly entertaining - and occasionally moving sci-fi action romp. It's the kind of film where you shouldn't expect too much, much like Free Guy before it. With this you will enjoy it, but probably forget it after the credits roll. 3/5.

title: Ryan Reynolds is his usually charming self, but the movie feels like a remix from other time travel movies.
text: Adam Reed (Walker Scobell) is a 12 year old boy who due to his short stature, asthma, and mouthy attitude is often a target for bullying. The death of Adam's father Louis (Mark Ruffalo) has left a rift between him and his mother Ellie (Jennifer Garner). When Adam is left home alone he investigates a strange noise in the nearby woods and discovers a man (Ryan Reynolds) who turns out to be him from the year 2050. In the future Adam has stolen a time traveling jet intent on investigating the disappearance of his wife, Laura (Zoe Saldana), while eluding Maya Sorian (Catherine Keener) who has used Louis Reed's research to control Time Travel and amasse untold powers in the future. Now the two Adams must find a way to stop this future from coming to fruition.The Adam Project is the latest high concept star vehicle from Netflix, runiting the streaming service with director Shawn Levy (Stranger Things) and Ryan Reynolds (Red Notice, 6 Underground). The concept behind The Adam Project can be traced back to a spec script originally called Our Name is Adam from 2012 written by T. S. Nowlin, best known for his collaboration with Wes Ball on the Maze Runner trilogy. Although announced at Paramount as a vehicle for Tom Cruise in 2012, the film has lingered in development hell for over a decade and has now found itself in the hands of Shawn Levy and his production company 21 Laps. There's some charm to the film with committed performances, but there's also the air of "I feel like I've seen this before" and the movie reminds you of it quite a bit.I will say that the casting of Walker Scobell and Ryan Reynolds as the younger and older Adam Reed's respectively is well done and the two show some solid chemistry. This is Scobell's first major leading role and he'll next be seen in the Paramount sci-fi blockbuster Secret Headquarters later this year. Easily the best moments of The Adam Project are in seeing the two Adams play off each other and wile Scobell's delivery is a little lacking in polish, it's a solid effort for a first time lead.The rest of the movie feels pretty standard with the film being a mixture of The Last Starfighter, Back to the Future, Flight of the Navigator, and even the central premise of a "younger self meets older self" has been done in projects like Looper, Disney's The Kid, and even in the Jumanji spiritual sequel Zathura. The movie never really gives us a reason to care about avoiding this "terrible future" because we don't really know how bad it is and it's kept very vague how bad 2050 is with the only major sequence set in the time being a dogfight in the Earth's atmosphere in the film's opening sequence where older Adam steals the Time Jet. Catherine Keener's Maya Sorian feels like a placeholder villain and there's nothing all that interesting about her nor do we really know what exactly she's done. The movie also feels overly "clean" with its time travel aspect and rather than play with the paradoxes of time travel the movie feels like it's trying to avoid them so it can get to the next fight or chase sequence. The effects look okay and are par for the course of these 21 Laps productions that try to evoke 80s pop culture and iconography, but there's really nothing that popped out at me and distinguished it.The Adam Project is an okay time killer that you won't be bored watching, but it's not going to leave much impact on you and you'll probably forget most of it when you wake up the next morning. Ryan Reynolds is fine as is Walker Scobell in his debut role and the two have good chemistry together, but everything else felt very muted and called attention to the fact other movies like this exist rather than leaving its own footprint.

title: Fun Movie, Action and Comedy Throughout
text: What a fun movie to watch. Ryan Reynolds and Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner and Zoe always do a great job in their roles. Guaranteed comedy too.There was a touch of sci-fi, comedy, scentimental moments, and action. It was a nice mix of all throughout.I enjoyed watching this movie. Quick one that wasn't expecting to ever see. I hope it performs well on Netflix.

title: Really enjoyed
text: My husband normally picks bad movies. This time he didn't. What I like yhe most is the kid. He has the mannerisms down pat.. and him.and Ryan's scense are great.

title: Meh it's a fine Reynolds movie
text: It's not one of Ryan Reynolds best movies nor is itnrh worst. It's just a meh movie, some funny spots but nothing truly hilarious. A lot (6+) of speeches where actors have tears in their eyes that were mostly pointless. Doubt id watch this again and wouldn't recommend. Just red notice again instead.

title: Loved it!
text: Best entertaining Netflix movie ever!! Very enjoyable time travel movie.. ok..its not back to the future but you still have a wonderful time watching it.During this times its not easy for a movie to switch off your problems and let it go...so good job Reynolds and Levy great duo!!!

title: Lovely movie
text: I thought the movie was quite fun, I always love the humor that Ryan Reynolds (and his characters) bring into the movies. It's a good watch, I do recommend watching it.

title: Silliness at best
text: I will always watch films starring my favorite actors, and Ryan Reynolds is one of them, but what a disappointment was The Adam Project. It's silliness at best.

title: Cute and fun family friendly sci-fi flick.
text: Ryan Reynolds is sticking to what he does best here: being a charming action hero throwing jokes around, and there is nothing wrong with that. The kid is also great and hopefully we'll see him in more movies in the future. Overall fun action sci-fi to be enjoyed by adults and children alike!

title: ANOTHER OK NETFLIX PROJECT
text: Love Ryan Reynolds. He is a funny guy and he drops a few amusing one liners here. The young Adam/Ryan drops a few too. Amusing.Sadhana is really weak and Garner just weird looking and untalented as always. In fact most of the acting is pretty poor.As for the hyper Hollywood overly dramatic Home Alone/Disney score. ...My apologies if I missed that this is a Disneyesque family adventure movie.... Oh, apparently I did. My bad.Ok, probably a good family movie.

title: Flawed but enjoyable
text: The Adam Project (2022) is a sort of odd-couple bromance set against a half-baked sci-fi time-travel adventure story. The character-driven relationship between adult Adam (Ryan Reynolds) and his younger self (thirteen-year-old Walker Scobell) is cinematic gold. The script provides a complex multi-tiered relationship with a lot of conflict, self-doubt, and guilt for the actors to explore. Both are talented and there is a lot of positive chemistry between them, as well as tension and conflict.The sci-fi/adventure plot is a hopelessly muddle of implausible contrivances to dismiss familiar temporal paradoxes. Catherine Keener plays a Pelosi-esque villainess who used insider information to become rich and powerful, then sold her soul to preserve her position. She hops through time with a phalanx of humanoid robots that fight like martial-arts masters and disintegrate when dispatched, allowing for large-scale fight scenes and Clockwork Orange ultraviolence without soaking the ground with blood or littering it with severed limbs.Fortunately, the movie largely avoids much of the woke content that makes so many recent films nearly unwatchable. None of the characters carries or uses a handgun and no police are anywhere in sight to trigger any radical leftist snowflakes in the audience, even when two bullies beat up a weak asthmatic schoolmate in broad daylight at a shopping center. To promote ethnic diversity, intercultural romances have become de rigueur. Adam's romantic interest is played by Hispanic Zoe Saldaña. The young Zoe, who played Cataleya in Colombiana, would have been a brilliant choice, if time travel were possible. She's still a strikingly beautiful woman, but eleven years and three babies later, she looks more like a soccer mom than a college freshman.Despite the contrived plot, the story is engaging, leaving the audience to wonder how the characters will extract themselves from this quagmire without creating some temporal paradox. Instead, all the characters seem to teleport themselves into some other movie playing at the cinema next door which kind of looks like the first movie, but takes place in a different cosmos of reality or some parallel universe.The ending isn't satisfying, but getting there is still fun.

title: Funny and light sci fi. Did you felt that Star Wars homage too?
text: If The chased down in the forest at Around 40 minutes does bring you back memories Of speed chasers in the forest in Return of the Jedi.... Please watch the movie again. Ahah.This has to be a subtle wink at that iconic scene from Star Wars. I see you 👍🏻Well done that made me smile. Great cast and funny scripts.It entertained me enough to pause and write here this during the movie :)Play!

title: Great father son movie!
text: Great father son movie! All the stuff young boys and girls like, action, fun, mom n dad it's a feel good movie. Great family entertainment!You can't go wrong with this group of actors.. all first class.

title: Lazy Hollywood Junk
text: I gave up watching after 30mins. The story is so predictable. Hollywood seems to have lost the ability to make anything original. Lazy film making. Lazy script writing. Lazy actors.

title: What a great film!
text: Love Shawn Levys work.This film is full of comedy and also has a great story.Ryan Reynolds was great and so was the young actor in the film (walker Scobell), I'm sure we will see much more of him in the future!Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner also play a fantastic part.A lot better than I thought it was going to be very easy watch, didn't feel Cheesey like some sci fi time travel movies do!Definitely worth a watch.

title: Great movie for parents with a teenager
text: Good wholesome fun ... nothing spectacular. Suggested age range 10-16.Bring popcorn and enjoy with your kid. It is pleasant enough ... but without a kid, I think you may forgo the fun.

title: The Adam Project
text: 5/10 - Shawn Levy/Ryan Reynolds' follow-up to the surprisingly good Free Guy is a bit lackluster with a confusing and not fully thought-out sci-fi plot that is at its best in its moments of heart (but could have gone so much further with it)

title: Time Travel
text: I was excited waiting for this movie. I love time travel movies. I didn't expect that this movie would be so silly. I know this was a comedy but I wish they had played it straight. I think the emotional impact would have been more with out all of the comedy which I didn't think it was all that funny. It just came off as silly. I love Reynolds he can be pretty funny ie Deadpool..and he is usually comedic in his movies but he could have played it straight with a few jokes. I didn't hate this movie, but I didn't love it either. I think the story would have been better without all the wise cracks..

title: Did I watch it? I don't remember tomorrow
text: It's just another Ryan Reynolds movie where he acts Ryan Reynolds. No plot, nothing new, nothing fancy, everything copied and seem before (even the "plot").It's ok to press the play button and start reading the news, that's why 3/10, otherwise 2/10.But if your electrical bill is already high, I suggest you skip this one.

title: WARNING! It's A Lighthearted FAMILY movie!
text: Ryan Reynolds is a family movie actor. Lots of people hate family movies and complain about them. All I can say is, don't watch lighthearted movies if you don't want lighthearted entertainment.Now, that said, this movie is really fun. It isn't his best but it is not less than really good. Reynolds is his usual wisecracking self.Mostly fast paced, it can seem to drag a bit toward the end, but picks up again. Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner all did well. The little boy who played Reynolds as a kid did GREAT impersonating the straight face delivery of the attitude and mouth of the man he will be (Reynolds).

title: Superhero landing....
text: Yep. It's nothing like you haven't seen before. However, it's still a very good family entertainment. The performances are really great. The chemistry between Ryan and the kid is great. There's never a dull moment. But also, the moment don't rise beyond a certain point. Set pieces are nice, given the fact that it's a Netflix movie. You won't feel that you wasted your time.

title: Complicated Movies
text: What happens when Deadpool, Hulk, Gamora, and Elektra are in the same frame? Of course, you will think if we are going to talk about Marvel movies. But this time your guess is wrong.The actors who played the iconic Marvel characters gathered and played in the science fiction genre film with the title The Adam Project. Maybe you have high expectations if later this will be very promising, but this time we apologize.You will be disappointed if you have high expectations with this one film. Big names don't make this film great at all. For those of you who like the Time Travel movie, you might be very interested in The Adam Project.

title: What.. How can this get negative reviews ???
text:
It's a Ryan Reynolds movie and it's nicely done.. loved it..
Excellent story, nice fx fantastic acting..
Without spoiling, watch the movie and enjoy it..

title: A different perspective to Sci-Fi
text: It's a good perspective to look at the science fiction's movie and funny way to introduce the time travel perspective. I really like the movie and the story is original enough.

title: A boring copy of every 80s movie we love
text:
Ryan Reynolds playing Ryan Raynolds -again-, groundbreaking!The Story is very predictable and also full of plot holes... Full of cliches... He has to have asthma, right? He has to! Every bullied kid has to have asthma. That must be an unwritten Hollywood law or something... Is it really that hard to come up with new ideas?I think the problem with this movie is that it wants to be everything at the same time. Science fiction, action, family drama, romcom... Unfortunately it fails miserably.The only thing that was good about this movie is the child actor who plays the young Adam. Everything else is just mediocre. Zoe Saldana playing a -not green- Gamora. Ryan Reynolds is as always himself and Mark Ruffalo has very little screen time just like Garner. SFX are OK for a Tv/Streaming movie...
This felt like a Kids Movie, like one of those you see on Nickelodeon or Disney Kids Channel... If you are between 5 and 12 years old you could enjoy it very much. I fast forwarded a chunk of it just to get over with it.

title: Entertaining
text: Greetings from Lithuania."The Adam Project" (2022) was a surprisingly entertaining flick. Writing, directing were solid, well done and always entertaining. While the story wasn't the most original one, it was good enough to keep me involved into it. It doesn't go very deep with its premise, yet for what it does it does very well.Overall, i liked "The Adam Project" for its being fun, light entertainment. It was pretty smartly written, has a good humor, is very well directed because at running time 1 h 40 min its perfectly paced and is not boring for a minute. Performances were solid as well as descent CGI. Entertaining flick.

title: Enjoyable Movie 🍿
text:
MY PERSONAL REVIEW ON "THE ADAM PROJECT" MOVIE👇👇👇
✨DIRECTION: 7.5/10
✨ACTING: 8/10
✨STORY: 6/10
✨CINEMATOGRAPHY: 7/10
✨MUSIC AND BGM: 8.5/10
✨SCREENPLAY: 9.5/10
✨DIALOGUE: 7/10⭕ OVERALL RATINGS: 7.5/10.

title: Good entertainment, and a good enough watch..
text: I like Ryan Reynolds and admired his work again in this film.The whole cast also kept up with the ball and played their roles well, especially the young actor playing Ryan as a youngster.Hard to explain the plot without possibly compromising the movie and that would be a shame.My wife and I both enjoyed the movie.Cons: CGIs (grr) but well done ones.Plus; Not an Adam Sandler in sight..

title: Cute movie
text: Nice comfortable feel-good movie with a great cast. Movie managed to make me genuinely laugh alone in my room and I feel like a good amount of the emotional moments worked for me. Solid fun, not too complex. What you'd expect from a Ryan Reynolds movie. I recommend it if you are looking for an easy watch.

title: Worth a watch
text: A decent level of plot, put together in a nice flow where you keep watching and a step above a 5 (C level) rating at a 6.There is plenty of special effects, fight scenes, action/adventure along with some 'family' bonding throughout the movie.Times where they cuss a little more than needed considering this is a movie that you could have a 10 yr old watch, but don't want the foul language.

title: Much fun!
text: I really enjoyed it! Ryan Reynolds is always fun to watch! Lots of great humor and action. I laughed out loud often. The little boy did great as well.

title: Classic time travel story with emotional family engagement.
text: Shawn Levy puts up the show with most the most ambitious stars of the decade. And they do make you laugh and shed tears at the same. A lighthearted Friday watch for movie buffs.Direction: Shawn Levy has previously directed Free Guy, starring Ryan Reynolds. And the director has already got the taste of Mr. Deadpool. With The Adam Project, Levy brings up the most emotional side of Reynolds.Screenplay: As the film takes a fast pace, it leaves an empty mark for some of the potent characters, including Zoe Saldaña. Over screenplay keeps the good hold on the audience, but fails to give enough time for the characters to evolve in a speculated time frame.Cinematography: The cinematographer Tobias Schliessler takes a wonderful wide angles, especially the Jet fighter sequence and lake side scenes, but failed to tap the close ups during emotional scenes. I was really expecting a close up shot (panning the camera across) at the end, where most of the characters shed tears out of their respective loss.

title: Good visuals, but no heart and forgettable
text: This movie reminded me of too many other movies and it kind of irked me. Sort of wish I would have skipped it. It had zero originality, good cgi but that's all. I felt nothing for the characters, except maybe the kid. He was ok.The movie literally copied the "scar" scene from the movie The Kid. And the ending reminded me too much of the last ep. Of Stranger Things.

title: Who doesn't love time travel
text:
Walker Scobell does an excellent job of playing young Ryan Reynolds. Serious acting chops Scobell did an absolutely awesome job with Ryans delivery and mannerisms. Nice movie funny and it's great to see Jennifer Garner and Mark Ruffalo in a movie together again.We found the movie very entertaining and definitely recommend.Ryan Reynolds is great he could tell someone to
step off and it would still be funny.

title: Good Family Entertainment
text: I know we are all desensitised to violence. And my kids are old enough now to enjoy action without feeling the need to act it out on their school mates.It channeled plenty of good stuff from Guardians of the Galaxy to Back to the Future. Nothing not to like here. Thanks for the efforts in a time when we really have lost the plot on what entertainment is...

title: Project Boring
text: I am about done with Mr. Levy. Free Gy was complete trash and this title proves that Netflix only gets movies that studios passed on for major release.The premise of this film gets an A+, but the overall story, execution and passing all fail.Katie Keener is a horrible villain and should count her role in Get Out as a one off evel person. Ryan Reynolds is pretty funny, but he can't carry the film and the writing is actually downright awful. Walker turns in an impressive performance, but he can't carry the film either.Zoe is disposable and brought nothing to her role and I never believed her and Ryan were in a relationship and surprising, Ruffalo may have turned in the films strongest performance which should tell you what the caliber of this film really was.Shawn Levy is starting to remind me of. Simon Kinberg, someone that was once associated with quality titles until everyone realized it was a fluke and he was actually ruining franchises.This movie could have been so much more, should have been so much more, but in the end it came off like a VOD title with low budget VFX.The trailer was so good and the title doesn't come anywhere close to delivering on that promise. Wouldn't shock me if they make a sequel, but trust me when I tell you, this is nearly two hours of your life you'll never see again.

title: Unoriginal but still enjoyable
text: Family orientated light sci-fi where the cast are all great and have good chemistry. The film has a fun, enjoyable air and doesn't overstay its welcome or take itself very seriously.I enjoyed it but also felt it just lacked any level of true drama or believability. It felt like it was sleepwalking along even though the writing and acting was above what you get in most modern sci-fi films of this type. Just seemed to be lacking something (Originality and believability).

title: Rainy afternoon in fun ...
text: Well if you don't like the Ryan Reynolds brand of self deprecating fun, then don't bother, but he is very good at it.This is purely designed to entertain, not to be deep and meaningful, nor to provide revelation, so it needs to be be taken as such.It's a pretty solid 6.5, but for the added laughs provided by Reynolds sidekick, the young Walter Scobell, who works hard throughout, it gets the rounding up treatment.Family movie fun I guess.

title: Wholesome family entertainment
text: Easy watching wholesome family entertainment with a couple of great actors thrown into the mix! Not something I would say to family and friends 'you have to watch this.' But if you're flicking through movies unsure what to watch on Saturday afternoon...this isn't a bad option! Pretty enjoyable!

title: Loved it!
text: It's so awesome!!Cried thrice. Laughed a ton. Loved it. Didn't blink once!Fun story, Cool effects & Zero political crap!It doesn't try to be an all around movie with too many things to score, it focuses on story, with an old-school back to the future type time travel, doesn't take itself too seriously with the science, doesn't try to act like society's saviour etc.What it does, is stick with the characters, contrast their future and present/past versions, bring out the emotions in them.Loved the cast and how they portrayed their characters.The visual effects are noticeably awesome and aesthetically pleasing, its a refreshing take considering how Hollywood today takes itself too seriously and every movie has to have some sort of impact on society or whatever, this movie is a movie and it knows that, which makes it a good movie.For viewers who don't much care about the specifics of science, it keeps that to the absolute minimum, doesn't overcomplicate stuff so the story feels focused and fulfilling.All in all, great movie! Loved every second of it!💯

title: PAST MEETS FUTURE
text:
The Adam Project is a 2022 American sci-fi film directed by Shawn Levy and starring Adam Reynolds 🕰It's good 🙂
I'd recommend it if you like this genre 👍🏼PAST MEETS FUTURE.

title: For children/teenagers.
text: Not a proper film for adults. The dialog is just tiresome because of all the 'jokes' that are not actually jokes bust just unnatural conversation. If you want at least some connection with reality or with 'real' human behavior, skip it. I can swallow poor plot and sometimes even poor acting, but I'm just tired of movies that try to turn everything into a comedy.

title: Sheer Fun
text: A great escape and sheer fun. Critics of this movie just need to take a chill pill and get the frick over themselves. The young actor playinf young Adam does a star turn. If you could invest in an actor's stock going up, this kid has a bright future. Sit back, smile, and enjoy the movie.

title: If "Old Man" by Neil Young were a SciFi Movie...
text: Better than expected! It's a fun coming-of-age adventure with classic Ryan Reynold's quips, and fast-paced action scenes against an unscrupulous, but ultimately tame/manageable villain. You could do a lot worse than this film for a time-suck, especially considering Netflix's run of mediocre films recently......that being said my rating of 8 might be a slightly inflated 7, since I'm a sucker for any Sci-Fi Comedy, i.e. Galaxy Quest, Hitchhiker's Guide, Mars Attacks, the list goes on...

title: Easy to digest adventure flick won't test your brainpower
text: This is quite an enjoyable little movie despite the fact that it is ridden with clichés and tropes that you have seen in many other sci-fi movies. This movie was created to make money not as art or to make a statement. Nonetheless, it is a pleasant way to spend 105 odd minutes.Special effects are not blockbuster movie quality, but they are up to the job here. The script is fairly predictable but with enough interesting ideas percolating through to keep your intention. In fact, I felt some of these could have been developed more - e.g. Young Adam's relationship with the school bullies - but I guess that would have made for quite a long movie. The cast is mostly good. It's always a pleasure to see Mark Ruffalo in any movie. Zoe Saldana is here too because I think her contract says she has to be in every sci-fi movie that requires a female love interest. Jennifer Garner, who seems to be one of those ladies Hollywood calls on whenever they need someone to play a relatable mother character, is good as the mother. Ryan Reynolds plays, essentially, the same wise-cracking smart ass he plays in almost all of his movies. Catherine Keener is a fairly bland villain with Alex Millari Jr as her oriental (of course) henchman. The stand out in the cast is Walker Scobell as the young Adam. He acts well and steals the movie and I look forward to seeing him in future movies.I don't want to seem like I'm being too hard on this movie. It may not be anything remarkable, but I enjoyed it and so did the kids. If you're looking for something for your family movie night, you won't go wrong with this.

title: Another cheesy cliché
text: Personally, I wanted to like this movie, I thought it would be a cute, slightly predictable, enjoyable watch. Unfortunately this turned out to be a substandard, unwatchable dud. This film was centered around a man, Adam, who travels back in time and crash lands in the year 2022, he then teams up with his 12 year old self in a mission to save the future. While the plot of this film is in theory, an interesting idea, the dialogue fell flat. The movie's 'strong point' is built around the 12 year old version of Adam, who the entire movie is just doing a weak Ryan Reynolds impression. Reynolds then went on to bring in all his favorite cronies who turned in half-assed performances. In closing, I couldn't finish this film. Save yourself the time, and don't bother.

title: Forgettable but somewhat entertaining
text: Just another Ryan Reynolds movie with predictable plot. It's not a great movie but entertaining as long as you turn your brain off.Good cgi and cast. Too bad about the story.

title: When We Were Young
text: The Adam Project is a fun time-travel project. Targeted at the adolescence in us, the film is jam-packed with entertaining sci-fi action scenes - hell, it even borrows the lightsaber weapon from Star Wars -, lightweight dialogue and touchy-feely father-son interactions courtesy of Ryan Reynolds and Mark Ruffalo in top goofy form. Sit back, enjoy and don't think too hard....and expect Netflix to rack in billions of viewing minutes with this one.

title: The first Ryan Reynolds film I have ever enjoyed
text: Reynolds plays a man going back in time to meet his 12 year old self to fix a historical problem.Basic premise, but the storyline expands to be most enjoyable, reminiscent of an early Disney offering.Reynolds is an insufferable fool and yet in this film he manages to make his character appealing, despite himself.Scobell, who plays young Adam, despite his extremely limited filmography (ie: this is his first feature) is actually the acting epitome of Reynolds and you could easily mistake him for being the real son of Reynolds.Ruffalo was wasted on his part as his skills just weren't needed but the addition of him, Saldana and Keener did add to the film.SFX are great, the storyline is engaging and consistent, the pace is great and the directing spot on. Those ingredients bring us to a well defined, well baked film which I think the majority of people are going to really like, despite Reynolds being the star.There's hidden nods to many sci fi greats that have come before, see how many you can get!

title: lightweight but fun.
text: Produced by and starring ryan reynolds. Time travel. In 2050, ryan reynolds, playing adult adam (his name is no accident) goes back in time and meets up with young adam (walker scobell) getting into trouble in school. When they meet, young adam is just as wise-ass as adult adam. But adult adam didn't come back alone; there are soldiers from the future chasing after him. It looks like he'll need his dad's help (mark ruffalo) to put things right. It's a lightweight, feel good, time travel thing. Its pretty good. The ethics of changing the future. Or the past. Directed by shawn levy. He was nominated for arrival.

title: Less about Time Travel than just unadulterated entertainment
text: If you're a time travel fan like me, leave any expectations of mind blowing paradoxes at the door, sit back, and just enjoy the dialogue, witty banter, fine acting by veteran professionals and decent action sequences. Pay attention to the little Easter Eggs that are planted throughout the movie too. Every single actor has at least one or two, based on previous roles they're known for.Casting of the young Ryan Reynolds character was perfect, as he picks up Reynolds comic timing perfectly with his own scripted lines.I came away feeling satisfied and not disappointed that TT was not more integrated into the movie as a subject matter. Which is what I think the lower ratings people are leaving are about.

title: Family Friendly Ryan Reynolds
text: Ryan Reynolds may not be one of the finest actors like, say, a Tom Hanks. But, Reynolds has that something special when it comes to charisma and likeability. Plus he has that endearing smart-aleck thing that is rare indeed. Burt Reynolds practically invented it by the way. So, to me what makes this film watchable is Reynolds. I think I didn't particularly care for the actual story here yet concede it will be Sci-Fi that many younger folks will. In the end it's a good romp that is just family friendly enough to make a cut for that and it's just Ryan Reynolds enough for us older viewers. It wants to be warmer and fuzzier than it can actually achieve however. Pretty good CGI for a Netflix release I'd say so no problems there. The cast is excellent too. It might be 6.5 if I'm being generous. Personally I would like a more interesting story but it's entirely serviceable I guess.

title: Excellent movie!
text:
This is a great movie!! Action-packed, cute, funny, and so MEANINGFUL it may make you cry a bit. But then you'll happy laugh. Walker Scobell is excellent and who doesn't love Ryan Reynolds!😍 (love his acting)
This movie definitely makes you think about how you've treated people in your past, even how you've treated yourself, and... how you should treat people now. Because really there's never enough time.

title: Its sincere story results in one of Netflix's better original movies.
text: A surprisingly heartfelt film that shocked me with how well it made me care for each of its characters. I watched this movie with low expectations due to Netflix's disappointing track record of mediocre original movies. Each actor felt typecast into roles they had played before but still delivered meaningful performances. The effects and production were fairly typical of a Netflix project. But even though I can't say each specific part of The Adam Project was particularly remarkable, the sum of all its parts was fantastic! The writing mixed with the cast's solid performances just equals something great. The standout by far was Walker Scobell's excellent portrayal of young Ryan Reynolds.

title: That kid is good
text: Adam Reed, age 12, and still grieving the sudden death of his father a year earlier, walks into his garage one night to find a wounded pilot hiding there. This mysterious pilot turns out to be the time-travelling older version of himself from 2050. He has risked everything to come back in time on a secret mission. Together they must embark on an adventure into the past to find their father, set things right, and save the world.This, mostly original, film co-written and directed by the same person who directed Ryan Reynold's 2021 big hit (Free guy), Shawn Levy, is very fun and entertaining, especially that it's short and not slow-paced. The movie also had its pretty emotional parts scattered throughout. However, the ending was pretty expected to me yet not necessarily in the same way I thought it would end.Walker Scobel (who played younger Adam) did a really good job portraying a younger Ryan Reynolds, which shows that the casting team was great. His chemistry with Reynolds (who playes older Adam) is perfect as the interactions between the two are really good and quite funny. However, Reynolds, as always, performs really well but with a very similar character to all his other movies. Mark Rufallo's character (who plays Adam's father Louis Reed) reminds me of Bruce Wayne if he never was the Hulk. I would've liked to see a bit more of Zoe Saldana (who plays Laura, Adam's wife) and Jennifer Garner (who plays Adam's mother).The villain's story wasn't built-up perfectly as Maya Sorian (played by Catherine Keener) is a very basic and two dimensional character that you know nothing about and is just there so there would be a villian in the story.The script was pretty thin as the film is kind of forgettable and suffering from too much Ryan Reynolds, yet it is very funny.The fight and action scenes, although not found as much as I anticipated, where really good and very fun to watch. CGI was also great especially with the scenes with the futuristic soldiers and how they died. However, I would have really liked to see some more special effects as this is a sci-fi movie. Additionally, it contained some really beautiful natural scenes.The Adam Project is short Sci-Fi comedy, that of course has it's flaws, but if regarded as a movie made for young teens who wouldn't necessarily find those flaws, the movie would be considered a good one.Score: 7.5/10.

title: Good enough
text: It is basically a fun movie to watch. Cast is good, it has some good jokes and visuals are good so you are interested in watching. This movie will not get any oscar or don't over think about time travel. It is a good movie to watch after busy day or a good evening.

title: Cute story bad language
text: Why do the studios keep coming out with movies for kids and throw language in? The movie would have been awesome with out all the Jesus Christs, God Damnits, Ass, etc... I just don't get it. You make more if you make it for all. Story was good but the language was not cool. Parents be aware of what your kids are watching. It does make a difference.

title: A good example to mix science and love
