text: Though the start of the story is lack of imagination, the way to tell the story is pretty good. The plot is simple and smooth. The motivation of the story is love,and the science is the outfit. The show of the love is very suitable and the emotions moved me. It remindsmr my dad and mom,and also reminds me my dream of my childhood. The science isn't a joke either. If u r a physiology lover, u may find this. And also it can bring laugh. Some situations is really funny, so when u saw it, your emotion also experiences a great trip. What's more, I really love theAdam,include the elder and the smaller.Time waits for no man, love needs to be shown. Problems need to be solved and future is still in our hands.In my opinion, it's a good movie, especially when see it with families.

title: The BEST movie I've seen for awhile!
text: I can't see how anyone can give this movie anything but a 10 star review. Full on attention grabber through the entire movie. Action packed, exciting, touching, funny, sad...it has it all. It would be great if there was a sequel, but it didn't look like there will be. APPLAUD 👏 and thanks to all of you for giving me such great entertainment...I'll be telling everyone to watch it!

title: Cringe but entertaining
text: I honestly had no expectations of this movie. It's just good at production and special effects, but I'm not going to lie that the script is a copy of all the science fiction movies of time travel.I have to say that the interaction of the Adams from the past and the future is very awkward and it just sounds like there is something wrong.6 stars ,no more or less .

title: IMDB 7.2 very optimistic
text: Not too bad a film with a very intense Ryan Reynolds, just like all his roles, he acts the same.Any film that introduces time travel has to play it very very well or it's rubbish, this is boarding on rubbish....

title: Finally another good movie
text: They still exist: the simply good films. Without stupid, politically correct drivel, without morally insane monologues... lately, thanks to Ryan Raynolds, Netflix finally knows how to deliver good films again that are neither shallow nor empty of meaning.The story? Not that important, it's been seen before in a similar form. But there is finally an entertaining film here again, in which there are no annoying children, no nagging women, no whining teens, no vulgar sex.And last but not least: finally science fiction again.Thanks, Ryan. More of this, please.

title: Everyone's a Superhero
text: Deadpool/Gambit/Green Lanter goes back in time to find his wife, Gamora and finds his younger self, his mom, Elektra and his dad, the Hulk. All the while evading the scary psychiatrist from Get Out who painted Kramer and tried to sell all of the. 40-Year-Old Virginia vintage collectibles.

title: Don't expect too much
text: I saw a preview a while back and it looked interesting, however it doesn't really fall into the sci-fi genre or action. If we remove the time travel element this is a drama.Ryan is his usual comedic self and it's ok for a while, but gets tiring. This is not really the background for one liners and comebacks from him or the 12yo kid. It's still an alright watch, but maybe this is more of a family movie. In that case, they should have removed the implied sex scene or toned it down a bit.Nothing out of the ordinary happens, nearly 100% predictable from the outset and everything happens too easy. The previews make it look better than it is.

title: A lot of action
text: I mean this movie just came out and it turned out to be a good one heck there's a lot of action but as we all know we can't change the past like they say altering the future can lead to some serious consequences.

title: Interesting Concept
text: Enjoyed most of the film, but some scenes were not very believable, even if you accept that the events are believable. The issues Adam deliberates about his former and future selves are interesting.

title: Nice movie
text: I like the movie.Time travel is becoming more and more a thing.So I like the story and Ryan Reynolds is just fantastic as always.There is not much that I can complain. Probably at the beginning a little more backstory would have made the side characters and the villain more clear. What are the motives of the villain. In what kind of prospect is the world ending. At the beginning it is really unclear to me what had happened. Maybe I need to rewatch that.Some scenes just remind me of Star Wars - maybe sometimes too much.On the positive side, the movie is not that long so you can watch it in under 2 hours.

title: This Was Fun
text:
3-11-2022:
So far this film has 65 reviews not counting mine.So less then 100 reviews, and a bunch of people did not like ot for the story, production quality, writing, director or whatever.....
If you pay attention to the movie outside of the things people decide to dislike;
This film does a wonderful job of writing an underlying purposeful proposal which is:
Time Travel is developed realistically, For Realistic Ideas, Realistic Purposes. Outside of strictly discovering wormholes to transport people/things. Outside of watching a "time travel film from 30 years ago" which kept trying to say Time Travel will automatically be used for unrealistic endeavors by the human beings.Ultimately Humans Rip Each Other Apart Once The Reality of Time Travel is within grasp: Which Is Also An Open Nod To How People Do Work In This Life!I guess perspective is everything. So if all you want as a consumer/audience of this movie,
is to demand a perfectly written, directed, acted, worded story for only entertainment value (which there is no such thing in any form of story telling anyway) : Go Right Ahead and only see the small window.The bigger framed picture: for those who took the film and face value then noticed it too; this story is looking at time travel as a realistic way for people to come together and rebuild together.In theory one day we all may just have the selflessness to actively value the nuances in story telling.

title: A lot of fun filled with heart
text: This movie is pretty good. Ryan reynolds acting was good and dialogue was fine. It has its problems though like Adams father automatically knowing older adam was his son or the chessy fart jokes. I really liked this film it was a refresher from the bad movies made today. Im hoping some writers or directors take inspiration from this and try and make good films too.7.3/10-good.

title: Predictable and boring.
text: Like most other bigger Netflix productions, this feels rushed.It's always the same and won't get better because you add some famous actors to the cast...

title: Finally, the BIG question answered: Time Travel with Multiple Missions
text: I am guessing the standard time travel movie 'cliche', has been : "You can not talk to yourself", is simply that no one thought it could be so funny and so serious at the same time.The old "Don't take yourself so damn serious!" Finally paid off and I got to see a great movie.Laughed a lot and got choked up once or twice and laughed a bunch more.

title: More mindless Netflix trash.
text: Don't waste your time. This "movie" is trash. Feels so thrown together and relies heavily on Ryan Reynolds quips which have become beyond stale. I loved the dude as early as the 90's but his whole schtick has become so tiresome...it's the same gags over and over and over. Snarky sitcom humor and dialogue. Nonsensical plot. Plus there's loads of CGI and overly choreographed fight scenes where bad guys comically attack one at a time. Looks way more like dancing than anything resembling fighting.

title: Okay
text: Overall enjoyable movie to watch once. There were some predictable plotlines, however (especially towards the end), and I found the way Adam's young version was written a bit unrealistic for a 12 year old child. I'm starting to feel like every movie Ryan Raynolds is in, he just plays himself, rather than the characters, making the movies/characters a bit repetitive. But the fact, that I like Ryan Raynolds, definitely helps. I probably wouldn't watch The Adam Project again, but I'm not mad I saw it.

title: Liked it.
text: As for the sci-fi, time-travel plots go, "The Adam Project" is actually solid one.The direction is fun and energized. With some great soundtracks added. The action sequences are exciting and entertaining. Ryan Reynolds is great with the role. Walker Scobell is also good. Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner are good. Zoe Saldana is good for her small part. Catherine Keener does feel a little out of place with her villain role.Overall, movie was fun to me. This is a good sci-fi flick that's got action, humor and heart mixed in and features a great cast.

title: I know its Ryan Reynolds again. But, come on guys. It wasnt that bad
text: People seem pretty upset about film that only bring the presence of main actor. Like this one.Me personally really like the story of this movie. The script has pretty solid fun in it at least. The ultimate duo clearly steal the show. It showed some good family value too, although it got a little top much. But its goodExpect from the connection between grown up Adam and his wife, i pretty much have no complain.

title: Darn Right Good
text: Ryan Reynolds is a awesome actor plays multiple roles good for action, comedy, suspense but he really smash the little red button on this film.The story line is unbelievably great and action is non-stop.

title: I made it to the end...
text: ... Because I was scrolling through my phone through most of it. The emotional parts had no effect on me. There was something off about how Jennifer Garner delivered her lines. I'm not a fan of Ryan Reynolds humor (bullet hole farting is supposed to be funny?) The action was pew pew pew. Nothing new or special. I sort of liked how the villain was killed, though. Maybe I'd have enjoyed this if I was the same age as the young character.

title: Absolutely awesome
text: Fantastic story, awesome graphics and special effects and a superb storyline. This movie made me laugh, cry and put me on the edge of my seat. What else do you want in a movie.

title: Good fun
text: One thing that this movie does well among entertain the whole time travel theory is it's use of a occasional Rock or classic pop piece of retro band music circa 1970's /80's, keep this is up and just maybe the music of this current generation 2022 will finally reboot that great Rock/pop music of our past for the future.Enjoyed it.

title: Panders to the dumb.
text: It just didn't do anything for me. It wasn't funny enough to be a comedy, wasn't emotional enough to tug at my heartstrings, and there was nothing fresh or innovative about the action sequences. No one really learned anything in the end, so there was no substance to it. I think this is well-suited for people who want movies to be like amusement park rides rather than good stories that help us understand the human experience. The thing is, good action movies can do both, but this does neither.

title: Ryan Reynolds is a gem.
text: This is a step in the right direction for modern movies. It's a blast from the past (literally) which feels nostalgic for the 90s and early 2000s where films have heart and soul and don't yell down at you.Acting is fantastic I love all the characters and of course Ryan Reynolds with his ad-lib is always great. The actress who plays Gamora in Guardians is also cool and sweet as always.The only downside is the deep-faking stuff is a dead giveaway of shotty cgi. I'm not a fan of it because once they start resurrecting deceased actors it becomes immoral and ruins the joy they gave us. Just a personal gripe.

title: Thoroughly entertaining
text: Well Android dumped my review before I saved it so bottom line very enjoyable movie, lots of heart, excellent cast, most of the comedy lands well, some tear jerking moments, jet fighter sequences get tedious, but Sean Levy knows how to direct human beings and pull the most out of the script.

title: Childish script but entertaining
text:
Very lame scenarios and dialogues. Nothing makes sense in this movie, the supposed science, the fact there's no one in the streets lol...
but at least it's entertaining...

title: Pretty good!
text: My favorite thing about this movie was the acting of «young adam» his imitation of Ryan Reynolds and his acting was close to perfect!Tons of funny moments and lines and the movie made me audibly laugh more than once. The plot wasnt something i was too exited of before I started watching cause im not normally into stuff like that, but this movie made it good!It was some stuff that was a little messy, and some parts were slowburn, but overall i enjoyed watching, and i would probably reccomend it to some friends.7/10 fun movie!

title: The kind of movie everyone needs once in awhile
text: The Adam Project I will say is probably one of my favorite Netflix films to ever hit their platform. This film is full of action sequences, comedy, drama, and most of all, full of heart. It's the kind of film that doesn't come around often and it's also a type of film that everyone needs every now and again. Ryan Reynolds is fantastic as always as the lead character Adam Reed who travels back in time to stop time travel from ever being invented. Along the way he encounters his younger self played by Walker Scobell who actually captures all of Ryan Reynolds character mannerisms like clockwork and is one of my favorite characters of the movie. Zoe Saldana plays Lauren Shade who is Adam Reed's wife and although she may have not had as much screen time as I hoped for, the chemistry between her and Ryan Reynolds was captured perfectly and made me want more of the two. Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner are also fantastic as the parents of Adam, as Louis and Ellie Reed. I wished we had gotten a little more screen time with these two characters together as well. Catherine Keener as the villain Maya Sorian I thought was a great choice, because it has been awhile since we've seen her in anything and after watching her performance as a villain in Get Out, playing a villain never gets old with her playing the character. Overall, The Adam Project is visually stunning, exciting, entertaining, funny at times and most of all full of heart that is enjoyable for all audiences alike. Rating 9/10.

title: Very Ryan Reynolds
text: I watched this for Ryan Reynolds and knowing what to expect from his movies. It was very enjoyable; laughter, action, and some tears. Star Wars meets Deadpool meets Guardians Of The Galaxy meets Back To The Future. Standout performance by the adorable kid who played young Adam. Excellent job emulating Ryan Reynolds! That's a huge compliment coming from me . Hulk as Deadpool's father was interesting.

title: Predictably Boring
text: Watching this you can't help but feel like there's nothing new here. All these plots have been played out before. This probably would've been a good film in the late 80s. Today it just feels washed up.

title: Decent for Netflix
text: A really solid and entertaining original action film for Netflix. It was relatively well done with some good effects and action scenes. The downfall is Ryan Reynolds literally acting the same as he does in every single movie he's in. Also, this film felt like it was already done before.

title: Fun!
text: It's a Ryan Reynolds movie what's not to love...funny in moments feel good movie. Yeah Def don't look for logic in a time travel flick. Sit back relax and enjoy 😉

title: Outstanding family SF movie~!!
text: A kind of time-travel movie, which is a very complicated story line to be managed well, even with Ryan's on-and-off gag. But it makes me miss my mom and dad. Good enough to watch~!

title: Fun!
text: Fun...Nothing more, nothing less!In other words, the movie is well established, and some of the questions of the plot remain unanswered, as the screenplay seems to be pretty straightforward to it's goofy and big motivations.Still, the movie is fun... a cozy and sweet story, with good emotional appeal to the audience.I had fun.

title: A movie time travelled from good old days
text: It's hard to believe it's by Netflix.It's good to know that someone out there can still make good movies with good stories without all the unpopular trendings forced on us nowadays, It's a also a good comedy and without may be 3 minutes of the movie it could have been a family one.

title: Good teaching
text: An excellent film in which you value more your day-to-day life with your family. Science fiction and quantum physics a bit difficult to understand. Action, emotional and good humor.

title: Honestly I couldn't tell what I was watching
text: Was it Deadpool? 13 Going on 30? The Hulk? Stranger Things? Green Lantern? Back to the Future? This is Us? The Last Jedi?I don't know, and I don't care.What a total mess.

title: Scify Ryan fun
text: While not original, this is quite fun and entertaining. As all time travel movies, do not think too much about the repercussion that can occur. It is not broken, but still. Ryan Reynold plays Ryan Renolds, aka, the cool funny dude who can turn any situation, no matter how desperates into a sassy joke. The movie rely a bit much around the charisma of the character and it shows. Put any other actor in the role and the movie is just a crappy scify non sense. The sole purpose of the kid, aside for a few cutes moments, is for the exposition. He doesnt know anything and ask a lot of question, so the audience can follow up the plot. Over used trope very much appreciated in this convoluted plot. As I said, not original, but entertaining enough to keep watching. Turn you brain off, heat up some popcorn and enjoy.

title: Double the Reynolds with double the feelings
text: This is a Sci-Fi film where Reynolds travels back in time, bumping into his twelve year old self, and confronts his feelings of growing up without a father - oh yeah there is some laser guns and stuff too.If you don't like Ryan Reynolds you will not like this - a lot of the movie is Reynolds dealing with his feelings of loss, and reconnecting with his younger self.The comedy comes from Reynolds witty batter with his child counterpart which works pretty well.The acting and production are all great and it was pretty entertaining.The sci-fi elements are pretty much irrelevant and are only an excuse to use some CGI and break up the emotional scenes.The combat scenes are very dull and predictable.In fact the whole movie is so by-the-numbers you can easily guess the next scene.The male and female leads take turns saving each other, the bad guys wear armour that does nothing but does mean you don't feel sad when they get murdered, the villains talk the talk but never come close to delivering.The story wraps up in its inevitable conclusion but by then I was already on my phone.A solid enough Netflix movie that has some really nice emotional scenes but is already fading from my memory.

title: Just Bad
text: I can't remember the last time i have ended a movie after 30 minutes. Bad acting and a really confusing storyline. Ryan Reynolds has some funny moments here and there but all in all, it is really bad. Save your time!

title: At least it's not "woke"
text: Yeah, the main character is a black woman, but she's one of the best actresses, and I think she did an excellent job here. The movie wasn't as funny as it was expected (for a Ryan Reynolds' movie), but it was not cringe too. I'll never watch it again, but I'd recommend it.

title: An easily digestible fun wholesome time.
text: The Adam Project (2022) is another outing from the director-actor duo Shawn Levy and Ryan Reynolds, who gave us Free Guy last year, a movie I loved. With the premise being that in the future time travel exists and a fighter pilot goes back in time to team up with his younger self to save the future, I had to give this a try. While not on the same level of enjoyment as Free Guy, this one turned out to be another success for the duo. Interestingly, while looking at the director's filmography before putting down my thoughts about this movie, I had no idea I have watched several of the films he directed and pretty much all of them were enjoyable to some extent with my favourites being Real Steel (2015) and Night at the Museum (2006). The dude might not be making masterpieces but he sure has consistency for a good time from my experience.Anyway, the style and tone of the movie pay homage to the 80s sci-fi or fantasy family films or Spielbergian feel, without actually taking place in the 80s. I'm a fan of that era so I was hooked pretty much from the start. The action, the SciFi stuff, the production quality, it's all decent. CGI can be a bit wonky at times but it wasn't inconsistent to the point that it was annoying a lot of times save for one thing that I'll mention later on.The strongest point about the movie is what it had to nail in order for the experience to work i.e the relationship between Ryan Reynold's character Adam and his younger self, acted wonderfully by Walker Scobell. The kid rocked, I loved him and he genuinely felt like a young Ryan Reynolds and the banter between him and his older self was hilarious and endearing. I also enjoyed the aspect of connecting to your younger self as one grows old instead of forgetting it, the idea that one should keep the inner child so that one doesn't grow cold and heartless after being drenched in responsibilities as an adult, which just happens to be one of the core messages of one of my favourite books i.e The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupery.Ryan Reynolds himself was good in the role and he sold it well as a person who has unresolved issues from his past, particularly with his father. The movie, in general, surprised me with the performances. Even if certain actors didn't have a lot of screentime, they utilized that time effectively instead of phoning it in for an easy paycheck, whether it was Jennifer Garner or Zoe Saldana or Mark Ruffalo. Certainly a strong emphasis on the emotional side of things which I appreciated given the story of the movie.The weakest aspect that brought the movie down a notch or two was the villain and the final act. Catherine Keener wasn't bad in the role but she wasn't given a lot to work with. She also had a younger self who was poorly de-aged and that was distracting every time she was onscreen. The finale felt rushed and lazily written relative to the rest of the movie as if they wanted to get it over with and go to the ending and the wholesome message. Ironically, it would have made the catharsis better had there been more stakes and tension in the final struggle.Overall, despite its faults, I had a good time with this movie. It won't blow your mind, it is not groundbreaking, but it is an easily digestible fun wholesome time and if you're looking for something like that, give it a try. It's on Netflix too. And if I were to rate it, I'd give it a 7/10.

title: Good fun
text: Although it had some plot holes it is still a good watch on Sunday evening.Ryan Raynolds is basically playing the same type of role in all of his films but it is still funny over and over again.All together no masterpiece but very ok.

title: handsome little boy
text: The little boy was good acting. It must have been his first movie shooting for a little kid, but his emotional acting and facial expressions that give laughter and fun are amazing. If the genre of this movie was not sci-fi or comedy, but family and drama, the tears acting would have been great. It was such a fun movie, and if there is a second movie that will later accumulate in filmography, I will watch it with great anticipation. I look forward to it. Always be healthy.

title: not a family friendly movie, but fun
text: Wow, serious misstep on the 1000 cuss words. Otherwise, the kids would love it. Lots of Star Wars stuff. Wife and I liked it. Not sure why they pushed the language but ridiculous. Hate when they have 6th graders using the F-word. Also, the science was silly. The magnet grabbed the bullets but not the gun? There was a lot of metal in the room that was not impacted. The chase scene was so silly it made us laugh - implausible. Overall a fun ride if you can get past the unrealistic language and poor science. Good sci-fi for adults.

title: Thank god im not the only disliking this i thought i was crazy.
text: First off with positives, Ryan and the kid did a good job, the effects are what they could be for a scifi movie but everything else is literally made for children, if i was 6 years old this would be my favorite because i would have no idea about time travel concept or what it meantOther time travel movies did much better jobs long ago. Looper, BTTF. Predestination. This doesn't even come close.And those who are praising it probably watched it while they were drunk or their GF liked and dont want to confront her.

title: Great concept but why. THE CUSSING !!!
text: You all have kids watching this movie. Why in the world out of all the cuss words you have to use GD and JC ? Do you think for one second what you're putting into a child's mind, or even Antoine's mind? If you feel the need to put some cussing into a movie because you're lacking better words, how about leaving out God's name.?

title: Back to the past or......
text: After all, I have seen this movie, but the wait was made by this movie, it did not live up to it, till the interval the story was very light, it seemed that the story after the interval Will catch on, but did not enjoy, action is also less, I think Robert zemeckis write this story was very superhit.

title: Lost a point for bad language
text: Good flick. ET meets LOOPER. The cussing was very unnecessary and unrelenting. Could have been a family thing but wow. GD about 20 times, JC about 10 times. S word ... A-hole .. and on and on. Lots of stars. Good plot. Good special effects. Fun.

title: Another enjoyable Ryan Reynolds movie.
text: Been a Ryan Reynolds fan is what made me check this movie out, and like a typical Ryan Reynolds movie it was enjoyable, fun and had the comedy aspect that Ryan Reynolds brings to most of his movies. I really liked the aspect of this movie, even though it's a big cliche and overused, time travel in movies never gets old for me. I do think the antagonist of the movie wasn't really good, she didn't bring much to movie anyway to be honest, and I believe without her the movie wouldn't lacked. I would definitely recommend this especially if you're a fan of Ryan Reynolds or not f you want to enjoy a comedic family movie.

title: Sappy... Cliché but Sincere
text: Worth a watch but won't win any awards. Ryan Reynolds is very much himself and that's worth points. Concept is interesting but I felt like I know what was going to happen at every turn. Fun overall. 7/10.

title: I'm really moved!!
text: This movie has done the emotional part very right. The scenes between Ryan's younger self, with his mother and father, all of them were truly magical. I think people from all over the world will be able to connect with the movie. Getting this thing right is big task in itself, but Shawn has been able to make the movie so accessible, that we don't need to think over twice to what is really going on? And that is an achievement in itself.

title: IT WAS OK.
text: It's ok, the kid that plays a young Ryan Reynolds character does an excellent job of capturing Reynolds's sarcastic personality. Could have used more back story about the main character in his timeline. Without it the story gets murky and has no anchor.

title: Good Times Bad Times
text: When I heard the first two chords of Led Zeppelin's first album, I knew this movie was really just Ryan Reynolds doing his patented "Ryan Reynolds" routine with some single mom bait. I laughed so hard at the other one star reviews that I had to write my own. It's definitely not a comedy tho. It's soft porn at it's worst. Definitely wouldn't watch it again. I swear these videos are what makes people cut themselves...

title: I actually really liked this
text: Good crew and solid acting, interesting storyline and very touching. It got me, and to be honest, I was sobbing by the end and I cannot remember the last time a movie made me cry so much lol. I loved Zoe Saldaña.

title: Disrespectful
text: This looked like a really great movie and I was all settled in ready to enjoy it. However, I only made it thirty minutes into the show. There was just too much use of the Lord's name in a derogatory manner. It shows a total lack of respect for the Lord in general.

title: A Fun Intended Sci-fi Drama
text: I'm gonna smoke your banana, mother.... Noooo we are not allowed to say that.Hey everyone, it's time to travel back in time with Netflix's new sci-fi drama The Adam Project. A mood relaxing fun film starring Ryan Reynolds and child actor Walker Scobel in lead roles with Mark Ruffalo, Zoe Saldana, and Jennifer Garner in supporting roles.A consistently entertaining film that makes you laugh numerous times throughout its runtime. Director Shawn Levy gives us a well-balanced film by keeping the main focus on human relationships & emotions and, mixing it smartly with occasional adventures and actions sequences. Even though the basic plot of the film isn't innovative and the sci-fi elements are pretty much traditional but the way this film explains the time travel concept is genuinely interesting. The visual effects are fantastic.Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobel who gives Reynolds a tough competition with his charismatic performance, are the key strength of this film. From start to end they keep us entertained with their laugh-a-minute kinda conversations.Want to enjoy a good fun movie on the weekend with friends and family? Fetch a bucket of popcorn, call some of your friends and enjoy this film.7.2/10Follow us on Instagram: m_movie_reviews.

title: Perfect pizza movie night film
text: Sci-fi, action, drama, comedy, this movie has it all. And it will make you think. And feel all the emotions. With great acting and a beautiful score. Nothing else to say, really. Go watch it, you won't be disappointed.

title: Another anti-science science fiction
text: What's with the nonsense claim that there are things "man" just shouldn't know? It is a dumb and lazy plot device.And apparently electromagnets are selective about the objects they attract, and when. Who knew?The inserted music is inappropriate, and Reynolds doesn't bother playing any character but Reynolds, but here is some genuine humour.Ok to watch once.

title: More sentiment and less of "saving world"
text:
RATED 7/10
Language: English
Source: NetflixOne time watchable sci-fi sentiment drama. There are very few characters in the movie and they are taking about saving the world. Because of few characters, it is filled with sentiments and looks like small scale budget movie... It could have better it lot other ways...
Still one time watchable as it is not boring except the second half family reunion scenes....

title: Time travel movie with good twist but mid story
text: This movie had a very interesting twist than some other time traveling movies. It combined aspects from the terminator, back to the future and other movies. Yet half way through this movie I was very impressed thought it would be something different, but sadly by the end it just came together in a movie that wasn't very good.On the other hand Ryan Reynolds did a great job acting, he again plays the funny witty guys as usual but did surprised me when he had the ability to get emotional. Same with Zoe Saldaña, as I did know she was already a good actor when needed. She was able to convince me that she was hurt and emotional. Also the fight scenes in this movie were pretty solid and well choreographed.In conclusion, this movie like many others with a cool concept had a good begginging but in the end could have a good enough ending to finish the story. Ryan Reynolds surprised me with his acting in this movie and the fight scenes were well choreographed.

title: Feel good movie
text: Enjoyed it.. Comedy, emotions, Sci-fi and action. Hey it's Ryan Reynolds.. Didn't go in expecting some Oscar type movie but this surprisingly touched some emotional buttons and brought out some laughs. Really enjoyed it and will definitely be seeing again and again.

title: Ok
text: This was a nice surprise. Good action and story. Weak on the special effects towards the end but still enjoyable. Weak villains. Not the sort of movie that will stand the test of time but yeah.

title: Sucks big time!
text: I cannot believe someone actually put money in this "project"! Lamest, most superficial film I have seen in a while. An embarrassment to the movie industry. A host of video games, props, idiotic dialogues, and gadgets, without a story. I would have given it a ZERO but, well, they did try...

title: What a great movie
text: I love this movie. It's funny, sweet and a great movie for the whole family. Ryan Reynolds is super funny, as always.. I'd definitely watch it again!!!!

title: Great ending
text: I must admit for the first 10 minutes I almost turned it off but it got better and I love a happy ending. Gosh I love any ending that makes sense and wraps everything up properly, and this does. Please I hope there's no sequel it doesn't need one, it's perfectly well rounded. Not to deep but well meaning fun and common sense.

title: Bored
text: Probably OK If your doing something else while watching.Found it to be boring not original. I thought I was losing brain cells. This is accelerating the process....

title: Rewarding if you're willing to sit through the action cliches
text: Time-travelling fighter pilot Ryan Reynolds crash-lands in 2022 and must get help from his 12-year-old self (Walker Scobell) in order to resume and complete a complex mission. Alternate timestreams, super-villainous antagonists, and video-game-ish dogfights ensue - none of which ever feel relevant or spirited. They're just there to fulfill genre conventions without copying previous entries all too blatantly. Back to the Future this is not. But if you're willing to sit through the action cliches, The Adam Project rewards you with some fine interpersonal drama between the young and grown-up Adam, their mother (Jennifer Garner) and their deceased dad (Mark Ruffalo). Young Walker Scobell is a gem, he's like an adolescent version of Reynolds, and the quips and banter between them are just as funny as the affection they share is heartfelt.

title: Fun but Formulaic
text: This movie was fairly enjoyable film for someone who's bored and doesn't know what else to watch. The chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and the younger boy was the best part of the movie. This movie plays a lot with time travel, which is a concept I'm somewhat tired of seeing in movies. Each movie with time travel rewrites the rules of how time travel works that's most convenient for the plot. It's gotten to a point where I just accept the ways time travel works for these movies instead of trying to understand it. Other than that, it has some decent action and laughs, fairly solid story, and some good acting and chemistry.

title: Oscar worthy lol
text: At least it has the right politically correct cast to get nominated for an Oscar 😐.It has its good moments but it's like really really. Trying to hard for.

title: Non-stop Fun.
text: Ryan Reynold is slowly becoming my favorite hero (well, one of my several favorite heros).Despite the presence of. Mark Ruffalo (in an extended cameo), Ryan manages to steel our attention to the hilt. Especially, the yourger version of him (Walker Scobell) is so adorable.Catherine Keener (as. Maya Soriyan) the arch villain? The director should have selected someone with more subsance and charisma, like. Samuel L Jackson? We could have had a better blast !!Joe Seldana (as Laura) and Jennifer Garner (as Ellie) manage their roles well within the time slots given.It is very funny to watch the present you witnessing the scene where the future you kissing your (now) deceased wife !!Despite the Science laced subject (Time Travel), the director (Shawn Levy) concentrated more on the story and enjoyable scenes, the subject becomes secondary.Very limited and judicial use of Special effects (CGI / Deepfake etc) make the movie more enjoyable.Have a blast. Enjoy this fun filled movie.

title: I love this movie
text: This movie is so fun and enjoyable and I love this kind movies as well and I like make the technology and When making this Sci Fi is so fantastic. I like how they time travel from one place to another.

title: Good One Time Watch
text: There is nothing new but still this movie is good one time watch. Good scenes, visuals, action, Plus Ryan Reynolds and his younger self. This movie take inspiration from MCU, Star Wars, Back to the Future and few other popular movie franchises. Overall it is a good entertaining movie.

title: Mediocre time travel movie
text: A mediocre time travel movie, and that's being generous. The dialogue was cringe and the jokes unfunny. I was unable to finish this movie. Ryan Reynolds is funny as always and Zoe Saldana is beautiful as always. Great casting overall, but subpar writing.

title: Great time-travel movie
text: The storyline is very familiar with other time-travel movies as we all know you should not change anything in the past. Ryan Reynolds is funny and play the role great. Recommended for a family movie night.

title: This could have been so much more.
text: Cool concept, but the movie didn't cash in on all the opportunities of the story, or budget. This could have been so much more. All that said, if you have Netflix already, it's worth a watch on a quiet weekend.

title: In Netflix nails are hammered again by microscopes...
text: The script does not even pull on a teenage level. Poor children are driven into the Middle Ages by science.Actors try (money pays them). But it's all useless, even against the backdrop of some pretty decent fragmentary dialogue. The film itself is empty and worthless. The clip thinking of new generations is again involved. Sadly. And for these children, who are being told this, to build a "bright future" ...

title: Fun family movie that addresses important themes of grieving loss.
text: Great Ryan Reynolds flick appropriate for kids. Is the SciFi predicatable? Yes. But what was more touching for me was the scripting around grief and loss. The anger, the sadness, love, acceptance. This was a film about loss and acceptance. Lots of one liners (whether funny or poignant) that expressed something once learned in therapy. I was glad my kids watched it. They loved it for the jokes and action, but also, they absorbed some good lessons. I did too. You don't have to have it all together. You just need to be there. Kids need to know it's ok to be imperfect. And then Mark Ruffalo's conversation with his boys at the end. Wow. He nailed it. To have a parent say it like that. Great writing. On point delivery.

title: Alright Time Travel movie
text: The Adam Project is a movie about time travel with Ryan Reynolds at the center. It has plenty of action like many other Ryan Reynolds movies.A few of the cast members you could recognize from various marvel projects, which includes: Ryan Reynolds as Deadpool in the Deadpool movies, Mark Buffalo as Bruce Banner/Hulk in the MCU since the first Avengers movie (2012 Avengers, Age of Ultron, Thor Ragnarok, Avengers Infinity War, Avengers Endgame, and She-Hulk), Zoe Saldana as Gamora in the MCU (the Guardians of the Galaxy trilogy, and the last 2 Avengers movies, Infinity War and Endgame), and Jennifer Gardner in Ben Affleck's Daredevil franchise.It is similar to Back to the Future but different in many ways. It does have the premise to go back in time and what happens to you in the past affects the present. The big difference is how time travel works. Another difference is the whole "don't interact with your past self" don't really exist in this movie.

title: Not anymore I found you
text:
Last part is the best part
Love it, love the dialogue, love the sense of humor, I am lost - not anymore I found you
Come on man love it.This is how love starts.

title: Awesome
text: Solid fun, awesome to see with friends or family or your significant other. Has few touchy scenes, brings happy emotions afterwards. Would happily watch it again.

title: Quite the surprise
text: This film was more fun than it had any right to be!I won't go into all the details, you have a synopsis for that.It's a proper nostalgia baiter though, tapping into the likes of Star Wars and Back to the Future etc.. The effects were brilliant, it was a great little time travel story that didn't get too deep and up its own a$$. Reynolds was, of course, his typical self with some cracking one liners. Young Adam wasn't an annoying brat!Yeah, I really, really liked it and will give it a second watch with my son.Switch your brain off fun, no obvious preachy political agenda, just a well made, well paced action/sci-fi/comedy that doesn't need over analysing!

title: Intersting premise!
text: I must say that all in all I thouroughly enjoyed this movie. There are way more good bits then there are bad ones, and towards the end there were quite a few REALLY good bits that made me completely sold on the experience as a whole.This is a time travel movie, a pretty decent one at that, because of the base premise it presents. They could've done a way better job with this though as they are a little too caught up in unorthodox ways to display the future tech (atleast imo). Also the Star Wars fan servicing is to a point which I found it was starting to get seriously annoying. Since the weapons copied over wouldn't be weapons of choice if this were actually a true to life story.The movie tries its best to be an emotional home run but gets to this way to early at the start. A character we are just introduced to goes through something very dramatic, and they play it up like we are supposed to be sad about this although we know nothing about the person in question.Other oddball scenechoices makes the minds behind this movie look rather scatterbrained, atleast to me. However I guess in a way it adds to the "charm" if you could even call it that. I think the movie would've done better without any of this charm though. Or atleast it could've done without the bigger part of it.All in all this is a weak 8 for me. Was considering leaving a seven and calling it a strong seven, however I feel as if though this deserves a boost in rating from it's current one, and I have no issues in putting this into the weak 8 category.Watched and enjoyed.

title: Masterful Exposition Machine for Obvious Story
text: Remember to take the time to appreciate those around you, that's how you will feel when you finish The Adam Project.A story of a home, broken by a lack of openness between family members that has a soul warming ending.Exposition is masterfully woven into the story with obvious background actions, although sometimes paying off a little too quickly. You will learn to care about the characters softly and willingly as they go on their adventure to save the future and their family.The action is hit and miss, but every scene is beautiful and fun.Highly recommended.

title: Boring ASF
text:
Felt like I was watching timecop with "predestination movie twist.The plot just gets worse & worse, worse like the CGI & fake forsets,
The green screen is a total letdown., if only they cast Ryan Reynolds on a give us some acting on tiktok.I just wish he jumped intime earlier than waste an hour of precious time.

title: Pretty good but Limited vocabulary
text: Good story line and really good graphics. Not sure if its a Netflix requirement of personal preference but rare scenes without Ryan taking the Lords name in vane.

title: The Recycle Project
text: It's a cute little flick to watch with kids if you have any. Great cast, but predictably Ryan Reynolds plot and dialog. Tired and unoriginal, as are casting Mark Ruffalo to play a nerdy genius, and Zoe Saldana to play a tough space chick who can shoot guns and put up a fight, and well... Jennifer Garner in any role, ever.... Right, they also borrowed a Reynolds version of the kid from Iron Man 3.

title: Ryan Reynolds being himself
text: The longevity of Ryan's career must be partly be attributed to his personally. When Ryan plays a role it means that he will add something of himself to it. And that always comes through. In that regards he will remind some of Johnny Depp (from an acting kind of view).This flick has him double down and go all in with the Ryan quirky jokes and puns. The film is mainly targeted at a 9-15 age imo but there is some slight profanity slurs thrown in there. The villains are not as well flashed out and their performance fall a bit flat. ButIt's an enjoyable watch, probably a bit forgetful in regards to plot etc.

title: It's entertainment, and a fun one at that, NOT a study in Quantum Mechanics
text: I enjoyed it! The chemistry between the actors, especially the 2 Adams, and the chemistry between the two Adams and their dad was great! Catherine Keener wasn't the best choice for a villain, IMO. The rest of the leads were fun to watch. With the exception to younger Catherine looking a little suspect, no real complaints about the use of CGI. The cast already clued in that's it's just a sci-fi comedy with heart. And we all know that! Except maybe the whines and complaints on this board about the science of time travel. SHEESH! I hate to be the one to break it to them that time travel doesn't really exist, and everything in movies is purely fantasy for entertainment. For those who already know that, and haven't watched this yet, it's 90 mins of chuckles and heartwarming, and action sequences thrown in for good measure. Liked the shout out to the late Stephen Hawking! 7.6 out of 10.

title: Solid Film
text: A solid sci fi. Not sure why I need to give up to 150 characters but here you go. A solid sci fi. Not sure why I need to give up to 150 characters but here you go. A solid sci fi. Not sure why I need to give up to 150 characters but here you go.

title: Dreadful, cheesy, been there done that mush!
text: Frustratingly, other reviews mark this as a comedy and the rest, sci-fi. It fails as a serious sci-fi and the comedy is cheesy, with the compulsory handbrake turn to prescribed emotion thrown in at the prescribed, paint-by-numbers, point in the movie, exactly where it should be, why? Well, because that's the way they always do it to churn out formulaic tropes.I won't bother getting into the contradictions in the physics because other reviews address that, albeit they dismiss the concept of a multiverse in the movie by suggesting it's not another well known film with multiverses in it. Quite a cynical way to slip out of any credible supposition that changing the past alters the future along a different timeline. It came across as the writers saying they couldn't be bothered to get into the science and they're telling you that, as if that excuses them.Ryan Reynolds is typecast at this stage and sadly it could have been any of his nonchalant vanilla roles, with similar quips, except this film just wasn't very funny, and suffered from the one thing it's generally a golden rule to avoid in time travel movies ... predictability.Waiting for something good on Netflix these days is starting to become a challenge.

title: A fun and funny sci-fi ride!
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It's a great premise that ties in a lot of emotional moments I hadn't been expecting. It was a fun take on time travel that didn't feel overdone or like something I've seen a million times.As usual, Ryan Reynolds is in his wheelhouse with a smart mouth and the perfect lines. The banter with he and his younger self is amusing and never gets old throughout the duration. I feel they played the schtick just right.Js the science pure and accurate? I'll be honest, I have no clue. But it wasn't completely outlandish and distracting, at least not for the average viewer.

title: Just another Ryan Reynolds movie.
text: What's the difference between Free Guy & The Adam Project? Ask me within 6 months and I won't know. There's probably an unspoken rule in Hollywood - If we cast Reynold, let him be himself and we'll just let the film roll. Yes, Ryan can carry an entire movie but when does this end? Believe me, I like Ryan Reynolds, his quip, the sarcasm, the charisma, yes, the entire package. But that cannot be the entire movie. Give me a story, a range of emotions, and make me connect to you. It's not that hard.Overall, the movie is like any other time-travel movie. It's got good acting, an average script, a very beautiful Jennifer Garner and the usual science side of Mark Ruffalo. Young Adam plays his role well. It's a good watch if you want something light and don't want to use your head. You can watch this movie even while you do other things and you won't have lost the plot. It's a good movie for all ages, Ryan doesn't get his Deadpool side. For a movie in the 'action' Genre, the action is pretty average.

title: Copycat of a movie
text:
This feels like a movie you saw before. Nottingham original about either story or characters. Taking ideas
from back to the future and making reynolds talk like in deadpool.Nothing wrong with the movie per-ce, just booring. Dont watch this if you wanna see something you've never seen before.

title: Flashy Family Flick
text: The best parts are the heartfelt moments, especially Scobell's performance. Overall, a silly movie that's fun in a lot of right ways. Also, it looks like it cost a TON of $$, so nice of Netflix to make it for us while they're green lighting this sort of thing.And I'll take more of Reynolds and Ruffalo in whatever they want to do together.

title: Fun Movie
text: You have to give it too Netflix, a lot of star power here, movie is fun and family friendly , no Oscar here but take for it is and enjoy it. Did it makes sense no does it have plot hole yes but it still a movie you can enjoy.

title: Broad Appeal Family Movie
text: A universal hook - single parent kid, bit of escapist, bullied at school. Outsider misfit is a protagonist almost everyone can relate to.Ryan Reynolds is ALWAYS good. Entry into a science fiction universe with plenty of quips and thrills. Good quality movie, that creates a vibe, and doesn't stumble over itself. These two make a good team.

title: Absolutely loved it
text: What an amazing acting by both the young and the older Adam. Ryan Reynolds is almost always good with humour but the kid did an amazing job and I am sure he is going places. Its a welcome deviation from the boring time travel movies and will highly recommend watching it.

title: Good actors doing a bad movie..
text: Interesting story told the wrong way.. could have been much more!The kid is annoying. Ryan is being Ryan.. wish he did another style of acting here.Boring and cringe action with loud music.

title: Entertaining and left me with the good feels.
text: I rarely write reviews, but seeing this movie with a 6.7 rating nudged me to do so. I'm not a big movie watcher, when I do though, I don't really watch action, comics, or sci-fi. I do, however, like Ryan Reynolds. Still probably haven't seen most of his movies, but after seeing Deadpool I realized he could essentially melt away the genres for me, and poke fun at the things about them that usually annoy me. Having said all that, his "schtick" might be old to some but it doesn't rub me that way.Onto the movie. I found all of the main characters endearing (except villain Catherine Keener, who as an actress I love), and with a desire to see them through safely. Even through the CGI (not normally a fan), I found it enjoyable, even convincing enough to swerve in my seat a couple times when ships appeared from nowhere in the skies. This movie has heart, laughs, action, and the actors all do a great job in reeling you in to make you want to care. It left me with a smile.Special shout-out to Walker Scobell for debuting his 12 year old acting chops alongside some big league actors, job well done, young sir. I suspect we'll be seeing him around for a while!

title: Fun movie that goes by fast
text: Ryan Reynolds's is funny as ever, little Adam is so cute and adorable and like Ryan Reynolds. The story could be predictable but it's still oodles of fun. Liked the interaction between the small Adam and big Adam. A feel good movie. A straight forward sci fi movie with a charming cast.

title: Generic and annoying
text:
The Adam Project is a waste of time. Its sci-fi premise of a time traveler teaming up with his younger self is fun, but that positive is overshadowed by formulaic MacGuffins, empty drama, and forced quippy dialogue. Likewise, Ryan Reynolds shows vulnerabilities, yet mostly plays his typical sarcastic self. That snarky humor can work in the right situations, but becomes grating when overused. Furthermore, Garner, Saldana, and Ruffalo all provide some emotion, but their smaller roles come with strained comedy as well. Overall, The Adam Project has some heart and creativity, but not nearly enough for audiences to actually care.Meanwhile, The Adam Project's filmmaking is generic. The cinematography has moments of lighting, focus, and framing, but is mostly unimaginative. Similarly, the editing is never interesting and the sound is rarely elevated. The music uses recognizable songs, but they aren't related to the material on screen. Plus, the production design is painfully unoriginal and the excessive CGI is cheap (making the film look like a Syfy original). Clearly, the priority of The Adam Project was its famous cast, since that's the only reason the film is relevant. Ultimately, it might have glimmers of potential, but The Adam Project does nothing worth watching.Writing: 3/10
Direction: 4/10
Cinematography: 5/10
Acting: 4/10
Editing: 5/10
Sound: 6/10
Score/Soundtrack: 5/10
Production Design: 3/10
Casting: 8/10
Effects: 5/10Overall Score: 4.8/10.

title: Just a great bit of fun!!
text: I'm not much into the modern day style of sci-fi that relies on CGI and mind-blowing sound effects but I was minding my neighbour's 10 y/o youngster. A friend of his had recommended this movie so we went for it with the Dolby turned up.It's exactly what it set out to be - a piece of enjoyable pure hokum with a bit of sentimentality included. You could have an hours fun afterwards picking out all the plot holes but why bother. The film never dragged at any stage and we both clapped at the end - not something I would normally do, I hasten to add :)I'll be honest. I would never have watched this without having had a child in the house but, if you're childminding, I'd definitely recommend it as 100 minutes or so of great fun.

title: Pretty good, but not the best!
text: The Adam Project is a fun, family friendly time travel movie that the whole family will enjoy.Ryan Reynolds does a pretty good job though it shouldn't be that hard for him considering his appearances in film nowadays are all identical to one another regardless of the film his in, he acts like Deadpool, cracking jokes etc in pretty much every film I've seen of his recently. However it suits this movie at least so well done there. The Kid who plays the younger version of Ryan's character was probably the most likable and did an incredible job. Definitely enjoyed seeing him in the movie. Zoe Saldana, Jennifer Garner and Mark Ruffalo all did good jobs with the albeit scarce screen time and few spoken lines that they had. All in all the casting was great, and the performances all were good enough with the only note worthy one being the kid.The storyline itself is kind of simple and straightforward. It won't leave you with questions or asking yourself about time loops or if the chicken or egg came first, unlike other time travel movies that will have you wracking your heads for years. However it worked fine for the film as this was more geared towards kids and a younger audience who wouldn't want to spend hours on end trying to make sense of a convoluted storyline.Special effects and all were pretty great so no comment there.All in all The Adam Project is a enjoyable film to watch, it's got action, a good cast, nice special effects and will keep you entertained, though you won't leave the cinema analyzing every event or minute of film.Good job and 7/10 from me. Don't think there will be a sequel but would be interesting to see!

title: Ryan Reynolds movies meets Netflix again
text: You know the result. Another romantic action comedy that was given away by the trailer and superficially checked some "life lessons". It was and interesting idea, but too predictable to enjoy. Not to mention the unrealistic and exaggerated parts.

title: Slick, focused, and simple
text: I had little to no expectations for this movie when I sat down to watch it last night. I was pleasantly surprised to find a fun and easy to follow story with some tear-jerker moments, sharp comedy, and the best child acting I have seen in years. This one is definitely worth booting up on Netflix while it is still popular.

title: Lower the bar even more.
text: After red notice Netflix realized that they can lower the bar more and more and more. This movie is just too stupid to endure for over 15 min. Just within the first 5 min you can see how it all points to the end of the movie. Also why do they need to bring bullying to the topic of the movie when you can tell Reynolds was probably the kid bullying everyone. If you want to talk about kids being bullied then cast someone more believable. Is just what cinema is all about now. A mix of things with no structure.

title: yup 10/10
text: Idly scrolling titles. This appeared as suggested movie. WOW, what a sweet, action packed film. All the leads were amazing. Walker Scobell knocked me over, what a superlative little actor! Jennifer Garner, Ryan Reynolds, and. Mark Ruffalo, were spot on. They all acted their hearts out. Zoe Saldana was an stunning loveable ass kicker. Catherine Keener was a perfectly horrid villain. The script was great, the cinematography and effects were eye catching and engaging. So very glad I watched this film.

title: Dull
text: Very dull disappointing, the movie was full of stars, Ryan Zoe Mark Ruffalo but man there literally was nothing new in the storyline, the jokes were not that great, vfx were nothing we haven't seen earlier and the action was the weakest part. Expected so much when Ryan Renolds was coming with a movie but damn disappointing .

title: You can't hate it
text: Was this a mind boggling cinematic offering that made you truly put genuine thought and appreciation into the film before your eyes? Absolutely not. Was this a bad film? Absolutely not. I like to call films like these easy films.. no inconclusive plot of question at hand, no breath taking cinematography, no thought provoking script. Not to take away from the movie at hand This was a good movie. It was an easy movie. Witty at times, mostly cutesy and predictable. A fantastic movie for a family night in. Plus who doesn't love Ryan Reynolds's?

title: A popcorn worthy fun dramemy-fi (except for the young Keener!)
text: There's not a lot that needs to be said about this movie. It looks good. It's funny at times. It had me tear up at the right moments. The acting is sufficient. There's just one thing that had me shrivel in horror and that's the absolutely distractiongly bad job at creating a young cgi Keener. Those scenes had me squint my eyes not to let it ruin the movie for me. I have a feeling YouTube will be filled to the brim with people discussing the horrible cgi done on that. Why didn't they use current Keener for the young version and just grimed her to look older. She's a good looking woman.So my advice is basically: squint your eyes every time cgi Keener appears on screen or watch it in horror.

title: A 6 out of 10 due to the effort....but it came short
text: I liked the story, somewhat original with tons of potential, but came short.This review is not about the movie, but it is about Netflix productions. They bring in big actors, and they obvisously have a proper budget, but still they come short in outdoor setting scenes and the script.It is not only in this movie, but in other Netflix's movies and some series as well. I can dig the fact that digital effects allow for indoor setting for almost everything, but it cannot simply substitute the outdoor scenes in movies.In my opinion, this is getting frustrating and will eventually decreace Netflix's value in movie production (and series), especially on the Sci-Fi genre.Finally, scripts. I mean there are some talanted script writers working their ass off and I am sure the do work with Netflix, but I get the feeling they are not allowed to expand the boundaries of sci-fi storytelling, since they may lose their target audience?Come on Netflix! After SO many time-travel AMAZING movies, the scripts need to be more thought-provoking!! We need to think while watching and not just consume subpar material, because we don't get our asses and go to the cinemas anymore!

title: Quite entertaining
text: I really liked this movie. For and action science-fiction movie, it's funnier than most comedies and even quite sweet. As always, love Ryan Reynolds!!!

title: Everything that dude touches turnes to gold!
text:
I see a picture with Ryan Reynolds, i gladly pay to see, and i take my three daughters with med because they just love Mr. Reynolds....
Loved the film, and see forward to buying it :)

title: Mediocre at best
text: 4 stars for Ryan and his younger self, other than that it's too cliché and the emotional dialogues feels fake.Good enough if you want to watch a movie that requires zero focus.

title: 10 out of 10!
text: Whoever gives this lower than an 8 out of 10 has not watched the same movie that I just did. What a great movie! It has action, comedy (of course) and emotional content. The kid in this is great as is Ryan, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner, Zoe Saldana and Catherine Keener. Really great, fun, sad, exciting action/comedy movie!

title: Predictable TV Teen Movie
text: The Adam ProjectThe first half of this movie was good but then it ran out of steam. The same jokes throughout grated.This is very much a TV movie written for a teenage audience and I am sure they will look beyond the faults.I'm giving this a weak 6 outta 10 meaning instantly forgettable and not Ryan Reynolds finest hour.

title: Adam and Eve eat your heart out!
text: What an awesome, fun filled ride.Great casting of Adam and his mini me, they bounce off each other perfectly.If you're looking for a fun, action packed, slick, intelligent film, that passes a couple of hours, with no pit stops, to check how longs left, this is the one.Highly recommended!

title: Strange and exciting movie
text: The movie was understandable, time travel is one of interesting topics, the a actors played good. It had a lot of small bugs but having comedy genre was a good advantage. Overall, I enjoyed watching this movie and I suggest you to watch this movie.

title: A fun heartfelt movie
text: First, understand what kind of movie you're going to watch before sitting down the watch it. I'm so tired of reading reviews about sci-fii, superhero movies, horror movies or any kind of movie that takes an imagination. These movies have a place, to allow us to sit down and be entertained. I don't need to understand time travel, or be an expert in physics to enjoy this movie. Actually if you were you probably won't enjoy this movie. This movie is awesome. It's exactly the kind of summer blockbuster I remember going to the movies as a 12-year-old kid to watch. In fact, I wish I saw this in the theater on the big screen with my son. Full of action, laughs and full of heart. Watch it with your family!

title: Worth watching
text: In general it's not a 'great' movie. The SF part of it is pretty weak - either things that have been done before or such bad science that you'll shake your head (why has Hollywood decided on one theory of time travel, and a BAD one at that?). But the movie is well-paced, well-acted, and entertaining - just don't expect too much more than a movie worth having a bowl of popcorn with - Frankly, I will settle for that every time considering what has been coming out of Hollywood lately. OH, and it is definitely a Ryan Reynolds vehicle - he carries the movie. And if you like him you will definitely like the movie.

title: Sci fi with heart!
text: Yes it's a little cheesy, yes there are plot holes and yes its another time travel flic. What this is has that others in this genre don't, is heart! It's a very easy watch, it's fun and you actually care for the characters. Even my sci fo hating fiancee enjoyed it, that says it all.Well done Netflix.

title: Surprisingly funny and entertaining
text: Gotta be honest, I"m not a Ryan Reynolds fan. Something about him as an actor I've never been able to stomach but -- he's normally not as funny or cool as he thinks he is -- but in this movie he makes it work because he's up against his 12 year old self. It's a simple premise, a screw-up with time travel sends people in all sorts of directions and times trying to fix it. The chase /actions scenes were saved from monotony due to the humor (chase scenes are so cliche). The movie never loses sight of the childhood family issue future Adam has carried with him for decades, and it's lovingly resolved in the end. It's a great kids movie but does have some bad language, though somehow framed in the humor it doesn't come across as vulgar (to me). It was worth the time to watch it but I wouldn't pay money to buy it. Jennifer Garner was perfect in her role as Mom. Lots of colorful, catchy special effects kids of all ages with love. Worth a watch.

title: Nothing special and a lack of soul
text: I heard Ryan Reynolds took a break from filming close to the making of this movie- Thats understandable. The movie is sloppy, the script is very shallow and impersonal. A Quick production and Quality thereafter. Dont get me wrong, Ryan is great but the plot is too weak, all other movies with him are better.

title: Brilliant family movie
text: Fantastic acting, story line was intriguing. The Adam Project has earnt itself a place on my rewatch list for sure. Great for a family movie night snuggled on the sofa. Action, comedy, drama etc, it has it all.

title: The Adam Project
text: What presents an interesting concept for the sci-fi genre, ultimately becomes generic and confusing in its execution. The film tries to convey personal and emotional elements, but fails to do so with the convolution of questions that constantly create plot holes that could have easily ended the film quicker. It creates a disconnection to the story the film was trying to tell, ultimately making it feel longer than it needed to be. The leads of the film, while for the most part are entertaining, the youngest proves to be borderline unlikable due to how annoying he becomes. The villain also feels underdeveloped, portrayed by an actress that is much better than the material given to her. Despite the creative elements that can be respected for how much it tries, the film is bogged down by its obvious Steven Spielberg visual impersonations. Overall this film had promising intentions, but lack the creative minds behind the camera to tell a memorable story.

title: Surprisingly good
text: Was a 7/10, deducted 1 point for casting Mark Ruffalo. It was a fun sci-fi, and actually pretty funny. The kid does a good job do a Ryan Reynolds impression.

title: Enjoyable for the most part
text: Liked the self aware humour and acknowledgement of previous time travel movies. Also that he was visiting with his younger self was enjoyable. Unlike many movies nowadays there was an emotional connection to his mom that helped get the viewer involved. Time travel is always tricky and for the most part it isn't too confusing here until the ending couldn't totally explain things worked out. But it's generally okay.Later there are some fight scenes slightly similar punctuated by typical Ryan Reynolds wisecracks. Zoe Saldana is quite convincing in sci fi action.This is quite enjoyable and you want to see how things work out. Although the ending felt a bit predictable. And Mark Ruffalo's character was a bit annoying.

title: Solid performance by the boy
text: Easy watching piece of fun. Lovely ending. The cgi is definitely iffy buy who cares. Good story and nice casting and characters. Definitely a good effort from Netflix.

title: Funny Ryan Reynolds
text: Very funny and heart touching movie. Ryan Reynolds funny as always. Would recommend it to watch it, when you want to have fun and in the same time action.

title: Sit back, chuckle and enjoy
text: Entertaining action with amusing likeable characters. Absolutely nothing to dislike about this movie .Mark Ruffalo and Ryan Reynolds dont disappoint and provide an easy family watch.

title: Average
text:
It should be a more duration about 2hrs. But it's okay
Good movie with great time travel theory. Ryan Renolds,mark ruffalo and others cast was awesome.

title: A vehicle for Ryan Reynolds
text: This movie has so many plot holes, I lost count. Time travel movies are notoriously difficult to make because inherently the concept makes no sense. Going back in time creates multiple paradoxes which would destroy the nature of the movie itself. Thus, these are ignored for the sake of comedy, action, special effects, and the same old Ryan Reynolds character that we have seen in every single movie he makes. The concept was interesting, but the writing was horrible. Netflix needed something to put Ryan Reynolds in, and they found this mishmash of a action/comedy/family/science-fiction movie.

title: Shawn Levy Stranger Things style but a movie
text: Yep classic cozy 80s references to ET, Back to the Future, Star Wars, and more. Has a similar 80s feel as Stranger Things. Great fun and enjoyable for being on Netflix. Nice high quality production graphics mini me Ryan Reynolds does a great job carrying Ryan's mannerisms.

title: An engrossing adventure that travels through time. The charismatic performance of Ryan Reynolds takes this science fiction gem to new heights.
text: A fascinating and endearing science fiction adventure, The Adam Project strikes a perfect mix between humor, action, and real emotional depth. The movie's core themes center on the difficulties of family dynamics and the influence of time travel on personal development. Ryan Reynolds plays Adam, a pilot who meets his younger self and sets out on a time travel mission to save the future. Ryan Reynolds is known for his charm and wit in this role. Reynolds plays the lead role with effortless grace, displaying his comedic timing as well as his ability to emote sincere feelings, which endears and relatable the character.Shawn Levy, the director, should be commended for his skillful blending of several genres to produce an audience-pleasing movie. The pacing is brilliant, combining thrilling action scenes with poignant moments to keep the spectator interested. The story is skillfully interwoven with time-travel elements, providing both suspense and profound observations on the decisions we make in life. Reynolds's developing friendship with Walker Scobell, who plays his younger counterpart, is a major feature of the movie because of their chemistry, which gives the narrative an additional degree of reality.The Adam Project is notable not only for its captivating story and outstanding acting but also for its capacity to convey a deep message about the value of relationships, family, and the decisions that determine our futures. It's a heartwarming journey that gives viewers a fresh perspective on the importance of love and second chances as well as a wave of nostalgia.

title: Wow mind blown what a concept!!
text: Every so often there is a lull in cinema, about every 3 to four months, but then the Ryman Reynolds comes around and knocks it out of the park.Everything thing in this movie is spectacular and not argerlich in the slightest even Mark Rukkalo (the hulk from the hulk movies) is fanf___kingtastic. Walker Scobell who plays the main character, (character name escapes me) is charismatic in the way a child can only be, his eyes grow bright with wanderlust as he gets to use the cool sci fi gadgets, and defeat the invisible guys who choose not too fight invisiblyThe car chase through the heavily wooded woods of Zoe saldena driving a old pickup truck in reverse while a space jet chases them brought back memories of Gene Hackman chasing a train in the French Connection (1996)Ryan Reynolds also pops his shirt off if I remember correctly.One downside of this movie was, Jennifer Garner undoubtably got paid and continued her career.Which is upsetting, especially considering the recent allegations and controversies.All in all a perfect movie to watch on a Wednesday morning while your unemployed and drinking grain alcohol.4/10 there's something for everyone.

title: Deadpool time travels minus the sexual jokes
text: I have to say I think Ryan is an entertaining actor. But his acting range is very limited. It works for Deadpool since he's taking his usual persona to the limit and fits Deadpool. For other movies he's usually playing the not so hero same weird/funny guy. So this makes you feel like you watch him do the same shtick in a different movie.Besides that this movie is very half baked. It feels like a b or c grade sci fi movie. It was a decent watch, not more than 6.5 at best.

title: Fun interactions and poignant message
text: Enjoyed this immensely. High level blasphemy was unnecessary and bothered me. The plot and script wore out towards the end but the action was convincing and fun.Effects were solid and the fast dialogue worked very well.

title: A fun little movie
text: The Adam Project is a movie that starts off its presentation with a bucket of adrenaline rush and goes on keeping up that standard. Right off the bat, many things try to catch your attention with the flashy presentation being one of them where some of them work and some don't. The actors as well as the screenplay keep you engaged with all the fun elements but struggle to keep up as the story moves forward. Talking about the story during the whole run of the movie it feels like a culmination of many stories that came before it with a big sticker of adrenaline rush stuck onto it. Director Shawn Levy has come up with a harmony that has his unique signature which screams that if you don't like it that much then at least you are gonna enjoy it a little. All in all The Adam Project is an action-packed, adrenaline-infused movie with not that good of a story-telling but it does the job anyway.

title: Time travel
text: The Adam Project (2022) is a fun, funny, and entertaining time travel movie.Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell were both great in the movie as older Adam and young Adam. They were both funny and were both entertaining together throughout the film.The other actors like Zoe Saldana, Mark Ruffalo, and Jennifer Garner were also good. The action scenes are nicely shot and are fun to watch.It has some good cinematography, especially in scenes that take place in a forest. All the future stuff was cool when you see it, like the kind of weapons they use.I had fun with this movie and I can see a lot of people liking this movie and the actors in it. This will be worth your time.

title: VERY GOOD MOVIE
text: This movie is very good. The plot is light and not too heavy to digest. So this film is easy to understand. There are also many references to Ryan Reynolds' Deadpool and Mark Ruffalo's Hulk.

title: Cliché SciFi time travel movie
text: For the number of stars that are in this movie it disappointingly manages to hit every time time travel cliché going. From the roping in of a younger self because the ship is coded to the pilots DNA to trying and failing to answer the grandfather paradox.

title: Don't think, just watch.
text: When I think about a movie to watch, I tend to mark them in two categories. I will either be heavily invested in the plot and nothing can stray my focus or I will fall asleep to some background noise. Quite a few of Reynold's movies seem to straddle the line however. Despite excellent dialogue and action scenes, they seem to be more about the aforementioned Reynolds showing off than anything.The plot is fairly straightforward, using time travel to stop the invention of time travel. However as with most plots like this, they describe how it is achieved. This will most likely bore those who don't quite understand the science they refer too, and upset those who do understand. Back to the future anyone?The dialogue is fantastic of course, the natural witty charm of Ryan Reynolds and the talents his co stars Garner and Ruffalo. Whoever decided to cast the young Walker Scobel deserves praise. That was about the most convincing aspect of time travel in the whole flick. Action scenes are well choreographed and highly enjoyable to watch.I'd like to point out a certain trend happening with movies as of late. Many actors are producing and directing films. And despite their obvious talents, they tend to gravitate towards self-promotion. What I mean is, a great movie isn't necessarily having every scene an incredible action sequence, and I don't want to see funny but tired jokes and lines in every scene. Great moments are only great if they are accompanied by ones less so.All in all not a hard film to get through, but I don't see it becoming a cult classic.

title: Light hearted feel good
text:
Light hearted feel good kind of movie. Don't think too deeply about the time travel aspect of ... if your here you must remember now that your older sort of thing... but quite enjoyable
Good for the family.

title: To much punch and not enough heart
text: I really wanted to like this film. But the screenplay was pretty bad. I guess it's a children's film? I could not really tell. I normally really love Ryan Reynolds, and Mark Rufalo. The director relied to much on the action scenes to make up for a poorly written script.

title: Middle of the Pack
text: When it comes to time travel movies, 'Terminator', 'Back to the Future', 'Avengers: Endgame', are my favourite, but 'Interstellar' is the best.Anyways, a time travel movie with typical Ryan Reynolds is essentially what this is. I've always been a Reynolds fan since the mid 2000's. Then people seemed to have lost interest in him; until 'Deadpool' that is. Then no one could seem to get enough. He is actually a good actor and has done several diverse roles, but lately I think people just love him too much as the comedic sarcastic person he's known to be, so thats what we keep getting. Which is honestly okay with me.As a whole the movie has good effects (other than the driving through the woods), and is a fun, funny, family action film. Mark Ruffalo hits those key sentimental notes. The kid did a pretty good job acting as a 12 year old Reynolds too, so kudos to him.Seeing as this is from the people who also did 'Free Guy', I feel as though I have to say I enjoyed 'Free Guy' much more.

title: Pretty decent..
text: This was a pretty decent movie, good efforts by the cast, not the worst CGI we've seen and overall an interesting story line.The chemistry between the Adams is pretty nice, fun and witty throughout, and also great between the Adams and his/their parents.Overall a solid stand alone movie, 8/10.

title: Entertained
text: If you like this kind of stuff, you will be entertained. I hoping that a second viewing will increase my rating.
