I think that Ryan Reynolds is a good actor, probably from The In-Laws (tt0314786), I did see him in Van Wilder (tt0283111), but that's a totally different movie. Anyway, I would certainly recommend this movie.

title: Full of clichés
text: Time travel is an idea so fascinating that movies that revolve around it will always have a fan base, whatever the outcome.However, it seems to me that this movie is not a genuine time travel flick. I mean, of course, time travel is in the center of the action, but the whole meaning of the movie is more important than that. Family ties, coming of age, reflecting on life are all issues you will come across in this film. And that's not half bad for me.But it's so absolutely full of clichés both action- and dialog-wise that for me it doesn't cut it. I knew every line that was going to be thrown and every plot outcome right from the start - I caught myself fast forwarding all the time.It was somewhat fun at certain points, and if you are into this kind of action sci-fi films you might enjoy it. But there's so much computer animation potential these days (making FX more or less irrelevant), that script should paid more attention to.

title: Great fun and a time-waster no critics need to apply
text: Remember when movies were made for fun, no-brainers you just sit back and watch it? This is one of those throwbacks. Just enjoy the show don't worry about the plot. Watch the action and the performances. Fun, just add popcorn. BTW everybody is great in this.

title: Sci Fi Entertainment
text: The Adam Project was an entertaining film. The performances and chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell were perfectly executed. Walker Scobell did an outstanding job portraying a younger Ryan Reynolds. An entertaining time travel film filled with humour and action. The Adam Project was enjoyable to watch.

title: It's not for me

The movie has a lot of recycled content from another ci-fi movies of space and time travel but it's really bad.The start of the movie is confusing and it doesn't explain much, the trama is really bad and the end is very boring.The only thing that I like about this movie is Rayan Reynolds.I hope this review help someone to not waist his time on this movie.

title: Watch it for the jokes, not for the plot
text: This film can pretty much be summed up in two words: Ryan Reynolds. From other reviews I've read, it seems like many went into watching this with high expectations, something that is quite frankly unjustifiable when you're watching a Netflix production Ryan Reynolds movie.This film guarantees a couple of pretty cheap laughs which gets a little tiresome at times. But then again what more can you expect. Honestly the plot was very flawed, but the overall feel of the movie was enjoyable and the underlying message added a touch of emotionality to the whole affair.All in all, watch it if you like Ryan Reynolds and are in need of some light comedy!

title: Great cast, great family fun, but...
text: My family really enjoyed this one! There's action, emotion, laughs, and cool visuals! It's like a modern day Back to the Future with better special effects! But just like with Back to the Future, you have to suspend some disbelief. Time travel is a tricky concept and, to its credit, this movie doesn't worry too much about the holes in its explanation. There are moments where you think "Wait. What!?!" but then the movie quickly moves away from over explaining and dives back into the fun. Definitely worth watching!

title: Very entertaining and a great movie

A lot of people are saying Ryan is playijg the same niche he always play but that is fine, he is lile.robin wiliams.or jim carry, he has a niche and he specialize in it.I personaly cant get enough of that type of humor it has made me literely lapugh out loud in a lot of parts in this movie like not many movies do.This movie has some emotional parts also, and sure ot breaks a lot of laws of phisycs with its explenation of time travel and there is a lot to talk about but the question is

Of cours but im sure it wont have any and doesnt need one so muchis it like epic avengers end game level movie ?No of coures not... but its a netflix movie to watch at home.And netflix are doing some incredable productions lately with this and with the rock/gal gadot and drops some huge names therewith that amazing cast also on screen ... amazing effects, sound work, and cinematography ?This was def a very very enjoyable watchit has everything i would ever want from a weekend watch movie on netflix10/10.

title: An odd movie
text: So you think its going to be predictable and cliche at first. Then it surprises you again and again. A mostly solid movie with just a few weird things.So Im gonna start at the end. The end was stupid. The father does not want to change the future even though they changed the future back to the way it was....even though I thought the father was killed by the main protaganist..so Im not sure why he is still dead.. Its pretty weird to do all that just to have the father die. The other woman died now sso the future has already been changed.... AnywaysI thought Adam said he met the girl in flight school but with no war...and yet they still meed exactly the same way. Pretty hard to believe.And I do love the good Place but the actor plays a terrible bad guy here. It almost ruins the whole movie.And of course I like Ryan Reynolds...but He tries to do too many deadpool impersonation moments. We all think of these moments as the true Ryan Reynolds...but I hate it now. When he whispers in that high pitched voice trying to be funny,...its over the top. It does not work well in this movie I think. But his heart of gold moments are really well done. I mean damn when he met his mom in the bar..that emotion was genius.That is all i have to say about that.Oh except for wasnt it stupid how that woman died at the end. A magnet powerful enough to stop a bullet and yet the gun is still in her hand...adn they just walk out without any problems...What about the world melting down scenario? Thats not on the table anymore? Uhh ok.

title: Good family movie that's about it.
text: Everything in this movie made bad, cheap CGI, fake forest, fake house, green background, cheesy acting and same old jokes we all know. This movie is good if you have kids around and/or you are 12 year-old, for everyone else it's just boring.

title: An actually decent time travel movie
text: We all have seen so many lame time travel movies that we're about ready to barf tachyons, yup? I had just about sworn off of time travel flicks... when along comes something with some real heart to it.This has everything: good directing, script, acting, action/adventure choreography. I think what makes it special is that it has just enough science to make it "believable", just enough action to give adrenaline junkies their fix... but focuses far more on people and relationships. For once, the audience can identify with the characters.Further, it passes my ultimate test: "Would I watch it again?" Yes. It's that good. This is a time travel story that succeeds in all aspects, without absurdist paradoxes.Edit: I did watch it again a second time, some time later, and enjoyed it as much as the first time.For those who rated this low, for whatever reason, seriously you folks need to get off your ego podium and just enjoy a movie for once. You bunch think yourselves qualified to rate movies but your ratings deserve 1-star ratings. What, not enough sex, gore and obscene language for you?This is a terrific movie with some real heart. Good job on all counts, and well worth watching.

title: Enjoyable family fare
Another movie for the trash can
text: Trust me this movie is unable to hold your interest after 30 minutes. I am not even getting into the biggest plot hole in the history movies so that I won't spoil your experience. But like the extremely boring Like Turning Red and other BS movies out there this takes the crown. It is a very ironically big waste of time since it plays with the concept of time travel. Just of think of it like batman suit with nipples.

title: Fun and enjoyable movie, but another one with the same Reynolds character
text: This is a quite entertaining movie, well put together and quite easy to understand. It has that taste of a contemporary magic formula that invites you to go to the movies and fall in love with the humor, the action, the visual effects and a fantastic story based on a question that many of us have asked ourselves at some point: What would you do if you found yourself with the version young of yourself? Time travel is always attractive if it is well justified in any story.The strong points of the film are a dynamic script that has a rhythm that is constant and accelerated, but simple, understandable and entertaining; the visual effects (except for the rejuvenation of the antagonist) and Walker Scobell.The low points of the film, the costumes and Ryan Reynolds, who again repeats the same personality of his last films.

title: Lightweight movie
text: I liked the movie in general, characters were entertaining, but undetailed. I would say there were way more possibilities in the storyline that what was the movie itself. Emotionally it was satisfying, but the time travel part was painfully simple and predictable. Certainly this won't be in my top lists however I didn't regret watching it. Don't expect huge twists, if you want that kind of enjoyment, watch the series Dark after this one.

title: Save for a rainy Sunday afternoon
text: A harmless enjoyable film. It's not very original and Ryan Reynolds schtick is starting to get a little old. But overall I found it to be fun. You can tell everyone in the movie is having a pretty good time. Walker Scobell as Young Adam does an amazing Reynolds impression. I was pretty impressed with his performance. Not bad if you're bored on a Sunday night.

title: A surprisingly entertaining time travel, sci-fi, popcorn flick
text: A surprisingly entertaining time travel, sci-fi, popcorn flick with Ryan Reynolds who is still playing himself and a kid, Walker Scobell, who is good at playing a young Ryan Reynolds.The banter between the two is extremely enjoyable and some of the funniest moments in the film. It's not just all comedy though and there are some genuinely moving moments with the dad and mom played by Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner respectively. Likewise, Zoe Saldana gives a strong performance despite her very brief appearance in the movie. Another aspect I appreciate is that the movie doesn't use shaky cam or overly edits the action sequences which is just a blessing on the eyes.However, the CGI is quite bad and there are a lot of very noticeable green screen. For some reason they also don't use actual explosions but CG explosions which just looks lame. I am also a little annoyed that the 2050 soldiers who have these futuristic guns, yet the bullets still act like a normal modern day gun. Could've tried to be a bit more creative...Overall, if you want something entertaining to watch for about 100 minutes then this is definitely a good film to watch.

title: Loved it
text: Great cast, superb acting, special effects were awesome.Plenty of holes in the plot, but still was a surprisingly good movie.Walker Scobell was fantastic as the young Adam.Great sort of super-hero-humor-ish vibe throughout.I will watch it again, and I rarely watch movies more than once.

title: Same Same.
text: How does Ryan get away with being Ryan in movies all the time? RR in this movie is like Deadpool without the skills or the suit. Kinda like the Rock. Same every movie and we yet still tune in to see it. Ah well. The young kid was good. More like a young Robert Redford than Ryan in looks, but he has a future if he sticks with it. Would have like to see more lines and wise cracks from him as he can delivery them well for his age. The locations were well created and the camera work was pretty good. It's visually pretty pleasing. I reached for my phone a few times in the fight scenes though. The full cast was very small. If I was a kid I would have been pretty engrossed with it. Definitely a rainy day/night movie with pizza and the kids.

title: Adult language in a kid's movie? That doesnt feel right. There is more bad: the jokes are missing the mark, quite often
text: This movie feels kinda weird, because this supposedly is a kid's movie, but lots of adult oriented language is spoken by a kid's character's. Just one of such an example: talking about getting laid with a kid at 12 years old? In a kid's adventure movie? What were they thinking?We know Ryan Reynolds from his freaky, gross comedies. (Deadpool). That movie is full of adult jokes and they do work brilliantly in Deadpool, which is an R-rated movie though. But that adult oriented style simply does not go down well in a kid's adventure movie. Did they talk about having sex in E. T? Could you imagine that? That would be so gross and destroying the magic of an adventure story.More bad: they made the kid's character too smart. His character is simply not true to life. And that's a bummer, because the kid is the 2nd leading actor.Even more bad: the timing of many of the jokes is off. Almost every joke is timed wrongly. Read out too fast, without a pause to let the joke land on it's feet.Not any good then? It's not terribly bad, not at all, but it is especially lacking in true to life characters, which is an important lack, because this movie tries to center around family life and family bonds. But how should I as a viewer take this family seriously, when all the characters are made out of cardboard and say things that are not age appropiate?

title: No Adam without ... (Eve)
text: So Hulk is Deadpools father and Deadpool is into Gamora? Say what? Also what do you mean I watch too much MCU stuff? There's not enough to watch ... ok I may have gotten myself a few negative points by trying to be funny. But at least I included Gamora in my listing, who is actually in the MCU - some seem to have forgotten - Elektra unfortunately as much as I love Jennifer Garner is not part of the MCU, even though she is a Marvel character.But enough of my ranting. This is about ... actually I probably should not get into it. I mean time travel is so tricky ... they try to explain stuff and yes if you close your eyes turn around 50 times, getting dizzy throughout you probably won't question anything ... and it is better that way.Timeline getting corrected and stuff ... I guess this is closer to Back to the Future (one of many name checks the movie does). So yes wink wink and a lot of one liners and a lot of Ryan Reynolds. If you love him (platonically or otherwise), you'll love the movie too. And the boy is phenomenal too.The action is good and if you suspend your disbelief and just go with the flow you won't question the fact that there are way too many coincidences and that the movie or our main character should not be able to get away with so much stuff. But Hulk ... I mean Banner ... I mean Ruffalo is here too ... well sort of. And he's a scientist again ... you won't like him when he's .. doing math and science stuff. He won't get green though ... doesn't have to.Take this with a grain of salt, dive in and enjoy it for what it is ... there are some emotional moments too. Even the ones you will be able to predict and that are way too convenient ... but hey: it's a movie, alright?

title: Ryan being Ryan

There is little to no depth, except a tad of emotion towards the end.It was fine. Next...

title: Yawn
text: How does the director of Free Guy; an interesting concept, end up with this as a follow up film. This film is a contrite, Disney formula, yawn. They rip off just about every movie you can think up. From Spy Kids to Star Wars. (Yeah Lucas wants his scene back). The score is weird and the action scene music trying to be Guardians of the Galaxy doesn't work at all. People keep referencing Back to the Future; they wish it had an ounce of that story. BtoF had wit and played w nostalgia in a fun way. This movie goes back to 2018, ahh not much there to wax nostalgic for. If you can't do something original then why do it. Of course money, but....

title: Family themed science fiction caper
text: A film with a lot of heart. Time travel, some great special effects but more importantly a tale of family, bonds between a father and his son and a mother and her son. An entertaining tale with lot of heart.

title: It's not a spectacular movie
text: It's not a spectacular movie, but it's not bad either. I always find Ryan's humor to make me laugh. But the actions and effects were a bit messy in my opinion. It's a movie to watch once, but not that I'm saying I miss it and want to watch it again.

title: Regular
text: Think of a movie that is a tangle of things we've seen millions and millions of times in the science fiction genre, and for starters, I didn't hate the movie, but you have to agree that it's a very derivative movie. I believe that the main problems of the film are the script and editing, the first one helped by a very chaotic plot and narrative, you wonder what the characters' objective is for at least the initial 50 minutes, and a script that has many holes even, I wondered about everything that involved this time travel that went on for a year, but another character died that year, and the other came back to find her and then they will meet again, you don't understand, right, the script follows this same principle there, not to mention that some dialogues and situations in the movie that try to create humor only embarrass others. The other problem is that the editing of the film needed more polishing, there are too long scenes that do not add anything to the development of the plot and hinder the narrative, it is a film of 1h46min, but it seems to take a lot longer for the characters to finally start to pursue their goals is clear, luckily, the film's direction manages most of the time to get around these problems with the tone under control, it takes on the absurd nature of the film with touches of more intimate moments that didn't seem too out of place, in addition to him directing the action of the film with his hand on the primer, it doesn't get in the way, but it doesn't compromise either. The cast does well for the most part, Ryan Reynolds, with his comic way, manages to get around the awkward moments and even delivers cute scenes, but he's still the usual Ryan Reynolds, the boy Walker Scobell does well here he has personality, charisma, delivers a certain convincing vulnerability and he handles the scenes that are most demanded, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner and Zoe Saldana don't have much to do here, but they are fine as usual and Catherine Keener makes such a caricatured villain generic and your motivations are so weak that my God in heaven. The visual effects of the film are at best working, there are scenes well produced and others where you notice a strange thing there or here that can cause a certain distraction, and the film has even touching moments about family and fatherhood, even if it is superficial. "The Adam Project" does not offer anything new in the genre, it has a very irregular script, but it is fun and even touching.Note: 6.2.

title: Wait what? Not another deadpool?
text: Surprisingly it was bit refreshing to hear all that smart a*s talk coming from someone else other than the type casted script ryan reynolds. Its getting old, really old.Good movie. If there was anyone that knows how to make a movie with kids...its shawn levy. He just knows how to.make that connection.Good production def would recommend for a weekend night in.

title: Where Have I Seen, Heard, Smelled, Tasted & Felt This Before?
text:
The Adam Project is a great time waster with solid writing and excellent production. The problem with The Adam Project is that it relies on way too many tropes to deliver any kind of unique storytelling. Watching The Adam Project is like opening a ZOOM window with eight compartments, and then playing Somewhere In Time, Return Of The Jedi, Wandavision, The Last Starfighter, Terminator, MCU, Independence Day and
Quantum Leap at the same time.

title: Loved the movie but thought the often used foul language in it wasn't necessary, especially for a movie that is for families.

title: Entertaining

title: Quite Enjoyable Film!
text: The Adam Project was a great experience, i really did enjoy watching this. Ryan Reynolds never disappoints I don't believe I've disliked a single one of his movies and this one certainly paid off. After accidentally crash landing in 2022, a time traveling fighter pilot named Adam Reed (Ryan Reynolds) teams up with his 12-year-old self (Walker Scobell) for a mission to save the future. The movie is packed with loads of funny moments as well as serious toned and action packed, definitely a ride worth taking.I throughly enjoyed checking this one out, Netflix don't always put out great content they sure did with this one. A very strong Spielberg type of feeling to it, very fantastic.Highly Recommend! I really did enjoy it.

title: Decent movie with expected scenes
text: I watched the movie at sunday night, I especially waited until sunday because I wanted give myself a treat. I was expecting more outdoor scenes rather than studio with fake elements. It is decent overall, maybe 7-ish. Oh, if you don't like Ryan Reynolds, there is 2 Ryan Reynolds in here(not Adam type).

title: It was okay.
text: Although I'm not typically a fan of family sci-fi adventure comedies, this one really managed to captivate me. The main character, Adam, played by Ryan Reynolds, is a pilot from the future who travels through time and crashes in 2022. He enlists the help of his 12-year-old self to repair the future. Reynolds's usual performance style is well-suited to this movie. The child actor who plays young Adam is quite amusing, and their interactions are enjoyable. Zoey Saldana and Mark Ruffalo also deliver powerful performances despite their limited screen time. While the plot can be a bit confusing, it's still understandable. The movie's tone is consistently appropriate, and the humor is genuinely funny. Additionally, the action sequences are impressive. However, some of the computer-generated effects, particularly those used to de-age Catherine Kenner's character, are less than satisfactory. The film's antagonist, Kenner, is an unusual villain with poorly developed motivations, and her army is unremarkable. Nevertheless, this movie is a well-crafted and enjoyable Netflix production.

title: Perfect
text: I loved this time travel movie. It had the perfect amount of action, science, comedy, sentiment, and love. Ryan Reynolds is fun as ever in this role, and his younger counterpart, played by Walker Scobell, is as well. Zoe Saldana, Jennifer Garner and Mark Ruffalo complete the cast with beautiful performances. Catherine Keener is phenomenal in her roles as well. I enjoyed every moment of this fun movie.

title: A fun, sweet movie
text: Hey, it's not an award winner, but the premise is wonderfully imaginative. Everyone holds there own in this breezy, sweet movie. The CGI wasn't great, but despite that, and a bit of a slow start, I think the cast had fun and wanted its audience to a little fun as well. It was nice to watch a movie that didn't take itself too seriously - for a change.

title: Boooring
text: A boring film without any real depth. The stage that is set would have had a lot of potential, but this is not exploited. Instead, it seems that this movie is trying to keep the average Netflix viewer hooked on paying the monthly subscription. CGI is atrocious.

title: Feel good movie
text:
Although the story isn't really original,
it's a lovely movie to watch.Has everything a feel good movie must
have, but Ryan Reynolds makes it fun
for all ages. The young kid played well
also, had to check Idmb if he wasn't a son from Ryan: he's believable as the young version.

title: Fun and watchable
text: I would probably give this 6 or 6.5, but I bumped it up because sci-fi and time travel movies are usually underrated.It starts out fun. Most of the dialogue and humour rides on Ryan Reynolds playing his Deadpool-style character that he always does now.The movie takes a nosedive when Zoe Saldana appears, but thankfully that section isn't too long. It improves when Mark Ruffalo arrives and comes to a heartwarming conclusion.It's nothing groundbreaking; it basically treads a familiar ground trod by most movies aimed at a young audience nowadays but I appreciate the fact it's not another sequel or remake. They've at least tried to make something new instead of cashing in on an established name.

title: Very meh.
text: Fun for one watch but that's pretty much it. Great nostalgia but otherwise rushed and falls flat. It made me pretty much feel nothing! I think it would be more fun to watch in a family setting with young kids on a movie night.

title: THE ADAM PROJECT - SUPER ENTERTAINING
text: Actually I gave it 15 stars, but low and behold, IMDb only allows 10 ... SUCKERS!I watched this movie for what it was meant to be, an entertaining movie, no more, no less, it's really stupid and assanine to spend 1:46 Mins pulling a movie apart looking for social redeeming values or for some lesson that's not there, then trash the movie when it doesn't meet your expectations. How in hell can you take Ryan Reynolds seriously, he's comic who tried to act, some time he's pretty good and make (again) entertaining movies.I read a review by some nimrod moron who is trying to compare The Adam Project to a movie project Steven Spielberg may have produced, by calling this movie DULL! title: Chemistry for the Time-Travelling Duo
text: Another time-travel adventure where you shouldn't worry about the science too much, The Adam Project is a fun film following Reynolds' signature character well-mimicked by his younger 'self'. The quick wit between the duo works well as a double act, without ever being hilarious, and the additional top-billed cast members all flesh out the wider backstory. Some relatively glaring goofs in the face of the 'science' (/magnets) towards the end, but that doesn't take away from a plot dipping into more emotional family relationships. The deepfake de-aging for the villain isn't so easy on the eye, though.

title: Disappointing mix of readymade recipes
text: Take a bunch of recipes from what some algorithms returned from analyzing commercially (not artistically) successful features in Hollywood movies, shake it and there you got the new remix. Cheap entertainment with some gross humour, some cheesy romantic scenes, caricatural characters without depth, glossy droids that die from a single bullet, everything smooth and without much originality or personality. I saw craft without the art and soul. A disappointing experience. Good films are rare. The establishment likes consumers, they consume and forget and consume again and forget again... to do their revolution. Such superficial movies without profound reason to be won't surely teach a viewer something new, something useful, something worth their precious time. I don't need a plethora of special effects to be told an interesting and touching story about characters I care about. The economy of means, the unseen can be even more powerful.

title: Lovely
text: If you like Ryan Reynolds (you do because you would'nt read this if not) you will like this movie. If you also like the imagination of time travel you will love this movie... I was waiting for it and worried about disappointment..but it's just lovely.Edit: I would give more Stars after the second time watching it..

title: I gave it a shot
text: But I couldn't stand that insufferable child. Ryan Reynold plays himself. Again. I lasted about 20 minutes but then I gave up. Yet another Shawn Levy masterpiece. What a hack.

title: Time travelling shenanigans done right or does it just not make sense?
text: Time travelling shenanigans done right or does it just not make sense?Synopsis: A boy by the name of Adam is met by his future self and is told of a future where time travel is controlled but will they be able to save time as we know it or will they fail at succeeding?Story 3/5:Admittedly when I first saw the trailer to this movie with Ryan Reynolds doing his same schtick and the concept of time travel being overdone in recent years, I was hesitant that the story would keep me invested. I can report back and say whereas the story is a bit too overfamiliar, it is interesting enough for it to keep you entertained from start to finish. It's nothing too special and it does have some plot holes that are never fully explained but you don't need that fine tuning for it to be a film you can throw on and have a good time. The movie does have essences of Steven Spielberg films like E. T. and Ready Player One with its tone and atmosphere and these were clear inspirations for the director Shawn Levy (Free Guy, Night at the Museum). These inspirations do elevate the movie but obviously doesn't have as much of an impact as a Spielberg movie.Acting 4/5:This movie has an all star cast including Ryan Reynolds (Deadpool, Free Guy), Mark Ruffalo (Thor: Ragnarok, Spotlight), Zoe Saldana (Guardians of the Galaxy, Avatar), Jennifer Garner (Elektra, Yes Day) and a stand out performance from Newcomer Walker Scobell who has a bright future ahead of him. Scobell was able to capture my attention straight away with the witty delivery of his lines and the range of emotions he is able to portray. Ryan Reynolds (even though he was being his usual kooky self) was entertaining as usual and even Jennifer Garner (who seems to be a little bit more popular now) is able to shine in many parts throughout. With these big named actors, you would expect a certain level of gravitas to their performance and each and every actor seems to be having the time of their life, but there is one exception. Unfortunately, the villain, Maya played by Catherine Keener (Being John Malkovich, Get Out) felt out of place in a few scenes and this is not only due to the acting or script but down to some visual scenes in later portions of the movie which pull you out.Visuals 3/5:With that Segway, it brings me to the visuals which unfortunately are very hit or miss in my opinion. There are scenes which show off how far visual effects have come such as some of the brilliantly shot and choreographed hand-to-hand fighting sequences but there are also scenes which feel like it is a very early 2000's film and unfortunately looks more like game graphics (it would be perfectly placed in something like a halo game). There are even moments where it gets too close to uncanny valley for me and that pulls you out of the movie at the wrong moments. There are also very recycled visual elements that we have seen done better in other films and there are certain aesthetics that look to familiar (there's that word again).Editing 3.5/5:The cohesiveness of the scenes and the fast paced nature of how the scenes were edited makes this movie feel like a theme park ride. With the movie having a great mixture of action, emotion and drama, the pace never felt like it pumped the breaks and this was a great way to tell this particular story. I was never bored and loved how some of the fight sequences were edited, to the point where you felt very involved and could see every single hit. As mentioned earlier, with some of the visuals being lacklustre it impacted the overall editing in how some scenes were put together (I can't imagine how hard it must have been to edit some of the visual effects heavy sequences).Sound 2.5/5:Unfortunately, the score by Rob Simonsen (Ghostbusters: Afterlife, The Spectacular Now) was very generic and unmemorable and wasn't as hard hitting as you needed the soundtrack to be in certain scenes. With this being the weakest part of the movie, it doesn't mean it was a train wreck. Some of the sound mixing for the weapons and the ships were great and the impacts and explosions in the action sequences were well realised.Summary:All in all this was a fairly decent movie with a recycled storyline but with some amazing talent, especially Walker Scobell but it didn't have enough scope and interesting enough plot lines to make this a memorable enough project.Overall score: 3.2/5.

title: Watch it for the young Adam
text: A decently good movie with some really cool dialogues. Watch the movie for the young Adam who has been the best amidst all big actors. An extra point for him alone.

title: I'm seeing double here... four Adams!
text: To say that Shawn Levy and Ryan Reynolds' second collaboration is surprisingly good isn't exactly showering it with praise. After all, their previous collaboration was 'Free Guy (2021)'. Yet, it's worth noting that the flick is genuinely better than I expected it to be. 'The Adam Project (2022)' is by no means great, and in fact borderlines on being just fine for its majority, but it's also by no means bad. It's no secret that Reynolds' particular brand of endless yapping is starting to wear thin for a lot of people, myself included. Here, though, he's slightly less annoying than usual because he's working from a screenplay that actually affords him something deeper to work with. His immature, cynical and insecure underpinnings give his motormouth an almost tragic touch, and the flick knows when to rein him in to allow its emotion to outperform its comedy. That emotion is actually where the affair is at its most successful, too. It mines its time travel premise for almost all it's worth, not only commenting on the differences between its lead character's wide-eyed yet still snarky younger self (played to almost mirror-image perfection by Walter Scobell) and his emotionally scarred older version but also putting quite a bit of focus on both of their relationships with their parents. There's a scene between Reynolds and Jennifer Garner which feels like it's ripped straight out of a far more mature tearjerker. The emotional elements grant credence to the sillier science-fiction and out-of-the-blue action, making sure that the film is at least watchable for its entire runtime. Despite some pacing issues, the picture can be a fair bit of fun when it gets going. It's only ever so successful, but it's enjoyable enough for what it is. I just have to warn you, though: it features what's easily the most unsettling example of digital de-ageing I've ever seen. I mean, it's truly horrifying. Other than that, though, this is a fairly fun family friendly farce with an unexpected amount of emotional weight.

title: Nothing new but well done
text:
I liked the movie. It was fast paced as they get to the point within the first 10 minutes. It didn't have too many sappy drama scene which seep into this kind of movies. The banter between the two leads and later with Mark Ruffalo was quite good(which I hate in most Ryan Reynolds movies recently).The plot isn't new but there are some cool scenes that separate this one.Biggest drawback-Bad CGI and VFX
Deaging Catherine Turner digitally was the worst. The whole room where the final act takes place has Spy Kids era feel. I can see why all this happened. You have four A-List stars who take the budget and about a year to add the effects. It could be worse.

title: How are people taking this movie so serious and rating it on science?!
text: The movie was good, light, humorous!Honestly feels weird to see people giving the movie low scores based on science or a not deep enough story...It's an adventure family movie, c'mon guys...Yes the story isn't that deep but does it really have to be an 'interstellar' movie?What it lacks in deep story it more then makes up for it due to the typical humoristic Ryan Reynalds acting/dialogue and the kid that actually did a real terrific job playing younger Ryan!Music score main theme is also on point.Solid 8/10.

title: It was ok. Funny.
text: I watched Rey talk about this movie in his interview with David letterman and i got curious. He spoke with so much passion.He is a funny guy he did not disappoint on that. The movie has a good amount of humor. That was well executed.I am a marvel fun and i think i benchmarked this with. Dr strange movie's. I was impressed by the plot . He did just fine but...

title: Umm.. Meh..
text: Boring... Then too much cgi, too much green screen, too many sassy jokes. Not enough character development, no originality, not much sense. But the worst of it all is the fake Catherine Keener. I mean what the hell was that?? Ummm... No thank you!

title: This project is successful.
text: After achieving success with last year's Free Guy, director Shawn Levy and star Ryan Reynolds collaborated again on Netflix's new sci-fi movie, The Adam Project. The Adam Project mercifully doesn't get bogged down in time travel mechanics, wasting little time to get the two Adams together on their journey.Reynolds is reliably embodying an onscreen persona audiences are familiar with, though he is given moments of emotional sincerity to help flesh the character out. In terms of sci-fi action, The Adam Project doesn't reinvent the wheel (though there are some neat visuals and concepts). What makes it click is the strength of the characters and their personal stories, getting viewers invested in what's happening onscreen.The Adam Project is a thoughtful, witty mash-up of all the movies from my childhood. Ryan Reynolds is on top form as Adam, while Walker Scobell matches him punch for punch with a great debut performance.My Rating : 8/10.

title: Fun, family friendly, action/comedy
text: Ryan Reynolds is making a nice living, not only is he on the "A" list for such films as DEADPOOL and FREE GUY (a wonderful film that you have to check out if you haven't seen it), He is also popping up in charming action/comedy films that go straight to Streaming on Netflix. Following the fun romp that was RED NOTICE (with Gal Gadot and Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson), he is back in the Shawn Levy helmed THE ADAM PROJECT.And while this film is not doing anything special, nor will it be nominated for any kind of awards, it is a fun, entertaining way to spend a couple of hours.Family friendly, THE ADAM PROJECT, stars Reynolds as...you got it...Adam. A time traveling pilot who goes back in time to find his father - the inventor of time travel - and stop him. Along the way, her runs into his younger self, his mother and a very important person from Adam's past...or rather...future...or...You get the idea, it's a time travel movie, so I wouldn't get too caught up in "the rules" or dig too deeply into the plot.Reynolds, of course, is charming as pilot Adam, ready with a laser gun and a quip. His quick wit and snappy banter is reminiscent of many, many other roles that Reynolds has played...and that is okay. He is joined by his younger self (dubbed Small Adam) who is played as a young Ryan Reynolds mimic very well by newcomer Walker Scobell. To be honest, Scobell is annoying early on in this film - and that is on purpose - for what is charming in the adult Reynolds is really annoying in a 12 year old.Jennifer Garner (Mom), Mark Ruffalo (Dad) and Zoe Saldana (mysterious person from Adam's past...I mean...future) are "professional" in their respective roles, bringing the right amount of whatever their character needs at the moment. Finally, surprisingly, indie film icon Catherine Keener is very good as the "bad buy" in this piece.All of this is handled deftly by Shawn Levy (NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM). His track record shows that he knows how to do these family friendly, action/comedy/adventure films and he does not disappoint here. He moves things along at a brisk enough pace to keep all interested while throwing in comedy and snappy banter along the way.All-in-All, a very fun way to spend a couple of hours - certainly a good way to spend a crisp Spring evening whilst waiting for the warmer weather to arrive.Letter Grade: B+7 1/2 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: A solid sci-fi adventure
text: The duo from "Free Guy" Shawn Levy and Ryan Reynolds is back togheter again. This time in the new Netflix movie The Adam Project.The Adam Project turned out to be a very solid Sci-fi adventure. The visuals looked great, the music was also very good and it had some great comedy. The Chemistry between old adam (Ryan Reynolds) and young Adam (Walker Scobell) is really good and becomes one of the highlights of this movie. The vilain of this movie was Kinda bland and boring, and the story wasn't that great and left a lot more to be desired. But overall it was a pretty fun sci-fi movie. Way better than i expected it to be.

title: TOO MUCH REYNOLDS MAY NOT BE A GOOD THING...!
text: A Netflix original from earlier this year starring Ryan Reynolds. Jennifer Garner has her hands full w/her precocious, motor-mouthed son, Walker Scobell, as he's gotten into trouble in school (definitely a repeat offender). We find out his dad has died some time before & Garner hasn't really broached the subject of closure over her husband's passing which explains the continued tension in their relationship. Later the same night Reynolds shows up skulking around the forest surrounding Scobell's home being pursued by some toughs led by Catherine Keener in futuristic aircraft. We find out Reynolds is in fact Scobell's future self hoping to go further back into the past to prevent his father, Mark Ruffalo, from creating the time traveling tech which we'll learn will be used towards nefarious ends. Hoping to right the wrongs he perpetrated due to his father's absence, Reynolds mission is usurped by his younger self & by extension his mouth (the typical Reynolds' schtick) which completely dilutes the heartwarming homilies director Shawn Levy (A Night at the Museum/Real Steel) is hoping to put across. You know your film's heading in the wrong direction when you hope your lead will just shut up for a second. Also starring Zoe Saldana (frankly wasted!) as Reynolds' future girlfriend.

title: A PERFECT 10+ family movie!
text: It's only March 2022, just finished Best summer movie in awhile. Great casting and story line, will definitely watch again. Thank you NetFlix!Not sure why this movie get some lower then 6 rating. But it's a 10+ from my wife and I. Disregard poor rating, just enjoy this action comedy and heartwarming movie and you will agree with me that it's a 10+ThaiGuy2504.

title: Decent blend of sci-fi, comedy and drama
text: Released as a Netflix film opposed to theaters, this film is quite a solid and overall entertaining piece of film.It starts off intriguing, stalls a little in the middle and has an interesting conclusion. The cast do solid work. Ryan Reynolds plays a character in which he has done many times, although he is a little more toned down here.What was slightly unrealistic is his character is from the year 2050 and technology and the overall landscape looks far more futuristic. Do they believe that in 28 years years that is how they think the future would resemble (film takes place in 2022). The attire of the assassins look nice but not much detail was on how once they got attached, they would dissolve into bright colors and fade away. Are we to believe these weren't humans? They could have explain a little more of the origins.The ending was slightly disappointing and anti climatic which lowers the rating as a whole. Otherwise solid film for the time being and it seemed to be a success for Netflix but it feels like maybe this film may be sort of forgotten. Although it is a film which will make people question about their past and future and possibly have a certain nostalgia affect.

title: Shalliw written Hollywood drivel
text: Attempt at a compelling time travel.plot falls hard on it's face and gets completely implausible in about 15 min. Marc Ruffalos I'm a smart scientist guy act that he copied from his marvel movies is insanely one dimensional and actually makes the movie worse. Why hurt Ruffalo, he makes things much worse.

title: Great movie
text: This sci-fi movie has everything in it. A jar of comedy, a table spoon of action, a pinch of romance. Overall recipe for a great watch. Highly recommend.

title: Solid movie from Reynolds
text: Being honest, Ryan Reynolds has done some real crap of late, 6 underground, Red Notice and the Hitmans Wife's Bodyguard.This though is actually a film I can recommend to people.It's well made, funny and has good action scenes. I may have had a tear in my eye at the end, may have.

title: Watchable but nothing new!
text: I love Ryan Reynolds and Mark Ruffalo ! The acting was good especially the little version of Ryan Reynolds! Besides that the concept I find, is wearing thin! I'm a huge sci-fi fan and found that this was more a father/son relationship drama than sci-fi! Nevertheless it was reasonably good and watchable but I rate movies by how often I can watch them over and over again and this is not one of them! Still love you Ryan and can't wait for your next performance!

title: The Importance of Time Travel
text: I always dig Time-Travel movies, and this one is okay. A fun "EscapeReality" distraction. Ryan Reynolds has his usual charm that you look for when watching his films.

title: A charming, gimmicky, sci-fi Reynolds style flick.
text: I know Ryan Renyolds and his style isn't for everyone, but if you're a fan of his then you'll absolutely enjoy this movie. Jam packed with crude humor, action and touching family sequences, this film hits every note of a watch worthy Netflix original.

title: Nice family values; too many expletives
text: The whole thing was a bit corny but the overall message of the importance of family motivated me to give it a 6. Otherwise, way too much cursing considering the co-star was only 12 years old. Also, Ryan Reynolds was the same, well, Ryan Reynolds from every movie he's in. Smart mouth, wise-cracking, funny guy. Some woke elements but mostly toned down - thankfully. Had an issue with understanding how in a mere 25 years we discover time travel and jet ship cloaking. Lastly, so good to see Ruffalo and Garner together again. Loved them in "13 going on 30!"

title: Surprising Simply Entertaining
text: All I can say is that this movie is simple to enjoy and surprisingly entertaining.We can enjoy simple scifi, simple drama, simple action and simple comedy well played by All the cast. Just enjoy it.

title: Needed More Time
text: This is an enjoyable movie that's casts a wide net to get as much of an audience as possible. The net just has too big of holes in it, so a lot of the audience falls through it instead of being ensnared. Is this a children's movie? The look of the CGI seems to suggest it along with the main character being a child, but the continuous cursing seems to suggest it's an adult movie. It's obviously SciFi centered around time travel, but then it makes a push for drama but having very silly, cheesy moments that could undermine it. At times it does each of these different things well, but it also felt a bit unfinished. Parts of the CGI were great and others looked more like Shark Boy and Lava Girl. The fight scenes were cool, but several parts you can tell it's coreographed and doesn't feel real. It just didn't quite all come together. But if you want a fun evening with some action, drama, and storytelling, then this will fill that purpose well. It just won't leave you amazed.

title: It's getting tedious
text: First off, I like Ryan Reynolds. I think he's probably a pretty good person in real life, and in that regard, I have a lot of respect for him. But I'm tired of seeing Ryan Reynolds play Ryan Reynolds in movies. He's the same guy every time. And no amount of Ryan Reynolds could make this (or Free Guy, or Red Notice) into a good movie.

title: the ratings are too low hence I gave it a 10
text: Must better than expected. Forget logic , forget academy awards but... this movie has good cgi, is funny, well edited, great sound effects, aome nice suprises, very well enjoyable and the dialogue is actually very good. Highly worth watching.

title: An alright family film
text: This is a good movie to watch with the family if you're after an easy watch with some laughs and rounded story line. However, what this film falls short of is anything that is fast paced to keep us on our toes. At times we had ourselves wondering when it was going to finish and pausing it to get drinks. This is nothing to say the acting was bad - the acting was great. It was the writing that let it down by having too much dialogue that made you feeling a tad empty. All in all, a good film, but could've gone through a few more drafts before filming.

title: Just Another Ryan Reynolds Movie
text: At this point you are either all in for all things Ryan Reynolds, or you are sick of his same old schtick. And if you are in the latter category, this isn't going to be the film to win you over to Reynold's comedy ways. For that, I would recommend Steven Levy's and Reynolds other partnership "Free Guy". But if you are a fan of Reynolds and his quippy, 4th wall breaking comedy, then you should like this film just fine.The film has decent effects and good performances from each of its stars and has some good moments of heart filled life lessons. The film feels like it is genuinely trying.On the negative side, it feels like every person is written to be the same quippy smart Alec as Reynolds. It makes sense for young Adam to act the same. But when Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner and Zoe Saldana are all making the same types of jokes, they kind of lose their impact, and characters lose their identity.Newcomer Walker Scobell does a good job in the role, but his character just ended up getting on my nerves most of the time. The movie also has two stock bully characters that are just inserted in the movie for the sake of being stock bully characters. But, throughout the story, I did find myself laughing a handful of times. The action, although completely bloodless and child friendly, didn't leave me disoriented or confused.The movie has a finale that doesn't make much sense when you think about it for more than 4 seconds. And ends off with me wondering if any of the characters have improved from the beginning of the story, and whether any audience member has improved from watching this movie.

title: Not the greatest movie but heh, it got a big budget.
text: The movie is rather fun but the characters are a bit boring and the movie itself is a bit empty. The plot is basic and it's an enjoyable movie but if you want movies that are for the whole family, choose comedy. Jim Carrey, Will Ferrell and more are better in every point than this lazy action movie. Ryan Reynolds and mark ruffalo are good though. The plot is really boring. But the budget is great, and I think that it's cool for kids to see a movie with a fun idea, it's like a kid made an idea and Hollywood took it and put millions in it, to be more precise, it's a 6,4 out of ten, but it's still a good movie.

title: Sometimes it pays to be a nerd.
text: A Netflix Original following a time traveling pilot who enlists his younger self to help save the future! All the lead performances are great, especially from Walker Scobell who holds his own opposite Ryan Reynolds. The production value, soundtrack, and direction are all top notch. It moves at a brisk pace, fitting in cool visuals and emotional moments when it can, but I think the plot had much more potential.

title: Predictable and pleasant
text: If you're looking for a relaxing movie with no plot twists and predictable ending, The Adam Project is for your. You've probably seen it all before and can figure out what's going on in the first 15 minutes.This is Ryan Reynolds at his finest: corny humor, action and not much sense.

title: Great
text: I like the movie, it is great, but at the same time it is not the best movie that I ever seen. It has a interesting plot and I really like Ryan Reynolds's, and that is kind of why I watched it, so that's great but except from that there wasn't anything special. But it is great.

title: Hilarious
text:
All the bad reviewers. Stop overthinking it and just enjoy the funny film. Duh...
I absolutely love love this movie but I'm just babbling on now the fill the requested word count.The end.

title: Passable way to spend an evening
text: The movie is nothing special. It's Ryan Reynolds being himself with some amusing quips.The story doesn't make a lot of sense, but it's time travel... and they rarely do.I wouldn't go out of my way to watch it again and there are plenty of films that are more worthy of your time.But it's ok... just ok.

title: Netflix trash again
text: Netflix did to movies what American Idol did to music. So sugary sweet you can feel your teeth rot while watching it. Hollywood is near dead. No more good movies that move and entertain you. The on,y outlet left for good entertainment is HBOMAX and even they have been slacking a bit but still better than anything else. I hate this new generation of "filmmakers". Almost everything sucks and Netflix is the King of this trash.

title: A new Amblin movie!
text: Fantastic! Loved every minute! Like a new Amblin movie! Action, fun, heart, moving, Ryan Reynolds, Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner, Zoe Saldana, lightsabers! What more do you want!

title: boring
text: It got boring real fast, and it was tiring. There is no scene with the world in the future. There were a bunch of "soldiers from the future" with outdated armor and weapons, chasing Ryan Reynolds, who swats them no problem, the fight scenes are just skip skip skip.Then Ryan Reynolds meets himself as a child and it's just empty scene after empty scene and vapid advice like "be nice to your mom", "don't drink beer until you're 21".And then the antagonist, the evil mind is a bland auntie sitting around in a cape doing her best to look menacing but she's just boring, pushed into the screen with no introduction, no build up, she looks like a nice lady who went shopping and was abducted by aliens and they're using her body.And there's "chases".. they're running in a car, from a fighter jet that can hover, walk, tip tope, sneak, dance.. and they talk, talk, talk, oh man.. the whole movie is like 2 hours of talking:Ryan Reynolds talks to himself as a child.Ryan Reynolds talks to Zoe Saldana.Ryan Reynolds talks to his mom.Ryan Reynolds talks to his pop.Ryan Reynolds talks to his evil antagonist.Ryan Reynolds talks to his evil antagonist's left hand, dude with scar.The fights look just like in Matrix 4, the FX look like in Matrix 4. That strong CG feel of CG environment, CG buildings, CG weapons, CG particle accelerator energy generator, CG jet fighter.

title: Better than average, barely
text: Its a fun film and RR always gives a good comedic performance. Nothing serious or mind-blowing and its not boring. These days I'll take that over the 80% of the garbage Hollywood is pumping out.

title: Turn off your brain first...
text: Unfortunately we get little more than a candy-shell sci-fi coating on top of an action rom-com here. Despite that it's still worth a viewing when you've re-watched all the Star Trek episodes that deal with time travel and can't force yourself to forget what happens.The visuals were actually decent and we got a few new toys to look at.Plot holes you could drive a truck through, nonsensical science babble, and cheap laughs and emotional scenes...too bad...

title: The story was about ... ehm?
text: I looked forward to watch the film because of the cast. But immediately after watching I realize the plot already vanished in thin air. Nothing to remember ..

title: Wholesome good film
text: All you nerds commenting on if it's real or real like, you're dumb. It's about time travel, time travel does not exist. Stop being so literal and watch the movie for what it is, entertainment. It was an incredibly entertaining film! Worth the watch even without the real science behind it. Some people just like to suck the joy out of life!

title: Nothing special, nothing realistic
text: Just one another movie about time travel without any actual science behind it. Well, they background all this stuff by worm-holes or something like that but still everything looks pretty like magic, not science.If you have some popcorn, beer and just want to relax, just watch some characters fighting some other characters with an obvious final without even a piece of worrying for any one of them, then go ahead and watch the movie. If you're trying to find something really interesting, something leaving you thinking about it for a couple of days, then don't waste your time. This movie isn't what you're looking for.

title: It was written in a hurry
text: I guess the writers and director didn't thought it through. There was a rush in the making and a rush in the film. The sci-fi logics were absurd. It's like wild west. They've put a theory as they seem fit. No logic whatsoever. And what's up with the young Maya's face!! I haven't seen that much low-graded VFX in a very long long time.How many times Ryan will keep selling Deadpool? All of his characters feel like same. Do less, talk more and put some idiotic humour. Voilaaaaa..... It had great potential if they could set some strong logic behind the sci-fi events.

title: Sci-fi fun
text: The Adam Project is a really enjoyable watch. It has the right combination of action, sci-fi and comedy, and hits right in the feels. There great acting from Walker Scobell who does an absolutely amazing job as young Adam.

title: Back To The Future 4
text: Amazing production quality and decent acting, but I just couldn't get fired up about this movie. It's missing some kind of core. Watching this movie is like eating a churro and 10 minutes later you're hungry again.

title: Pretty much a clone of Timecop only nowhere near as good
text: This film was advertised as a Back to the Future homage but it's much closer to Jean Claude Van Damme's 1994 movie Timecop in plot, story and character.Ryan Reynolds is yet again playing exactly the same character he always plays whilst Mark Ruffalo is stuck with a rather thankless role as a hidebound scientist {seriously.... The refusal to hear what Ryan is trying to tell him gets old fast and should have been cut down by a good minute.}.Jennifer Garner's barely in it and after one of the best scenes in the film completely disappears never to be mentioned again.Zoe Saldana is playing yet another Mary-Sue trope {can we please stop this Hollywood - Strong Female Characters can exist without being PERFECT!} but luckily she also isn't in the movie for very long so doesn't hurt it too badly.The finale is probably the weakest part of the movie although the coda runs it close.All in all; a decent time-waster but nothing more.5/10.

title: Nothing original here, but loads of fun anyway.
text: Nicely done family flick with Ryan Reynolds being Ryan Reynolds, which is awesome if you are RR fan. Well cast, nicely paced sci-fi flick with some very cool cg imagery.Wasted on the small screen. Should have been on the big screen instead of the current 'The Batman' garbage.

title: There is a lot wrong with the time travel and physics...
text: I'll just say that a time paradox is not something the writers seem to understand. Add that to a truck that gets flipped from explosives which magically stops forward momentum + a 12 y.o. Not getting thrown around and seriously hurt inside a jet doing flips and rolls AND you have a movie that loses my attention and borders on absurd. It was a nice try but they really got some things noticeably wrong which takes anyone paying attention out of the "moment."

title: Fun but not big plot
text: Sometimes was a little boring with drama moments but for a Netflix film it was very good!I love all the actors bad the young Adam was great! Just was missing a little bit more sparkle and more informations about the plot. CGI was nicely made for the kind of movie and the director made a good to watch movie!

title: Best film I have had the pleasure to enjoy in awhile.
text: I have rarely left a review for most movies that I watch. But I really felt that I had to for this one. This movie hit the feels in the right spots, but it also had a fun and sarcastic undertone throughout the whole movie that left it fun filled throughout the entire endeavor. I truly feel that Mark Ruffalo and Ryan Reynolds are a great team and the child actor that I have not taken the time to look up the name that played the young Ryan Reynolds character also did an amazing job. I really enjoyed this movie and hope that movies moving forward will be more like this one.

title: Low Budget Back to the Future
text: Every single Ryan Reynold movie is the same, and this once is the worse since Green Latern.Poor build up, poor mid, poor finishing. Zero Story. Come on, i am only typing this much becos i have to Hit 150 characters. But i really don't want to waste my time a movie that is so poorly developed.Seems like Ryan Reynold is stick in Deadpool character, and he cannot act any role withour referencing Lines from Deadpool."SUPERHEROE LANDING?" Is that not from deadpool?

title: Banana Smokin' Awesomeness!!!
text: I laughed. I cried. I fell asleep with my eyes open (not really). I didn't know what to expect with this movie, but I enjoy anything with time travel, quantum mechanics, and/or field generating wormholes... so. 10/10.👍

title: Could have been better, a kids film that kids won't really follow
text: The distribution between voting for males and females is very telling. Young males rated most highly, and older females; whereas older males and younger females voted much lower score...As an older male, I wasn't sure who this is really directed at. With the kid being the main character, and that people just burst into a glow of light when killed, it suggests a solid kids flick. But then the plot becomes a convulted time travel plot that isn't particularly fulfilling.I enjoyed the cheesy but well produced action scenes, but the plot, whilst moving forward well, is pretty weak and not adequate for an adult audience. It really feels like a wasted cast, and could have been a great film with more emotional content and more sophisticated script. I expected it to be better, but really, if you're bored on a Sunday and are watching with a young male child, it will fill the time with fun and frolicks, but definitely forgettable.

title: Sound improper
text: Movie is Good. But u need to value up to hear the dialogue and have to volume down when curtains suspense background music starts. Background music is too loud. But hardly hear the people talking and the Dialoge of the Movie in ur normal range of tv volume. One always have to play with remote control volume +_+_+_+_that was so annoying.

title: Surface level but fun!
text: The Adam Project (2022) follows a time travelling fighter pilot Adam Reed, who accidentally crash-lands in 2022 and teams up with his 12-year-old self for a mission to save the future. This film is so fun and really heartwarming. I found it consistently entertaining and had a great time watching it despite its flaws.The cinematography of this film is pretty good! The camerawork used felt very professional and there's a lot of nice framing choices. I also really like the set design! In terms of visual effects, this film uses a lot of CGI. It's often used well and looks good, but nearer the end the filmmakers de-age certain actors with CGI and this unfortunately looks quite goofy.The sound design in the film is good, but nothing outstanding. The mixing is done well and clearly and the score is fitting to the tone. However, the score does get rather repetitive and unfortunately feels very forgettable.The actors all do a great job, but the standout is definitely Ryan Reynolds. I'm not always the biggest fan of his humour, but this movie had me laughing out loud often due to Reynolds' flawless line delivery. His character is so loveable and a fun protagonist to follow along. However, the villain isn't a strong enough character and isn't a believable threat, the character needed a lot more development.Lastly, the movie has a fun concept and follows a fairly basic structure, but this results in an easygoing and entertaining watch. The pacing is steady and consistent, and includes a lot of heartfelt and emotional moments.

title: Not a bad movie, but..
text: Decent movie, but first half of the movie was much better than the other half. It started pretty interesting, with good cgi and all. But then started Ryans jokes, which were mostly not funny at all. Zoe Saldana acted pretty bad in one scene. Car chase scene, cgi looked like from 2000 movie.Trailer looked much better than the movie.

title: Adam Project
text: Ryan Reynolds plays well Ryan Reynolds and that's no bad thing, entertaining film with some good laughs, nice dose of action and Walker Scobell is excellent, definitely recommend this.

title: absolutely outstanding
text: I saw the trailer for this 2 days ago and I was counting hours till I could watch it. Ive been watching Ryan Reynolds for years and years. As they say, did that guy save the universe in another life? He is fabulous. Ms. Garner amazing and Mr. Ruffalo always smashing. Zaldana never disappoints. Walker Scobell amazing. Yep lots of typos but what a cast. I laughed I cried and Ill be watching it again. So much is said in this movie that just hits your heart. In a really beautiful fantastic way. Well done Mr. Levy and to everyone. Its now one of my favorites. Thank you all for making my night. Hats off to you all. Smashing job well done.

title: Was expecting more
text: I was expecting more than this, like the story keeps jumping from sci-fi to father-son moment. I dont know but i feel like it's lacking the story. Jennifer Garner's character is also lame. :(

title: Minimalistic Film About Nothing At All
text:
Decent action at times, visually appealing, great acting... but no plot.The narrative structure of the film essentially boils down:
There's no actual plot development, there's no twists, there's no 'AHA!' moment, there's none of that. It's a relatively simple story with multiple things happening with no actual background explanation given as to why these things are happening.The whole time travel thing is explained, but at the same time, the motivations for the antagonists are mystifying if not basic.There's really not much to the film, which is a great surprise considering Ryan Reynold's name is attached.

title: It's much more than a sci fi comedy
text: This story is a family constellation disguised as an enjoyable time travel adventure. It's one of those rare pieces that appear as thoug they were popular entertainment but carry meaningful and quality messages about life, family, expressing feelings, trauma and the way out of pain. It belongs to the category of Playing by Heart, Catch Me If You Can, The Adjustment Bureau, Interstellar, Vanilla Sky etc.Is it a perfect movie? Far from it. Is it enjoyable? Yes. Are there ideas in it that are worth letting in? Absolutely.Sometimes it's great to look beyond the first layer of things, the too obvious, the surface. This film is like that.

title: "2022 was a mistake"
text: A fun action time travel Ryan Reynolds movie. With the bonus of a mini Ryan, played really well. This tried to channel the same witty and soundtrack vibes as Guardians Of The Galaxy, with a node to the likes of E. T. but it somehow missed the mark of greatness.

title: who ever made this movie need therapy not a movie project
text: The most mediocre, corny, predictable sci-fi there is. It shows you a lot of money and a famous cast doesn't make a movie good. If this is what marvel movies look like i'll kill myself.

title: Passable but forgettable family sci-fi adventure
text: In director Shawn Levy's well-cast but average family sci-fi adventure "The Adam Project" Ryan Reynolds (likeable as ever tho not at his best) zaps back from 2050 (pursued by Catherine Keener & cronies) to his 12 yr old 2022 self Walker Scobell (meh) & mum Jennifer Garner, to try saving fellow-time traveller wife Zoe Saldana. The boys (and pursuers) then go back in time again to change the course of all their histories with the help of dad Mark Ruffalo. The four-strong (!) writing team hits their time-travel tropes (inc pop culture call-backs aplenty) & 'growing up' themes in a safe, watchable but wholly unremarkable way. It's passable, but also forgettable, fare.

title: No buts no why's
text: I liked it and I liked it a lot. A film is entertaining when from start to end keeps you on your seat, in this case (Netflix) couch. I liked it even better than free guy.

title: Fun Sci-Fi adventure that pulls on the heartstrings
text: After a botched time travel attempt land Adam Reed in 2022 he teams up with his younger self to complete his mission of saving the future.I enjoyed this film quite a bit and that is mainly because of how impressed I was with the character of Adam Reed. The movie takes both older adam and younger through this story of making amends with relationships in their lives. It's a really heartwarming emotional character story that's great to see.Ryan Reynolds plays the same character he has been for the last decade except this time his name is Adam Reed. Don't get me wrong I think Reynolds is a talented actor but his range of characters is very narrow.Walker Scobell plays the young adam and he does a really good job of making you buy into the fact that he is a younger Ryan Reynolds.Mark Ruffalo, Jennifer Garner, Zoe Saldana all did great with what they were given.The core issue I have with this film is the lack of development for most of the characters. This is a short movie which is nice and refreshing but it seems as though they set out to make a bigger movie than what they actually made.There was a couple of spots where the CGI needed to be cleaned up especially involving some deageing they did.I throughly enjoyed the action and was impressed with the choreography throughout. The plot was well paced and made sense throughout which is unusual for time travel films. The comedy was also great at definitely had me laughing out loud a few times.Overall this is a fun sci-fi adventure that pulls on the heartstrings at times. It does have some issue with character development but the action as well as the comedy makes fore a fun movie.7.5/10.

title: Sci-fi action comedy for the family
text: It's fun, and funny, but nothing serious. Worth watching and with Ryan Reynolds, it has the laughs you'd expect.Good special effects, and positive messaging, too.

title: Everything in entertainment
text: This movie has everything that entertainment is and should be. It has humor, believable yet fantasy, great special effects; family; life lessons, romance and a happy ending. Highly suggest it and will watch again.

title: For mamilies
text: Fun film for families, even if not very original or too memorable, the film manages to entertain and entertain throughout its duration without ever getting tired. The special effects are beautiful and the acting is very good. If you can make a note of course the film gets slightly knotted on some plot passages that are a bit messy, but this is normal in a film like this. Another small note must be made about Ryan Reynolds who has been playing characters all the same for some time.

title: Sadly, another old time travel movie with a new look
text: Understandably, Ryan Reynolds is totally milking his character with Deadpool pretty much dry.Fast talking, speed walking, fight acrobating usual run-of-the-mill SYFY movie that is fairly entertaining with a few big names for the main draw.... but really lacking originality that should have us on the edge of our seats.I know the rating may be a bit low, but it was just another mindless, and kinda mind numbing 2 plus hours of usual Netflix churn and burn.Nuff said.DK out.

title: Fun movie
text: I'm not sure I've ever seen Ryan Reynolds in a movie before, but I stumbled across this on Netflix the other night when I couldn't find anything that looked better, and I really enjoyed his performance. I was favorably impressed. As other people have pointed out, this is a family-friendly movie with some interesting twists on the time-travel plot, but maybe not the most original. The cast is good, and Reynolds has more charisma than I had expected. I might even watch it again. I liked the lack of CGI, which can me exhausting. With the glut of atrocious comic-book movies these days, The Adam Project is a lot of fun. I highly recommend it.

title: Another Ryan Reynolds attempt at trying to keep the fire burning.
text: Man time travels back in time in attempt to find out what happened to the woman he loves but due to a glitch, ends up in the wrong year with his 12 year old self.The story has a lot of potential and the several twists along the way were very good from a story telling perspective yet the biggest problem with the movie is that it Spoon feeds everything to the audience. This does not allow for a natural build up which would have kept the tension rising. The character build up is raced after the first quarter of the movie. Jennifer Garner had very little screen time and yet she made more of an impression on me than Ryan Reynolds or Mark Ruffalo put together.Also I am tired of Ryan Reynolds playing the same smart mouthed, slightly sarcastic and annoying character in every movie. It's like watching dead pool everywhere (6 underground, red notice). His comedy style is appealing yet overdone.The filming is good when it is not done on a sound stage. The chases and cgi spaceship battles satisfy though bring nothing new.The best part of the movie would probably be young Walker Scobell who awakened the kid within. His energy and comedic timing was enough to keep you from changing the channel.

title: Majeec!
text:
Why do people still confuse time travel with magic?Sure they throw in a few math equations and gibberish "oh quantumhumhum dingdinghon TIMETRAVEL!"There are movies and series that do time-travel "the right way" and don't add any magical properties to it, this is not one of those, this is among the thousands where they do it WRONG. Instead of labeling time travel a science, they should labeled it magic.Instead of a professor having discovered some math equation (or whatever) that lead to a machine being made that made time travel possible, they should had a monk reach enlightenment and discovered magic and discovered a highly advanced spell that gives you the ability to time travel, this movie would've been so much more realistic that way.Movie was good.Magic 4/10
Science 0/10.

title: Watchable fun
text: Ryan Reynolds is great and can do little wrong. The young actor playing the young version of him is perfect in role, great casting. A fun jaunt with little real substance, one for a lazy Sunday afternoon when you don't need brain ache.

title: A different, pleasant and entertaining film
text: It's a beautiful, pleasant film that makes you entertain, and you enjoy it fairly and it's laughing on your lips, because the film has a comedy atmosphere. It's very convenient to watch with the family, the special effects of the film are fairly good and you give a sense of a science fiction film, you shouldn't expect a lot of content, but it's good enough, it's a good option for entertainment, and the film is in a relatively quiet space that's a little bit inconsistent with science fiction movies, which is also a strong point of the film And there's the weakness.

title: Watchable generic Ryan Reynolds film
text: I call it a Ryan Reynolds film becuaee he is so typecast by now. The usual cheesy one liners we know from Free Guy and others.As a silly comedy its hard to believe the strong emotional scenes when its all so cheesy.But its fun and reasonably entertaining.Just a variety of scenes kind of quickly thrown together and Ryans one liners is just unoriginal and silly. Its ok. That's it.Doesnt deserve more than 6 stars.Formulaic action comedy.

title: Loved it!
text: This movie is honestly easily one of the most enjoyable and watchable sci-fi movies I've seen. The story was great and the scenes were amazing! Loved the actors and the end of the movie. Very good movie and i can recommended it to others to watch.

title: If You Like Ryan Reynolds...
text: There's plenty of cops, guns and bad guys movies available on Netflix. But if you want to watch time traveling good guys duel with light sabers, this movie is a must see.Mostly light hearted and fun to watch.

title: Amazing Movie 80s style!
text: Great 80's style movie, something from ET, yes it could have been a Steven Spielberg movie... the movie reminded me of my childhood and I love the 80's. The film has everything I could wish for, action, suspense, humor and, of course, emotional moments. I would even say this is the best Netflix movie there is! Thank you Netflix for this great movie!

title: A questionable movie with great actors
text: The movie begins with a grown up Adam (Ryan Reynolds) going back to his eleven year old self (Walker Scobell) in 2022 by accident when trying to go to 2018 to save his wife from a villain who happens to be his dead father coworker.We know that when Ryan Reynolds is in a movie there is going to be a lot of sarcasms and jokes. But usually his movies have a good storyline with a mildly interesting plot; well this is not the case. Don't get me wrong the movie is not bad, but is most certainly not great. The plot is filled with holes and, like every time travel movie, there are a lot of questions that remain unanswered. The lack of character work makes it impossible to create any connection with them, or even emphasize with them.But, at the same time it has is charm. We are used seeing Ryan as a sarcastic character, but credit is due to Walker Scobell in making such a great job impersonation a young version of him, it makes everything a little more interesting. Not to mention that the movie does what it was intended to do from the beginning, is movie meant to entertain; the movie is a swell diversion for a relaxed evening.It's not the best movie ever, and it won't change anyones life, but I had a great time watching it.

title: Your regular Reynold-Schtick that never ends
text: Listen folks - I like Reynolds like any other guy out there who watches and adores his movies but sometimes I cannot help but think that his sarcastic, witty-come back shtick is getting out of hand. This shtick may be synonymous with Deadpool because without sarcasm and come back what's deadpool got but I would really appreciate if Ryan Reynolds will just let this character to sleep and try something else for a change. We cannot condone as a viewer to this and subject to this ridiculous humor. It's getting tired and Reynolds if you are seeing this review or any of your buddies are - You are not funny. It's time for you to reinvent or just stop.Enough!!!!!Don't waste your time on this. You have watched the terrible Red Notice, you have watched this as well.

title: Watched this on my birthday
text: *) K Reviews *) ( ( Nothing special, just chose this to watch as i have nothing else to watch. Movie is good you can have a one time watch but this remindes me strongly of a similar kind of movie storyline which I can't seems to remember, maybe you'll get it after you have watched this movie.

title: GOOD IDEA. AVERAGE EXECUTING.
