text: I do not like to come up with action without good build up and let the character introduce him/her self as gap-filling from drama to slowing down without blinking !!I do like the actor performance however I can see better.\the punch scene was so bad.How come in 2022 we still produce movies with "Time-Traveling exist" sentence. We all know that is exist. At least in cinematography.

title: Light weight family fun movie
text: Forget about the action in this movie, it's basic and for kids, the main thing is the importance of time, which is the only resource we can't contain. Life is short, so try to make the best of it. The movie is good for almost any age, and is a nice way to pass an evening, probably you will not remember much of it the next day.

title: A fun Time!
text: I really liked this one! I can't resist a good time travel story and this one has some good time travel elements (even something in the second half I hadn't seen explored in a time travel story) along with some fun sci-fi and even some surprisingly sweet moments! Fun underrated movie from this year worth a watch!;)

title: Cool Time-Travel, basic Sci-Fi
text: Shawn Levy directed Free Guy (which starred Ryan Reynolds) and has now directed The Adam Project (also starring Ryan Reynolds). This film cuts to the heart of the important of family, and has enjoyable interactions between future Reynolds and his younger self from the past. The first two-thirds of this film are great, but the underwhelming/cliche climax does take away your final output of the movie. It's great to get invested with its fun ideas and interactions, but then dives into a very generic Sci-Fi ending that feels uninspired.

title: Netflix couldn't afford extras
text: Fun family film with lots of laughs and great moments. Predictable ending. Lack of extras to make the sets come to life. Limited background information on main characters. And a pantomime villian. 4.5 stars.

title: Brilliant.
text: If you like sci-fi, watch it. If you like action, watch it. If you like humour, watch it. I tend to be very picky but it's hard to find fault with this film. Acting, plot, effects, etc are all up there IMO.Can watch alone, with family, with partner, all good.I think to give this movie less than a 7 is exceedingly churlish and nitpicky. Beware such self-proclaimed critics who are only good at finding fault. Maybe this movie wasn't enough hollywood nonsense for them? Personally I found it a breath of fresh air, no agenda pushed on us, just a good adventure with largely likeable characters.Watch it without expectations and you shouldn't be disappointed. Enjoy!
I enjoyed this film, nothing to ride home about. However, it makes you feel all types of emotions that makes it a 6. Worth the watch for sure. Not as cheesy as Reynolds other films.

title: Not bad.
text: Not a bad time travel movie. A lot of tear jerkers. I just found it a bit far fetched for 2050. I mean maybe 2150. The kid in this was a smart butt and annoying. Very unrealistic. I enjoyed the movie though. The acting was good and the special effects. Emotional moments. Also really corny not funny banters that made it more of a comedy at some parts. I would recommend and suggest you give it a try. I rated it 6. I suggest you rate it as well because it was worth my time and i recommended it to my coworker as well. He said he is going to watch it too. Looking forward to hearing all reviews. Great website.

title: I loved it!
text: A great group if actors in a wonderful story! Ryan, Jennifer, Mark, Walker, Zoe and Catherine! I had to watch it a second time! I liked it that much! Enjoy this with an open heart!

title: Fun adventure
text: A fun film with some fun performances. Reynolds shines as always, but is more serious than his recent performances. Behind the exciting time travel plot is a deeper exploration of grief and regret. This is where the movie really shines and I wish it was explored a lot more.

title: Another time travel failure
text: It starts decently and goes downhill within five minutes. Reynolds, who used to be a likable actor, does yet another Deadpool version of himself, with endless unfunny jokes and maybe a couple of good ones.Playing the titular Adam from an allegedly awful 2050 he goes back to the past, trying to save the planet from that future and in the meantime, his wife Laura, too.Unfortunately Adam is attacked en route and ends up in 2022, 4 years after his target year 2018. Here we discover not only his annoying 12-yo version but also that his dad is the one who invented time travel and his evil associate Sorian the one who fu**ed up the future for the whole of humankind... what are the chances?I mean, one single person destroying hope for 8 billions seems kind of excessive, even if Sorian is a woman and nowadays women can do anything.Several factors make this a disaster, from the mix of multiverse and single universe, where more versions of the same person can coexist, at least for a while, to the awful and excessive CGI, to the fighting champions Laura and Adam and their inept assailants who despite numeric superiority attack one by one...And why exactly Adam wants to save his wife but not his dad? Two stars in memory of the actor Reynolds once was.

title: Sci-Fi nerds need to chill
text: This is a great Sunday afternoon comedy for the whole family.If you're a Ryan Reynolds fan, you'll love it.If you're sci-fi nerd looking to pick a movie apart, pick something else.

title: Great Comedy!
text: Had an amazing balance of emotion, action and comedy. The comedy was really good! Loved the "superhero landing" Deadpool reference! Has a solid beginning middle and end! Great movie to watch with family!

title: Predictable
text: One of the most predictable movies I've ever watched, but it wasn't too bad.Watch it if there's nothing else on. Marvel guys gotta get paid in their downtime.

title: Memory lane
text: Loved this movie for its mix of action, laughs and emotionThis is more than a space / time travelling romp or merely a stage for Ryan Reynolds to do him (although he does him really well again), deeper down it's about loss and wishing you'd said and done those things that your older self finds out, often too late.....Yes it's cheesy but it's not time wasted and I thoroughly enjoyed it from start to finish......maybe it appealed to my inner-child but......If you've ever lost someone and still carry them with you, make sure you have something to wipe the tears away because you will shed a few.....and you laugh and love the special effects.

title: Well, crap. Ryan Reynolds plays the exact same character.
text: I guess it's me, but Ryan Reynolds cannot seem to play any other character, other than the one-liner smart-ass he plays in EVERY MOVIE. It's the same person, different scripts, set, supporting cast; but his character never changes. Now I'm officially bored of Ryan Reynolds. Who by all accounts, seems like a very capable actor and genuine guy. This move was so cliche, brining and predictable I almost fell asleep.

title: Funny, heartwarming, interesting family flick
text: Our whole family really enjoyed this movie. Young Adam was awesome. Zoe Saldana was kick ass. My daughter loved her character. It's just a solid movie that's genuinely enjoyable. One I can see our family re-watching time and time again. Ryan Reynolds doesn't disappoint. But when has he ever!

title: Ryan Project
text: Great family movie with the usual lots of Ryan Reynolds one-liners you'd expect in any Ryan Reynolds movie. Storyline starts off great but peter's off to the typical Hollywood cliched time-travel styled ending. Strained when Mark Ruffalo turns up as if the writers changed, but you can't fault Ruffalo's acting as expected.Overall, funny and full of the expected type of action relating to its title, providing an entertaining 106 minutes.o.

title: Still not a Netlix success
text: I still do not understand why Netflix cannot make a good movie, even when they have Ryan Reynolds on board. This one had a good premise but just didn't deliver anything tangible. Just too bad.

title: For once a decent Netflix movie
text: Netflix is usually amazing on tv shows and terrible on movies. This movie has been on my watchlist for a while and I haven't watched it because I didn't want to waste my time with another bad movie, but this one is a good family movie and it's worth your time. A time traveler who goes back and meets his younger self needs to correct the timeline and find his missing wife. While nothing earth shattering here, it's a good movie that you can watch with the family. It even pulls on the heart strings as well. Ryan Reynolds is his usual snarky self but it works here. His younger self is cast well too.

title: A pretty fun film.
text: In my opinion the movie was a well layed down to earth Movie. Ryan Renolds was amazing and the kid that played younger Ryan was a good kid actor. I do wish they could of had Zoe in it longer but other than that the movie was pretty solid film.

title: Nothing more than an a fun film
text: They achieved what they wanted in this film, To make a simply fun family friendly time travel father to son movie. Good characters even though I would dip my head in acid if I see Ryan Reynolds in another Netflix original. Enjoyable and emotional scenes. Overall does what it wants too.Not Top tier film making just a fun movie I recommend watching it.

title: Fab family film, wonderful actors and acting
text: I watched this with my hubbie and we thoroughly enjoyed it. I love Ryan Reynolds. It's funny with Ryan's witty humour, action scenes are great and sci-fi is wonderful. The young man who plays the young Adam is a wonderful young actor he is very talented. Mark Ruffalo is another favourite of mine and as always fabulous.😊

title: An average 90's family, action movie...
text:
This is going to be THE quickest, no-frills movie review I've ever done...
This movie is average in every sense of the word; high school kid being bullied by bigger kid, whom he'd later be expected to get revenge upon, kid acting like an absolute tool, while at the same time constantly getting in trouble at school, because he's dealing with "something"... mum trying to reach said kid but can't get through to him, the kid MEGA IRRITATING with a gigantic mouth - that makes it impossible to feel an ounce of sympathy for him after the first knee-jerk, shock reaction, protective instinct to him being bullied - at which point you just wish that that little annoying thing will stop squealing back with some irritating smart-mouthed retort.He comes across as an obnoxious, stereotypically American show-off with a huge mouth!Basic 90's-esque action movie, from an era that we all love. One that is infinitely better than the decade that succeeded it; social-media made everything much worse.BAD CGI...This film evokes feelings of the 90's, particularly rich in love, family and simplification, which is only a good thing.Average movie, highly irritating protagonist, bad special effects, great feelings of the 90's, Jennifer Garner... GORGEOUS Jennifer Garner... gorgeous in every way.If she were mine, I'd NEVER let go.Affleck screwed up, and ended up with one the worst Jennifer's that there is, as punishment for his crimes... and now, all that's left for him is eternal punishment (with a high-maintenance headache of an arrogant, egotistical woman who refuses to age gracefully)
Poor Ben, that'll teach you!!Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha!!Oh, and... we love Ryan Reynolds. He's such a nice, wholesome guy. One whom we'd ALL love to be friends with, because you know that he's such a good guy. The same feeling you get from Michael B. Jordan.An average movie, that captures feelings of a bygone era - a time that was so simple and rich with love.

title: Mediocre
text: I really wanted this film to be good. It had one of my favourite topics (Time Travel) soundtrack and a great cast. Sadly the story line was disappointing. I couldn't tell if it was trying to be a comedy or a drama. I think this film goes in so many directions, it's convoluted and hard to follow. Sometimes keeping things simple like how they were in Back to the Future works. The Adam Project was too convenient and cliché. One guy somehow defeats an army and saves the world. I also knew somehow Maya was going to be killed and the villain conveniently gets killed, predictable and dull. This has to be the weakest time travel movie I have seen. Sadly a waste of a strong cast, this was one project that should have been dropped.

title: Adventure and Laughs
text: This movie made me laugh, cry, and sulk. What a great story this year! Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scoobel chose violence by choosing to break our hearts, minds, souls, and spirit. I miss my parents truly.

title: Funny one time movie
text: Sometimes funny, sometimes cute, sometimes stupid. The whole film does not leave the feeling that you have already seen it, that these jokes have already been.1 Wade Wilson of 5.

title: The Adam Project
text: Looking for his wife, Zoe Saldana in the past, top time travelling pilot Reynolds goes back in time and ends up where his young self lives and realises he has to stop time travel ever existing.Fun sci-fi family adventure featuring Reynolds on usual wise cracking duty, straying deeply into Back to the Future territory. Walker Scobell is impressive as the 12 year version of Reynolds and Mark Ruffalo the one who manages to ground everything a bit despite a half decent comic turn. Features the usual time travelling tricks, lots of visual effects and hey, it's fine.

title: Something borrowed, something blue
text: Another tired time travel tale. But oddly, it contains some overt rip-off's from Star Wars, right down to the light Sabre fight. Why? There's also a lot of gratuitous JC profanity that's completely unnecessary. It is not a bad movie in that it is mercifully short and has a few funny lines. Not a stand out picture though.

title: A nice movie to watch with family
text:
Fun comedy and entertaining film,
The film is not deep and uncomplicated with all that back in time things.Great comedy by Ryan Reynolds
The drama side is also present, an excellent performance from Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Gardner.Zoe Saldana finally showed her real face without all that tons of green makeup, she had few scenes in this movie but were impressive.Although the performance that caught my attention was that of the little boy, he was actually the star of the movie.A really nice movie to watch with your families.

title: BACK TO THE FUTURE 2022
text: Ryan Reynolds is a pure genius. I can imagine him getting the script of this movie and being stoked enough to put a team together to realize its pureness and glory. The story is amazing. The tears? Legit. And most importantly, casting Walker Scoobel is one of the most awesome things, ever!

title: Enjoyable Sci Fi silliness
text: Overall a good, fun movie providing you don't put too much thought into it, a few story discrepancies but try not to let it bother you and you may have some fun with it. Ryan Reynolds is his usual charming self. If I had any bugs to bear, it's that Mark Ruffalo seemed very wooden and over all bad in this movie, he also throws one punch in it that looked like it belonged in a panto or something. But like I said......don't think too much about it.

title: Ryan Reynolds plays, Ryan Reynolds, as standard, and ruins this movie!
text: Wow this movie is so dumb. Sadly its the length of the movie that just pushes this movie into the absurd at times.I mean from the offski, Ryan Reynolds sarcastic, Chandler Bing-esque humour gets SO tiring, so quickly in this movie. Ryan doesn't play a character, he just plays himself. There is absolutely nothing to his character at all worth noting about. Most of the time, his lines just don't really fit the movie, or the tone of the scene.The bad guys are horribly cliched, with stupid costumes and angry scowls. You don't need to know much from them besides the fact that some of them look really cheap, in their shiny metal suits, that have a useless invisible cloak to them. Why those henchmen in invisible suits decide to make themselves visible just to attack somebody, I have no idea, they're just stupid and cheap looking. They look like they've come from a Power Rangers Movie.Mark Ruffalo plays a character, and his role only starts like 2/3rd into the movie. His introduction is really quite laboured, as the setup from Ryan playing Ryan leaves little to the imagination what's coming. He's supposed to come across as really smart, but the writing is just atrocious, they use too many worn out buzz words and stolen ideas from other movies.Zoe Saldana, plays a character who's lines seem to have been written by a 12 year old. Throughout the film, her character just appears flat, and unsuprising in anyway. From the moment she was on screen, you knew what her fate was, and it couldn't come quick enough honestly.Everything else about the film? Well the special FX are really cheap looking. You know, explosions on things with no burn marks left. Really awful CGI that looks ontop of something instead of in it. I don't understand how they afforded Ryan Reynolds, and couldn't afford better CGI. The sounds, OH MY GOD, were so cheesy! At any and every point, the humour just felt forced the way stupid sound FX were constantly added in, its so childish. The stupid sound FX made to sound Star War-esque were just groan inducing, as not only does the film use these sounds (Pod racers, light sabers, doors closing etc) they also use some other cliched weapons from the franchise to give the film more retro feel to it. All the fight scenes just felt horribly choregraphed, they were too technical, and not natural feeling at all. The use of so many hand held weapons over a gun, just looked like desperation in this film, I'm suprised they didn't have a sumurai sword in this film, or a Captain America style shield moment (maybe they did, and I fortunately forgot it).Overall I'd say this film was entertaining, but just straight up stupid sadly. You could happily walk out of this movie to make a snack and come and return and miss nothing important. The film is simply too long for its content and basic storyline, you just wanted it to be over much earlier. I really love Sci-Fi films, but this was just dumb to the core, and Ryan Reynolds pretty much ruined this movie, playing Ryan Reynolds in it, instead of a likeable character with a script that actually suited the movie.

title: THE STORY HITS CLOSE TO HOME
text: My mom is a single parent and I basically grew up like Walker in the movie, except that my dad passed away just 6 years ago. The movie churns a whirlwind of emotions to the viewers, from grief, to regret, to nostalgia, and pure joy. I appreciate how Ryan Reynolds stepped up to make this film.P. S.Walker Scoobel sweeps this movie like a pro. I am glad that he was picked as Percy Jackson!

title: cheesy feel good time travel romp that's almost great
text: They use Ryan Reynolds at his quick witted one liner best, in this time travel scenarioIt's a feel good emotional romp except ....On the 'back to the future' films each is a satisfying 'complete' story in itself.This lacks 'something'. The fact you have 4 people credited as writing it may be a clue i.e. Committtees can never agree on anything except the most banal things. The ending is a banal committee approved ending (In my opinion)Don't get me wrong I thoroughly enjoyed the film, it's my 'sort of thing'.I just felt the ending was a bit 'glib'.I expect the script said "and everything turned out right"Genuinely emotional watching it, genuinely invested in the film and the premis but felt let down by the ending.Would I watch it again? Yes probablyI give it a solid 7/10I felt the film flew towards an 8 then veered off at the last moment to be a 7 .

title: Good family movie
text: Was ok, but not that good. The first half was good with some good action, while the 2nd half was more blah blah talk. Also the movie was very short. Ryan and Walker did a good job, their scenes were well done, while for Jennifer and Mark, were meh... all is all, it was a good family movie to watch, but again was too short.

title: An average movie at home
text: Max 6.8/10 only because the story is only just slight above average.The special effect, directorship, actors all just average.The whole movie has little comedy that slight funny only.There are moments of less excitement and moments a bit excitements.Overall I would say its good but only an average Hollywood movie.Its good to watch at home only, not advisable to watch in cinema. I will not pay much for such an average movie.

title: Different entertaining movie
text: My wife and I were both pretty tired when we sat down to watch this and weren't sure if we'd be able to stay awake. No problem! The movie grabbed us from the start and held us until the end with the story line and character development. Very enjoyable to watch.

title: The Adam Project is just harmless, silly fun with a touch of sci-fi for any viewer to enjoy.
text: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free thoughts, please follow my blog :)"The Adam Project is the typical "streaming blockbuster", but one that manages to add some characterization and genuine emotion to its generic entertainment...Ryan Reynolds delivers a balanced performance - finally portraying a non-caricatured role of himself - and Shawn Levy steers the story through energetic, fast-paced action sequences. The filmmaker both plays and takes advantage of the cliches from time-travel movies.Ultimately, it's harmless, silly fun with a touch of sci-fi for any viewer to enjoy."Rating: B-

title: Just why?
text: While R. R. is always a pleasure to watch this film is just another forgettable Netflix film. Terrible story that makes no sense.Atleast they didn't "woke" it.

title: Super enjoyable, very well done
text: I really enjoyed this movie. It had everything.... action, adventure, humour and my favourite - emotion. I found myself teary eyed several times due to some very poignant scenes. I hope the creators, writers and actors try to avoid listening to any negative reviews. I think most people will really enjoy watching this film and only the super cynical won't. The cynical ones aren't fun to be around anyways so don't listen to them!I think there are several great bits of wisdom in this film.... especially to do with seeing our younger selves, our relationships with our parents and dealing with loss. Kudos to the team that wrote this and to the actors for touching my heart with their very moving scenes, each of their performances were great Thank you!

title: Cross ET with MIB
text: Whoever wrote the script for Reynolds nailed it, and young Adam too. There's a bit of Bruce Willis in there also.It's a fun film until the crass shoot-em up scenes start. Just why. It's a US must, maybe. Normalising slinging lead. The flight scenes are aided by rock music, are cool though.It's a family bond, love story, action, sci fi, tear jerker, comedy, and insider dealing... Lots of good reasons to enjoy this film.There's lots of clever connections and attention to detail, as they cross the years (and some continuity and logical boobs).There is plenty smaltzy tho, with speeches and everything. And it's very American apple pie (with a bit of baseball). And American cars are rubber bands btw. Don't take it too seriously and you will laugh out loud.(Good to see that Maia has clearly never held a gun, ever.)Loved the ending. It's a TV movie. Well made.

title: Gets a 2 star because I could actually finish it
text: Script was written by a 5th grader. The dialogues are fake, specially the lines of the kid. Terrible. Acting is wooden by most actors - Ryan brings his usual form of the only character he can play, so is Ruffalo but at least he's good. Very lazy soundtracking, wanna be "Guardians of the Galaxy" style. Overall a pretty lame movie.

title: Nothing special
text: Movie isn't bad, but it isn't that good also.There are tons of better time travel movies, and also there are way better Ryan Reynolds movies to watch.If I had to pick top 10 time travel movies I wouldn't put this one even in top 20,so 5 stars is maximum rating could give.

title: Enjoyable sci fi journey.
text: 4 out of 5 stars.The Adam Project is a fun, heartfelt, and action packed science fiction action film that feels like the script was written in the 1980s. With films like E. T. and Back to the Future kind of tone. The film is fun. It has action. And some humor and a heartfelt story about father and son bonding.It is fast paced. The film follows Adam (Ryan Reynolds) who travels back to 2022 where he encounters his 12 year old self (Walker Scobell). Which he will need his help and his love interest Laura (Zoe Saldana). Trying to stop a corporation from getting there hands on a time travelling device which Maya (Catherine Keener) is after.The direction is fun and energized. With some great soundtracks added. The action sequences are exciting and entertaining. Ryan Reynolds is great with the role. Walker Scobell is also good. Mark Ruffalo and Jennifer Garner are good. Zoe Saldana is good for her small part. Catherine Keener does feel a little out of place with her villain role.The story and script does strike an emotional journey with a older Adam travelling with his younger self. While trying to correct some of the missed opportunities that the kid is missing out such as cherishing the moments with his parents. It is a great and fun science fiction adventure. The film may skip out on plot development but does have a emotional theme to make this one great journey.

title: Awesome Netflix movie!
text: I love Ryan Reynolds so I was excited for The Adam Project which is really good! This is his third Netflix film after Red Notice and 6 Underground and its the best!The acting is great! Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell are a great duo! The characters are fairly fleshed out.Adam is a fun, fast paced film influenced by Steven Spielberg films. Maybe the odd person feels its too fast. The humor works, I guess at least two scenes were adlibbed.The action scenes are fun, no shaky cam. The action is intense but not too much for young kids. The visuals are mostly good not that I gave it much thought.Overall, Adam is a really good Netflix film! If you like Ryan Reynolds, you really should see it! Adam is a soft PG-13 so kids can see it. Not for nothing but Deadpool 3 should be fun.

title: What a boring movie :(
text: It's hard to watch a boring movie that has very good action scenes and visual effects, and this is the case.The worse of this movie is the bad acting, poor scripting and forced scenes.

title: Loved it
text:
I'm all in, totally predictable and after watching the time lines of Avengers End Game and how inaccurate this film is.....
I couldn't care less.I love Ryan Reynolds and how underrated an actor he is. He can speak quickly and hit me with a million nasty puns in 5 minutes and I'd still love him.The young lad they cast in his stead was a great pick and even using Ruffalo whilst involving time travel, was genius.Great Saturday night viewing and one I'll be picking more bones out of in the future, or past, or present, whatever.

title: *YAWN*
text: At what point after seeing the same character types using the same schtick in a studio film does it become boring even though it appears to be outwardly exciting and amusing? I imagine for an audience that finds this compelling, it's like being a 3 year old entertained by the 300th retelling of a nursery rhyme.Sure, it's got amazing production value and A-listers in lead roles. But it relies on an antiquated idea of time travel and features age old film tropes that were tired decades ago.

title: Derivative Sci-fi fun that works great
text: This works so much better than I expected it to. This is a very derivative sci-fi movie which can make some of those elements a lot less interesting. The kid in this movie basically plays Ryan Reynolds but as a kid so having two Ryan Reynolds is a good or bad thing depending on what you think of him (it works for me in this movie but I can see people definitely not liking it). It gets very melodramatic A LOT in this movie but I think it overall works because there are many good things.This movie is just such a fun movie and Shawn Levy perfectly mixes the great characters with a fun story. The action is great with heart-pounding rock tracks, the gadgets again are definitely seen in other sci-fi movies but it is still fun and awesome in this movie. The kid actor does a great job, Him and Ryan Reynolds are pretty funny and their interactions pretty much make this movie. The science and explanations for the time travel stuff is confusing and it never really matters in the end for you to enjoy the story, it's very easy to watch despite the mathematical blabber. There are a lot of emotional moments in this movie and I think most of them work well and it's very heartwarming and they make you actually care as the characters are fun and don't feel like one-dimensional nobodies.If you have seen many sci-fi movies and are tired of the formula and Ryan Reynolds then this movie probably won't be for you, but overall it was a great time and it worked better for me then I expected.

title: NOT A FAN
text: Why does every movie made with Ryan Reynolds have the same horribly cheesy humor created in DEADPOOL. I watched this movie for ten minutes and could not stomach the bad acting, bad dialogue, and bad story. I only give it 4 stars for the special effects.

title: Enjoyable sci-fi comedy in typical Shawn Levy fashion
text: Enjoyable sci-fi comedy in typical Shawn Levy fashion though its plot and characters didn't have enough to go off. Every family moments here were both purposeful and heartwarming. Reynolds & Scobell had cute chemistry and got us hooked in their adventure.

title: What could have been!!
text: This had the potential of being really good & has its moments like playing catch! Where it bombed is the timeline! Ryan is my age & having him being 12 in 2022 just doesn't work!! What did work is Ryan & Mark, those two need to do more films together!! Another fail is the constant fail in everything, the pc checklist & couple!! If they would just cast eight for each roll, you would have more memorable films!! I will again point to Ryan & Mark being a get pair as to what I mean in casting for the roll!! Also, the biggest part of the thumbs down will come from trolls & bots who are doing as they are paid to do because honesty means nothing to them!!

title: It's much better than what it's supposed to be
text: The Adam project has a pretty basic sci-fi time travelling story line which would've sounded super cool 30 years ago. This film gave me "Moonfall" vibes which felt like it was supposed to be made 25 years ago. But.....this movie surprised me. It was funny, engaging and emotional. There are some situations(or scenes) that needed to be more serious than they are to make the film even more compelling but this movie does get serious when it's supposed to get serious and it does get emotional when it's supposed to get emotional. All the character arcs ended well and the ending of the film is really good and satisfying. I wouldn't say this is a masterpeace or anything of that sort but this is a good film that deserves your time and attention.

title: Average at best
text: Yeah you would like this movie a lot if you're 14 years old. Predictable, cheesy, and lazy. Tim pool prefers this movie over "The Batman" so that's all you really need to know. Unless you're a child don't waste your time on this hot pile of hot pile of garbage.

title: Pay NO attention to the negative reviews
text: Cool sci-fi movie with an outstanding story. A great cast, lots of action, adventure and Typical Ryan Reynolds humor.Don't listen to all the Siskel & Ebert Wannabees or the Einstein impersonators. Damn it man, it's science Fiction. If you are not in to that, don't watch it. Simple.

title: A Spielberg Wanna Be
text: At just over 100mins The Adam Project kinda ticks the boxes of a Spielberg blockbuster however it falls short and just is an ok popcorn movie. Enter at your own risk.

title: FOTN
text: Had a Flight of the Navigator feel (in a good way) at the beginning and then turned into a wonderful story about love across time. Brilliant film, well acted, good comedy, well worth a watch. 2 thumbs up....!

title: Fine, if it were labeled as a movie for kids
text: Otherwise it does a non-favour to Free Guy, which was great, by putting this childish silly movie alongside it, just when one wonders if the same people who worked of F. G. can come up with something equally empowering. The Adam Project is certainly not it. The plot is like spilled stuff from a lady's bag, it alternates action packed with boring, it throws in time travel, but neglects the usual paradoxes, and it is quite forgettable in the end.Just retarget it to the proper age segment...

title: Enjoyed AP from beginning to end
text: Just had a little bit of expectation of the film. Watched it quickly over lunch (with our Bose sound system cranked up) and ended up enjoying the film a ton.Lovely father & sons Sci-Fi action. One scene early in the film got my eyes wet quickly. It is a simple scene but effective.Got exactly (and more than) what I expected. 10/10.

title: Highly recommned!
text: A wonderful cinematic surprise in today's time when world production is polluted with various trends (promotion) and boring not original themes. More than good visual and sound effects run through the film, the story is really interesting and is located and well distributed within the time frame of the film. There are almost no boring scenes. This science fiction film abounds in action and adventure with light comedy and drama at the end, really a great combination of all of the above. The actors do their job extremely well. All in all, I personally recommend this film to all fans of science fiction, examples like this are really rare today!

title: About what you'd expect from a Ryan Reynolds movie
text: Pretty standard, cookie cutter sci fi action romp / comedy. Story was fine but nothing majorly original or unexpected.Ryan Reynolds using his same old quirky sarcastic humour that we've seen in so many of his other films. I like Reynolds but the jokes didn't really fit with the tone of the film on a few occasions. I just wish he would try some new things rather than basically playing himself in all these films, as he's clearly talented.CGI effects were pretty decent apart from a fairly ugly deep fake de-ageing effect (you won't be able to miss it). I liked the design of the futuristic fighter jets.Overall a mildly entertaining film but nothing groundbreaking and I'll probably forget about it before long.

title: Great sci-fi adventure
text: The Adam Project borrows ideas and imagery from iconic films to create it's own great sci-fi adventure that's fun, fast paced and extremely heartwarming with some surprising emotional depth to its premise.Ryan Reynolds gives a great performance that plays to his witty strengths but also cleverly balances it with more emotional moments. Walker Scobell is note perfect as a younger version of Reynolds and has solid chemistry with him.Mark Ruffalo adds a lot of humour and emotion to the film and is extremely convincing as both Reynolds and Scobells dad. Zoe Saldana and Jennifer Garner don't get a lot of screen time but are still able to give memorable performances.Shawn Levy's direction is really good with lots of energy and momentum as well as fun and flashy action scenes. The CG has some impressive moments but very distracting ones too, especially the de-aging. The soundtrack is also great and definitely adds to the overall fun.

title: I lost interest
text: I started out being amused by the wry humour, then increasingy bored by the extended fight scenes, and the seemingly endless emotional chit-chat (why do all American movies have the cast explore their past when Daddy played ball with them in the yard??) but halfway through I lost the plot, literally, because it no longer made sense. This needs much less reliance on CGI and much more logic to what is happening and where it is heading.

title: Funny and emotional Sci Fi
text: Fun time travel film that will make you laugh but also deals with love, loss and grief. I thought it was very well put together, I had a few solid laughs and also shed a few tears. Definitely a well cast movie, Ryan Reynolds was funny as always but he hit the emotional notes a little harder than usual which was nice to see and Walker Scobell did great as young Adam. They worked really well together especially their scenes with Mark Ruffalo who was funny and a little heart breaking at times and he was great with Jennifer Garner as expected. I thought we'd get a little more Zoe Saldana but she did well with her limited screen time and her and Reynolds had good chemistry. Overall it was a good watch with some emotional ups and downs, even if you're not a Sci Fi fan it's still an enjoyable movie, definitely recommend!

title: Entirely Predictable, but a cute kid
text: I think we've seen this movie before. I mean, change the names, and a few details, and this is just like so many Time Travel movies before it. The kid is cute. The fight scenes were a bit too long and silly. The physics was terrible.

title: Loved it. It was moving and very enjoyable
text: Great movie. Loved the role of little adam. Loved the whole story. No it probably isnt going to win oscars, but I had good fun and was entertained.Why shouldn't there be movies that entertain you in a good way.Of course if you want to watch an oscar worthy movie watch other movies.If you want to be pleasantly entertained, watch this movie.

title: Yet another utterly GARBAGE Netflix movie...
text: I literally feel a responsibility to continue writing reviews of this ongoing onslaught of trash Netflix original films. There's been all of two passable films among the great many so far, to the point that, were it not for a much stronger host of Netflix original series and other content, there would be no reason to continue subbing. There's simply nothing good to say about this movie, not even a single entertaining scene, to the point that you question why you're watching any more of it. It's a really braindead time travel jet story with the usual senseless action choreography. LITERALLY NOTHING TO SEE HERE.

title: Surprise. I enjoyed this.
text: I almost didn't watch this movie but am so glad I did. I tend to not dwell on technical and scientific logic when watch a movie. I once took a class critiquing a movie which destroyed my enjoyment of movies so I shook off the crap that many watch a movie for. I look for fun and enjoyment which is in this film. This film is funny, sensitive, and captivating. Look at it as a fun movie for enjoyment not for reviewing.

title: No need to make films like these
text: I get it... there are Ryan Reynolds's fans and nostalgic viewers that feel like watching cheap unrealistic scifi with weak plotlines done with current technology. But the rest of the film watchers don't deserve to be put through such an ordeal.The storyline is either too simple or incredibly complex: Go back in time and change the future, in this case by destroying time travel. By now, so many films have been made on that, many quite memorable, that it could be quite interesting to see in which ways the scriptwriter solves problems like: what happens with the memory of people that time-travel? This film always chooses the worst and silliest solutions, for instance: they just forget everything. Ok...Then we have Reynolds playing the smart guy, Buffalo playing the scientist, and so on... so we get the idea: come and play what you did in other films. Young Adam is probably the most successful character, quite cheeky, entertaining and fresh.The film does take some breaks in the action, for the father-and-son conflict mainly. These parts are quite boring an cliche, and I guess not many people would feel moved by it.Is it worth watching? I regret having done it. Those of us who have watched low-budget, poorly-scripted films in the 90s are left wondering why we end up watching a film like this. I guess that the audience is constantly renewed and each generation wants to regret having watched horrible films like this when they were young. So... help yourselves.

title: my opinion
text: With this movie I became a fan of Ryan Reynolds acting..it makes me smile automatically with his simple moves..a fun, interesting and emotional movie that I loved very much.

title: 13 going on 30 (Adam's version)
text: Every time you watch a time travel movie you are at a great risk of watching a story that seems more promising than it actually is. The thing with bad time travel movies is that they rely on technical aspects such as CGI, being this movie an excellent example, since it relies on its excessive budget to work. The reason behind this is that this genre of films are only good if they are constructed around solid characters and functioning relationships among them. Furthermore, this is not the case of the movie, since its characters did not have a real objective to attract the audience besides a cliche need of fixing their problems in a way that was hardly believeble.All the problems rooted on the plot of the movie gave as a result a mediocre film that probably will not last in the memory of anybody more than one month. By repeating the same old-fashion patrons of films from the 80s and 90s (that did not work either then or now), Netflix offers us tolerable entertainment if we are up to watching a movie that will not contribute anything new.

title: Great family movie
text: Predictable plot, yet still entertaining. Great to watch a movie just to be entertained rather than reminded of what's going on in the real world. Action scenes were great. Chemistry between actors were also good.

title: Average but entertaining
text: The kid is the star of the movie. Movie isn't terrible but could have been better. Reynolds and his wife have zero chemistry mostly due to diversity casting. Focus on quality and not ticking boxes.

title: Brilliant
text: Brilliant movie to sit and enjoy with the kids, people expect too much these days and will rate it a 1/10 however just sit back and enojoy it.Not enough of Garner though!!

title: Promising start, disappointing end
text: A film of two halves. I'll keep it spoiler free and short.This film opens well, it's by no means a masterpiece, but it doesn't pretend to be so no complaints there. The story introduction is a bit silly but told well enough and doesn't drag itself out. Character introduction again doesn't delve in deep, but we meet a typically charming Ryan Reynolds type. There's some witty, family friendly interactions (a couple of bad words but nothing major) and the story kind of rolls on as we have some fun with the lead characters.Then the story develops and for me the whole thing fell apart. Everything became rushed and very typical of a Hollywood action film. Endearing characters became annoying and their arcs became painfully predictable. Guns are fired, things explode and warm feelings are shared.Again the first half is enjoyable and if you are a fan of action scenes and "dramatic" storylines, then you may also enjoy the second half. It wasn't for me though and I struggled through the final 45 minutes, but made it in the end... just.

title: Entertaining & Heartfelt.
text: Good Movie. Only con I had was at times the young Adam just came across to me as an annoying ungrateful brat. Reynolds, Garner & Ruffalo were all exceptional in this... just really wished they'd had let both versions of Adam reveal themselves the same way to his Mother as they did his Father.... or even a post-credit were the Old Adam had left a note or some sort of message to the Young version to give him an edge in life.

title: Did Ryan Reynolds have a debt to pay off? Lose a bet?
text: There has to be a point to a movie that doesn't end as badly as it began. The beginning of this movie was abrupt like if you walked into a conversation between two people and only heard the last word said by one of them.The ending, no spoilers, because honestly, if you're dumb enough to watch this, you deserve to know how it (predictably) ends.I won't even get into the the really bad soundtrack that is completely irrelevant to the plot or action on screen. It's as if someone said let's put all the 80s and 90s music we can in a movie for the boomers who just want a mixed tape.This is just utterly bad. Free Guy was fun and ingenious. This is just stupid and makes your brain hurt.The only reason Ryan Reynolds agreed to make this because someone he loved must have either been held hostage or his mobile phone company just needed money to survive.

title: Such a feelgood movie
text: It exceeded my not so high expectations on a Friday night, so I'm happy. It was solid. Maybe a 10 is exaggerated but I feel it deserves a balancing high rate to all the haters here. The kid is not a great actor yet tho.

title: A sickly rethread
text: This movie is attempting to recapture the magic of the classic Ambient movies from the 80s, in particular E. T. This attempt is unsuccessful in large part due to it's lack of original soul and Ryan Reynolds. It is attempting to deal with a higher emotional core than many of Reynolds previous films but it lays it on way too thick. The emotional scenes are so overrepresented that it comes off as manipulative. The humor is stale and relies too heavily on references and the self aware 'wit' that has haunted Hollywood these past few years.

title: Great Time Time Travel movie AND Ryan Reynolds! AND a dog!!!
text: This is the best of all mixes - SciFi, time travel, a cute kid, a dog, Ryan Reynolds (you know what I mean). The special effects were great! They flying sequences excellent! A great way to spend a couple of hours on a boring evening. Spices it right up.This could have been a big screen movie, in my book.

title: Started good
text: Started good, but soon it became lake any action movie.The main character was smart in the beginning, but as soon the female main character entered the scene, he suddenly and inexplicable became very stupid.I usla like all the actors. The ide was kind of cool. But this movie wasn't that good.

title: For a Netflix production this is fantastic
text: Great story, great effects, Great acting, Great cast. Such a wonderful clean movie that the whole family can enjoy. Very uplifting moments, coupled with more uplifting moments makes for great viewing. Some nice sci-fi concepts thrown in without beating you over the head with it. I really enjoyed this movie.

title: Netflix=trash
text: This is an insult to the intellect of monkeys. On a human level it's impossible to watch beyond 20 minutes into it if you have more than an ounce of brains. They could have cast Mathew Perry as a leading man, that would have been hilarious and much more appropriate! Absolute trash!

title: A pleasant surprise
text: This was a funny and heartwarming, emotional movie with solid fight scenes. Ryan Reynolds and the young star pair well together. Overall a really really fun movie to watch.Some of the effects are excellent, while almost any CGI or special effect that involves a person moving in a fight scene is somewhat of a noticeable eye sore. The worst is a particular scene that makes an effort at de-aging where it almost looks like someone talking to a cartoon version of themself.

title: Did you all feel my giant eye roll?
text: The Adam Project isn't a good movie. I knew it wouldn't be going into it, but it looked like it would at least be mindless fun.For starters, its a Netflix original content project, so there's strike one.The cgi is laughably bad. People, Jurrasic Park came out almost 30 years ago. Why is there still substandard cgi in our movies?The writing and story are almost absent. Young Adam buys in way to quickly and easily. The relationship between old Adam and Gamora has no foundation and we feel nothing for her loss.And can we give it a break with time travel as an element of story telling? I don't believe its possible or will ever be realized, but all it serves as in movies is plot convenience. At least Terminator and Back to the Future had respect for the topic while they played with it.With all of that said, it is just a movie and Ryan Reynolds is still enjoyable, but this movie lost me with one line.Kathy Keener's character when talking to her younger self refers to our current environment as toast.For the love of God, will people in the news media, government, and our entertainment media shut the hell up about how doomed the environment is? If people want to start being stewards of our planet, then start acting like it. But put up or shut up.I don't think I can stand to hear another woke ass bit of preachy liberal dialogue in our various forms of entertainment media. Make an entertaining product without telling us what to think or how to feel. If you do want to force an agenda, then make a documentary and see how few people come to watch.When I stop seeing trash all over the sides of the roads and littering parks and shopping areas, I'll start listening to people crying about our doomed planet. When I stop seeing people racing to be the first to have the biggest house or the newest car or the latest technology or seeing every single damn human walking around like a zombie with their face glued to a phone screen, then maybe I'll believe that I live on a planet inhabited by people who actually do care about the environment. In the mean time, we're all a bunch of self righteous hypocrites and some of us think we need to tell everyone else how bad we're treating our home. Fine, preach away. Just don't do it within the scope of my time of relaxation and attempted enjoyment.Damn it anyway.

title: Adam Project
text: Very good futuristic film about time travel and all thr universal problems it creates. Mark Ruffalo, Ryan Reynolds and Jennifer Garner are great in this film. Great family film. Highly recommend this film.

title: Another film with an asthmatic child
text: Problem No. 1: Films about time travel are fundamentally saturated with logical gaps. Problem No. 2: Ryan Reynolds is always pretty to look at, but really he only ever plays the same role, no matter in what guise. The Adam Project doesn't try to avoid either of these and stomps right into all the clichés that exist. And films in which children have asthma - the USA seems to be full of them - basically get a two-star deduction from me. What remains is a film that doesn't hurt you, but which for me was a waste of my time, because in the end there's nothing left that's worth remembering.

title: Something for the Whole Family
text: The writers have polished items found in other movies (light sabers, time travel, storm trooper-ish fighters, villains in black capes) and combined them with a sentimental family story, heavy on relationships.What could have felt recycled or mawkish, instead feels like the perfect anecdote to 2022.---Ryan Reynold and his counterpart, Walker Scobell, deliver the emotions of grieving sons & nerds.Jennifer Garner & Mark Ruffalo are a parental combo that's hard to beat in any year.The bad guys (and woman leader) are ominous. The action sharp and the f/x pop.---There are a lot of films on Netflix--many, many great.Actors who are talented and good looking.But when you pack this much talent with this well crafted a script AND HIT AUDIENCE DEMAND needs in the pocket?Love, love, love.

title: Movie As Microwave Dinner
text: Clatter, clunk is the sound of the microwave meal tray plopping on the platter getting ready to be heated up. After the beep, you are left with a completely uninspiring meal. With the entrée portion still partially frozen and the sides limp and devoid of flavor. The plot revolved around time travel and the risks as well as the cliché concept of running into yourself at a different point in time. This regurgitates an abundance of stereotypical bad action/comedy movie moments. The screenplay and script are worse than an overcooked Hot Pocket with zero redeeming qualities. The soundtrack was an obvious attempt at $9.99 soundtrack sales. The band Boston is a solid band but they used one of their songs for the action scene which was simply a poor song choice; jarring and left me with a quizzical expression as even the lyrics didn't work with the scene. And leaving no cliché left behind, there was even the father/son moment of playing catch on a very obvious set piece. The Van Damme movie I watched previously felt more genuine than this. Had to follow it up by watching "Her" for some quality filmmaking as it just popped up on Netflix.

title: Very enjoyable
text: Really enjoyed this despite it not being anything particularly new or different. It was funny and the action was good. I love Ryan Reynolds even if he plays the same character in everything and the kid did a good job too. Will definitely watch this again in the future.

title: Terrific
text: Okay this is utterly brilliant. Funny, heartwarming, stupid, implausible, and thoroughly enjoyable. Some of the lines are spit your popcorn out funny, and there is a pervasive feelgood feel to the whole thing. The plot is daft, of course but that notwithstanding it somehow it manages to be mildly meaningful (like actual speculative fiction) and in places moving. The action sequences are fun. The characters are brilliantly cast and brilliantly played. The young Adam is terrific. And the relationship between young and old Adam is perfectly carried off by the two leads. I loved it. Great Friday evening film.

title: Pretty Standard Menu
text: Maybe some aliens did kidnap all capable human writers for some top secret purpose (maybe killing or lobotomizing all humans by mind starvation?) - The Adam Project is what I call netflixed: everything is somewhat okay, the acting, the production, the script, and if you are lucky, you get here and there a good moment. This little sci-fi adventure is not bad but forgetable. It won't hurt you, but it also won't impress you - this is the equivalent of your standard cheeseburger. Nothing more, but nothing less.

title: Fun movie
text: I enjoyed it, helped by three favourite actors, Jennifer garner, mark ruffalo and Ryan reynolds. Ok so reynolds plays the same clown but the funny thing he's taught the younger him to be just like him! Lol. I like reynolds humour, always gets a shout out to Canada 👍. And ruffalo always brings the emotions. 😢. Don't look for deep meaning, don't look for Oscar worthy performances, take it for what it is and enjoy it.

title: Wisecracking Reynolds
text: Poor confusing nonsense. Sugary mushy ending. Ruffalo excellent as usual. Reynolds being Reynolds not acting just being himself. I'd give it a miss. He peaked with Deadpool.

title: A Cliché movie I recommend skipping.
text: The project junk is one of those movies where from the start you can tell what is going to happen, and if it's true that the important is "how we get there "in this movie that is very boring and repetitive as multiplying a number by 0. I know that is a comedy with not soo much deep in the background story, but a dad's joke have more background than this trash, is insulting how this movie put so little effort in creating a "lore".The special effects are nice but nothing unique and in the end they seems ridiculous.Jokes are boring and made for little kids.The only good part about the movie that I actually like are the messages that the movie tries to give at the end for the espectators, and i personally like that idea.The plot is about a guy called Adam that steels a time machine to go back to 2022 for a special reason I don't going to tell you (spoiler) and he find his younger self and that is the opening. I find the overall plot very boring.In conclusion, movie is trash and not funny for adults there are better things to spend your time on. Go and watch some anime you will no regret it.

title: Don't listen to the wannabe critics.
text: Great fun sci-fi family movie. If you are a normal human being like myself then I'm sure you and your kids will love this.Unfortunately the user reviews are riddled with self proclaimed wannabe critics whose only intentions are to slate this movie by pointing out everything that the average person really doesnt care in the slightest about. I'm convinced most never even watched the entire movie either.

title: What can you say. There must always be these low-quality films!
text: In short, a less than mediocre movie. Same Ryan Reynolds. Same stupid jokes. Same predictable story. Same mediocre effects. Same mediocre score and same mediocre netflix. A waste of time.

title: Great Movie
text: The most important thing about a movie is that you enjoy spending time with the characters. Ryan Reynolds is one of my favorites. Easy on the eyes and an attractive voice. This is his best setting, because the script allows him to show off his comic talent.It was funny. In most cases that is enough.

title: Once a time only
text: If the cast of the movie is Ryan Reynolds, Mark Ruffalo, Zoe Saldana and Jennifer Garner the expectation are high. But the movie is not up to the amazing casting.Found it short and very precise, a little time to the line would have made it more interesting.You will find very ordinary about everything in it.But it is still worth for a watch, ONLY. Thats it.

title: Sci-fi Heaven
text: I personally enjoyed watching this, I love a good scifi movie, yes you know it's a little far fetched in places like they all are but that's what your imagination is for.

title: Meh
text: The performances are solid, but this is white (male) bread, baked for white males by white males and is very pedestrian & predictable. All of these actors are capable of so much more. Jennifer Garner plays a great mum but is criminally underutilized in this film (hello anyone remember Alias???!!!). Zoe Saldana kicks tail but isn't in the film much for it to matter. It's especially disappointing because Tropper created Banshee & Carrie/Ana was such a total badass. The script is so formulaic you don't have to pay close attention to it to know what's going to happen - seriously, couldn't Garner have played the scientist??? That wouldn't have been much but it would have been something. The best thing about this film is the obvious chemistry between Garner & Ruffalo and the likeability of all of the actors. Reynolds is solid, doing his thing & the boy they cast was a perfect younger Reynolds. If you've got nothing better to do, then definitely watch Reynolds' obviously play out his Jedi fantasy or put the movie on in the background, but know you've likely seen several variations of this film already. It left me wanting to rewatch Rogue One.

title: Action-comedy with a deeper emotional journey
text: While this was an entertaining comedy and action movie, it was an even more wonderful story of an emotional healing journey. I was impressed by the poignant conversations between characters that perfectly captured the emotional process of the characters. Very powerful!

title: Multi-genre Netflix slop
text: The latest Ryan Reynolds Netflix release. A Sci-Fi emotional drama, it could fit into other categories like action, adventure, kids but doesn't actually spend much time on them nor does the writer care about those aspects.The time travel aspect is flawed throughout (just nod your head and accept it because they mention back to the future and terminator), the motivations and plot leading characters through the movie doesn't make sense at any time. The rules of the science are only there to explain the plot and to not make sense. They even poke fun at this multiple times, I can't write and it's funny.If you don't enjoy Ryan Reynolds comedy now you get twice as much. The action is poor and only exists because it needs to be there. If you like heart felt family drama you're lucky that's most of this movie. Pick a genre and stick to it please and get someone to actually write it.

title: Jerks regarding poor reviews are jerks
text: One, yes another time travel movie but so many moments in time are worth reliving. Chemistry is great among the cast, light hearted moments, a tug at the heart yes, and trust me, take the time to watch a feel good movie.

title: A Joke in the name of Movie n Science
text: A complete trash, tried to copy things from movies, shirty chars does lame dialogues, lame comedy, lame music, changes context every 5 min, you can predict movie just in first 5 mins, it bored me to death.

title: Superb for family
text: A great move from the start to the finish. Excellent and with great humuor. Expect for a few kissing scenes and a little language, this is bound to be the best family movie to watch over the weekend.

title: A comedic sci-fi action thriller with emotional intelligence
text: Shawn Levy and Ryan Reynolds deliver again. The director/actor duo behind Deadpool and Free Guy bring us another movie as hilarious and fun as those - though this one packs extra love. And the kid is superb. All the performances are great, really. A scene between Reynolds and Jennifer Garner stands out in particular. What a unique moment for a story. And the chemistry and emotion between Reynolds and Saldana is intense. Highly entertaining and hysterical all around, with unexpected tear jerker moments. Recommend!

title: Forgettable Unfortunately!
text: I feel like this is one of those films that is good for quick watch with family members, but not something you will remember in a few days time. It definitely has some intriguing ideas, but it never really push these concepts beyond the surface level.Both Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell work well together and create some funny moments in the film. However, I wish they went a bit further with the idea of interacting with your future self. It could have provided some interesting commentary on the nature of growing up.The film's effects are decent, but nothing super impressive unfortunately. It is the same situation with the cinematography and editing as well. I cannot say I would revisit this film in the future, but it provided a fun afternoon with my family!

title: Amazing
text: This movie had the right amount of comedy, emotional and action bits in it. Ryan Reynolds was the perfect actor for his role, and so was Mark Ruffalo. However there is quite a lot of swearing and kissing in this film, so I would recommend this movie for kids over 10 or 11. Overall, the movie was amazing as it really showed the love people have for their parents and how much love parents have for their children. I cried lots during this film.

title: Booooooring !
text: If you have a problem falling asleep at night I suggest put the movie on it will definitely help.Flat story, villain not very exciting, fight scenes déjà vu.What a waste of a Sunday evening !

title: Trailer is much better than the movie....
text: Unfortunately the trailer is much better than the movie.I was hoping it would have been another Guardians of the Galaxy but unfortunately it was more of a Wonder Woman.It just has too much of the unrealistic marvel style scenes, had high hopes for this after seeing the trailer.

title: A decent time travel thriller
text: Nothing will beat Back to the Future...However, the storyline of this movie, the action, the music, and the laughs make this, in my opinion, the best time travel movie SINCE Back to the Future.Recommended.

title: vomit inducing schmaltz fest
text: Terrible waste of talent and everyone's time including mine. Some occasional witty dialogue and a few special effects . But incredibly cheesey plot. Do yourself a favour and re watch The Flight of the Navigator.

title: Brilliant
text: Loved this film. It might not win an Oscar but it's bloody brilliant easy entertainment! Ryan Reynolds is as always amazing and funny. A great easy to watch film.

title: Annoying
text: I cringed constantly at this movie. The dialogue is like a bad Judd Apatow movie... every character is constantly snarky and sarcastic, especially the awful little actor playing young Ryan Reynolds. Ever wanted to see a ten year old try to imitate Ryan Reynolds for two hours? No, that sounds like godawful ear torture? Yeah, it's painful. It's like Ryan Reynolds guest starring in a Nickelodeon production. Then ya notice that Mark Ruffalo shows up when the movie is almost over... wait... IT'S NOT EVEN HALFWAY DONE? Dear god, nooooooooo!!!

title: Not Worth It
text: It was cute. I felt like it was a little stilted with the dialogue and that Ryan Reynolds fell back on his Deadpool character's persona a little bit too much. CGI was horrible on Ms. Keener's younger self. Music didn't quite work all the time and the chemistry between Zoe Saldana and Reynolds wasn't there. All in all, it was harmless fun, but nothing amazing.

title: If you think it´s about time travelling you are missing the best part
text: I found this movie charming and lovely. Mostly because it focuses more in what do you need if you can travel in time, I guess the whole movie is about love and family and the sci-part is the support to narrate the story and bring a lot of fun. Don´t take it so serious and pay attention to the family dialogues, and what could be the important thing if you can see your dead parents again... And what do you need from them....

title: Not much happened?
text: For a film with a sci fi genre, it was disappointingly based entirely on earth with very few futuristic components.The story was definitely there, but it was awkwardly paced, with the history of Adam's past chewing up most of the screen time, and the action scenes barely making an appearance. This made for a somewhat boring experience.While there were entertaining moments and genuine chemistry between Ryan Reynolds and his 12 year old co star, the film lacked the action and believability that it really needed.It's a shame, there was a lot of potential here, but The Adam Project most certainly missed the mark.

title: Great movie
text: This is a very clever story with it different elements throughout, all I can say is if you are unfamiliar with any of the characters in this film by the end of this movie and as I was sad that it ended and hoping that there will be another one!

title: Ambitious idea but Disappointing implementation
text: This movie had an interesting description, but when I started watching it, I almost immediately got disappointed. It felt like a mix of a melodrama and blockbuster with bad jokes, tons of special effects, anti scientific facts, and chaotic but emotionally deep interrelationships between people. Among the red flags were the involvement of a kid into a main role - a shooting kid, come on! - then idiotic jokes like a farting wound, mixing scientific terms with anti-scientific behaviors, all the future-is-here scenes with a kid controlling a military drone via googles and gloves, an absolute evil antagonist who wants to destroy everything - how predictable, a parallel story of how to be a good father - why you need to mix everything in one pot??, etc. I would say, the dialogs and acting are pretty poor as well. Overall, I did not make it to the end of the movie and would not generally recommend watching it unless you have nothing to do.

title: Just for kids
text: Not much to recommend in this standard sci-fi kids movie with lots of special effects (laser shooting space ships etc.) and not much else.If you have an interest in time travel movies, it's not worth bothering watching this one.

title: Loved it
text: See a lot of comments talking about missing scientific details and whatever, to those ppl I'd like to say you're missing the point. This movie was about love and family , and enjoying life the most u can while it's over in a heartbeat. So what there's a wormwhole not described as it should ? Ryan is awesome as always, he's younger version is extremely talented. And mark ruffalo is the calm u need in an action packed movie.

title: Uhh it was ok.
text: Enough to keep you entertained. But lacked anything else. Very predictable, had a few laughs and enjoyed the actors. Something you watched once and forget.

title: I love it
text: It has a meaningful storyline with fam values inside.. i always love ryan reynold's film. He just one of the best actor. And i love the Adam kid. Love every inch of the movie.

title: Trying too hard to please everyone
text: I had high really hopes for this movie but the movie is a mess. It fails the whole sci-fi plot. Tries to be a family movie but doesn't work well with that either.

title: Character of young adam 🔥
text: Positives :-First, the COMEDY SCENES of the movie have potential to make you laugh.Second, quality of VFX is amazing.Third, i am unable to watch the movie in original language, so i watched its dubbed version. Surprisingly, the DUBBING QUALITY is good enough.Fourth, ACTING is fabulous especially of young adam.Fifth, the PRESENTATION of the movie is so good.Negatives :-First, in terms of STORY, this movie fails because story is not so good and predictable as well.Second, The explanation of TIME TRAVELLING is confusing and wierd.Third, some ACTION SCENES are illogical.Fourth, there are some SENTIMENTAL scenes of no use in the story.Fifth, CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT is average.

title: Just BARELY on the acceptable sided of sacharine.
text: So sweet at times my back teeth started to twinge This film owes a lot of its dialog and jokes to movies like ET, Back to the Future, Time cop, premonition, Terminator, and Preditor. Not all bad references, but you could turn it into a drinking game pretty easily.

title: Casual Sci-Fi Done Right
text:
This is your everyday sci-fi ,
acting is ok most of the time with high quality actors,
cgi can be much better but doesn't have time and money to be done,
Story sound complex but simple to digest at the same time for mainstream,
So you may ask why is the high score because script is good and movie does its job it is entertaining, fun and emotional when it needed to be.Watch and enjoy.

title: Perhaps a specific audience...
text: Gotta say as somebody who lost his dad suddenly at a young age, I found this movie profoundly accurate - even if the logistics of time travel weren't.

title: A movie that hits all its targets.
text: The Adam Project is a bit special. It's very reminiscent of 80s family sci-fi. It has a great balance of action, comedy and drama. Without going into the time-travel storyline the movies strong points are a well thought out drama with great characters and a bit of emotional depth to tug the viewers heartstrings one minute then throwing alien action sequences the next. It's a great balance that really works.The chemistry between Reynolds and young actor Scobell is naturally funny and something hard to achieve.The Adam Project is quite a rarity these days because it's really good at what it does.

title: Dumb film
text: The story is very dumb and is like written by a kid. People who have no logic can enjoy this film. I don't suggest watching unless you are under 12. The whole film have so many plot holes.

title: Brilliant and Funny
text: Watch out for the young actor, Walker Scobell. Ryan Reynolds brilliant as always. I well thought out film and not too sci-fi to put of the non-scifi people. Worth a watch.

title: How is this getting good reviews
text: Don't even waste your time watching it. Stories awful, characters awful, plot doesn't exist. Are we all watching the same movie because I can't believe how positive the reviews are.

title: Funny, action packed and tugs at your heart strings
text: I honestly don't know how anyone could not like this movie. You get Ryan Reynold's x2! I felt it moved at a good pace. The story line made enough sense that my mind didn't wander trying to figure out holes in the plot, always a risk with time travel movies (not a spoiler). It was funny, heartwarming - but not too heavy - and action packed. A great way to escape for a couple hours.

title: Fun Sci-fi From Get Go
text: Only issue? Endless video game styled violence. When will Hollyweirdos grow a pair? Wake up! You must know that violence begets violence...oops too low IQ. So Hollywood gets to insult everyone but has no policing??? Great flick but for the pandering, inappropriate and endless violence.

title: You don't need to watch this movie - you've already seen it
text: About 20 minutes into this movie I started to get an uneasy feeling: have I already seen it? But that would be impossible, since it only came out two days previously. And then it hit me. The way that Netflix creates new content is so heavily driven by data and algorithms that this movie is nothing more than a mash up of the most popular scenes of other movies.If you're the kind of person who likes those flashback episodes of TV shows where the characters say "remember the time when..." and then you're treated to something you remember perfectly well, then you'll enjoy watching Ryan Reynolds sell out for yet another giant bag of cash.If, like me, you find it deeply offensive that your content provider has such contempt for its audience that it feels justified in passing off this glorified clip show as an "original" movie, you should give is a wide berth. In fact, you would do well to remember that in general, there's nothing original about Netflix Originals.

title: A touching and moving blend of time travel, adventure with the past, and family gatherings
text: Adam Reed, a time traveler, accidentally crashed in 2022 as a result of escaping from the leader of the time traveler group. He must work with his 12-year-old self to save the future.The Adam Project presents Ryan Reynolds as the main character giving a hilarious and exciting feel to this film. Meeting him in the past explains how exciting the adventure between them is. The film is wrapped in a light story plot. There are not many monotonous and heavy dialogues. The monotonous thing is just Ryan's jokes and comedy that are so-so. A musty dialogue that relies solely on funny scripts and is full of comedy. Conflicts and problems also run lightly and casually. The adventure presented is also quite fun and entertaining. It's a bit strange to see an evil character in the end come in the final third of the film as if there is a mysterious character being discussed. This movie is like a movie that is enough to entertain. One thing I like, the ending between Big Adam, little Adam and Adam's Dad playing together in the backyard becomes the touching part and the most serious part of the film.It is undeniable that Ryan Reynolds is one of the famous and entertaining actors. His comedic mannerisms and entertaining jokes and monologues have stuck and become his trademark in every film he has acted in, including The Adam Project. It's just that, in this film, there are some jokes that to me sound harsh and not quite right to perform.

title: Painfully average
text: Time travel stories can be hit and miss, this one is clearly more miss than hit.The pace is prety off, the story is not great and the only thing that saves it from being a trotal trainwreck is teh cast.Watch if you have nothing else to see and time top spare.

title: Juat brilliant
text: Two Ryan Reynolds !! How fantastic, we need a lot more of that gorgeous, funny, brilliant actor. This movie was funny and sad, and the acting was fantastic by the new little actor Walker Scobell. What an amazing little guy, so cute and such a great actor, exactly like my grandson. Good luck with your future Walker, you deserve it.

title: Great caste bad movie
text: If you are a fan of time travel movies, this is not for you. There is no complicated paradoxes or altering the past n future or mind bending theories in this movie. Just a straight line story of someone from future coming to stop the the time travel in a very easy banal vannilla way possible. Also there is no character development or back stories. Just plain dumb ass movie it is.

title: Acting
text: Guys, i really don't understand how Walker kills that role at his age. Just awesome. The movie is hold together with the acting. Ryan is funny as ever and the chemistry between those two is great.I had a great time watching it! And yeah, the jacket is a little tight.

title: Don't waste your time
text: I saw more thn half movie but I'm really bored.. There is no storyline or nothing concrete to offer.. Its just seer waste of time. I don't understand why Netflix invest in such movies..

title: This triggers nostalgia in me
text: I don't know why or what or how but I've gotten attached to this film somehow? The vibe gives me a lot of the old films I used to watch but with modern takes. I laughed and I cried and it's just overall an easy film to watch. The effects are ok a bit wonky in some places. The actions also feel a bit lacking and stiff...most especially during a climax scene but it is an easy watch nothing too heavy to scrutinize by detail. I love the dynamic, that's perfect. Ryan and Walker are perfect for this. I like the comedic timing here feels natural to me. To me the time travel aspect is easy to understand. They skimmed and gave good enough base for it to not be like a 'wtf' thing. I'd recommend for certain for a family time (be aware of some language), if you like light soft sci-fi, light comedy, light drama. You might like this/

title: Too fake & unrealistic
text: It's an okay film but it's one of those movies where they shoot 1000 bullets at you and none hit. Makes it difficult to watch as well as some of the decisions the characters make are in contradiction with their intentions.The film could have been great but it is what it is.

title: Fun family movie with amazing soundtrack
text: It's a time travel flick but for the more science minded among you, don't over think it and you'll still enjoy. You also get to see a kid give almost as good as Reynolds can dish out which was oddly satisfying. Then there's the soundtrack by Rob Simonsen to top it all off. I watched this last night and STILL have the theme from the end credits bouncing around in my head and I'll be honest, while listening to it and reflecting on my own memories of my Father... One hell of a lump in my throat for sure.

title: too many vegetables in this soup :)
text: It had good humor and good acting, but the sci-fi thingy dressed with the family drama(ish, not too much) was like sooooooooo tiring and seemed like it just didn't fit in the movie. I am still wondering what genre is this because it had from almost everything, but altogether was just bad.

title: Funniest nerd sci-fi ever!
text: Without Ryan Reynolds this film would probably be crap, but with his hilarious facial expressions and quick jokes, this film will make you laugh continuously while also keeping you entertained with Back to the future-like sci-fi vibes. Don't expect to much out of the story. Just enjoy.

title: Why does Hollywood keep letting teenagers write scripts?
text: It's so bad it hurts. It's so dumb it bores. Just kept eye-rolling the whole film. Just wannabe sci-fi... don't waste your time here. It really feels that an early teen wrote the script... no offense... but it lacks experience, depth, coherence and a real story. It is empty.

title: Not a Masterpiece, but...
text: Not every movie needs to be a masterpiece to make you feel all the beautiful emotions that this film has.
