The story is great as the actors and as their delivery.The concept is very interesting and is still playing with the greatest minds on Earth which is time, more specifically time travel.The setting of it is your standard American family (I assume, at least from all the movies I've seen) which has some issues is something a lot of us can relate to, even though it's not a primary story, but underlying. I love when secondary themes become the main ones by the end.That's life and it's beautiful.Thanks guys, amazing job!

title: The science doesn't stack up
text: Big acting budget, but not much spent on the storyline. It was filled with numerous plot holes, and poor scientific explanations. Very hard to sit through the ending for anyone who appreciates science.

title: A Fun Ride
text: Who cares about all tropes... Reynolds' ad-libs are worth it and the cast of familiar faces make it seem like you're home again. A fun, escapist jaunt. Popcorn, feet up, enjoy.

title: Ryan Reynolds has become a bore.
text: Worst thing about this movie? The leading "star". Yawn. Same old, same old.Best things about this movie? The actor playing young Adam and that they played Led Zeppelin's Good Time, Bad Times as background music during a fight scene.Even so, not enough to keep me watching. Turned it off about half-way through and found something more entertaining to watch.

title: One of the best SciFi movies I've ever scene
text: Brought me to tears, brought me to laughter, but most importantly, it brought me a good time. The acting is phenomenal, cast amazing and storyline beautiful.

title: Booooooooring
text: An infinitely more boring version of Tron Legacy and a much weaker storyline. Hangs onto unfunny quips and bad acting to struggle to the end of the movie.

title: Need more like this!
text: Fun ride... just wach it! If you enjoy sci-fi, and you like time travel, this is a movie for you. Netflix did a great job with this movie and the actors and actresses in it make it enjoyable for the whole family to watch. No spoilers here just enjoy it for what it is.. do not listen to the negative reviews, I just filled with heartwarming, laughter, adventure, suspense, love, and if you are here reading this before watching it just now, but your time is not being wasted. It is a very short movie cut straight to the point, but if you have also lost a loved one, it hits you in the heart my only wish is to have seen it in the theaters .

title: The kid steals the show
text: This movie is FAR to long.Action scenes when they happen are cool but few and far between.The kid is the saving grace of the film who adds character.If it was 30 mins shorter you'd give the movie a 6 but there's better family movies out there that deserve your time. The Adam Project really didn't deliver.

title: Another fun Ryan Reynolds Movie!
text: If you've liked anything that Reynolds has done lately, you'll probably enjoy this. I expected The Adam Project to be funny and adventurous but what I didn't expect was the touching moments and strong characters. You could argue that some of the more emotional moments were a little contrived, but the solid acting from the entire cast sold the scenes very well.I felt like the Adam Project borrowed elements from Star Wars and then mixed it with Tenet's sci-fi messing with time theme. Overall, it worked and was a good fun time.Walker Scobell, who played the child version of Reynolds' Adam Reed was a true gem! He did such a good job and was 100% believable.Overall, I'd give this an 8/10. It's fun and doesn't take itself too seriously. It's a good 90 minute escape held together by a strong cast.

title: Very Enjoyable
text: I only watch movies to be entertained. I do not care what genre it is, if it is good . This one does entertain you. I giggled and cried a little. Has a good plot, good character development, great music. Love Ryan Reynolds. Great for the whole family. Really enjoyed this movie.

title: Who talks like that?
text: Made it halfway through. If you hate precocious children in media, this isn't for you. A child scolds another character for talking like he's in a movie, saying, "Who talks like that?", then proceeds to have a smart-ass quip for everything.

title: Surprisingly good
text: A mostly family friendly movie, The Adam Project shows more emotion than expected. Ryan Reynolds reins himself in a little more and delivers some impactful scenes with his costars. His youngest costar doesn't get overshadowed.Even though mostly predictable, if you're looking for sci-fi with some depth and comedy, you'll enjoy this Netflix movie.

title: mediocre time travel film
text: The concept wasn't new, and the plot was kinda old as well, but there could've been a unique making style which might've worked for this kinda film with an old concept & plot.There could've been at least some twists. &turns or some quantum physics concept embedded in it, there are just countless ways to make it way better but since there was nothing new in it, it feels like a mediocre film and it indeed is.Just look at Indian cinema, there's a film called 'Kanam' which has got almost the same time-travel concept visiting one's child version and although it is made slow, it is still interesting & engaging with human emotions nicely embedded in it, something like that is what people would expect from time-travel films like these unless some good VFX & new tech is introduced with a good plot.Finally, if you're not a fan of sci-fi, especially time-travel films, then its definitely not for you, otherwise, you can watch it once if you've got lots of time.

title: The sci fi comedy
text: I love it when they mix 2 genres. This movie is another good example of that. The quirky dialogues , Ryan , the baby Adam , the sci fi story. What else can anyone ask for? The perfect family movie on a lazy Sunday.

title: Did't think it would be this good
text: Everything fits, the music, the sentiments, the acting, the special effects. Though predictable I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It is well made and makes for a perfect evening for the sci-fi fan.

title: Walker is Ryan!
text: I was laughing and loving the acting by Walker Scobell as young Adam Reed in the first few minutes of the movie. He was spot on with his snarky attitude just like Ryan Reynolds (big Adam), think Deadpool. It is like they share the same brain.Also always a joy to see Jennifer Garner on the big screen, we first enjoyed her from her time starring in the TV series Alias. This time as a sad mom trying to appear strong as Adam's mom (Ellie Reed) after losing her husband Louis (Mark Ruffalo).I have watched this multiple times and continue to love it. It is definitely family friendly for ages 13+.

title: Actors
text: Great actors. Lots of noise. Beautiful scenery but void of any worthy story or emotion. Just like everything they make today. Same ol' Netflix fluff. Typical nonsense.

title: Nice movie
text: Always love a time travel movie. This one is a different taste of time travel. Love the movie. Light comedy and great action. There has been very few good movies lately but this is a must see!

title: The failed project
text: Though entertaining the movie falls short of anything more than a 5/10.Everything is studio fx. The sciFi of the lightsaber (lucasfilm probably gets a % for everytime LS is mentioned), ships, stormtroopers (another SW rip-off), to the pod racing. OMG this is a cheap version of the Phantom Menace. SMH.Okay it is not that bad but it could have been so much more. The young adam (Walker Scobell) is funnier than the older adam (Ryan Reynolds) but outside of that the story was as it flowed. If it was not for the SciFi action you would lose interest quickly.

title: A futuristic story that makes us reflect who we are
text: The Adam Project is a film that is both personal & relevant in today's culture. Addressing topics such as bullying and isolation are highlighted. A personal journey that progresses with reflection on one's own true nature. Another excellent hit by Ryan Reynolds. Recommended for young adults and those who just love the comedic value of Ryan Reynolds. Very much looking forward to future installments from Shawn Levy.

title: Just for kids
text: Hollywood please back to 80 and 90's. Please come back to the last boy scout and seven and etc. I think we are going to a nothing. Why? We have anything but result is a disaster. It is not justice.

title: Ignore the negative reviews
text: Sometimes you have to take a faith and ignore IMDB ratings. This is a rare gem. If you are looking for pure drama, this is not your cup of tea. The Adam project is such a rare gem. A beautiful movie with a heart and soul. Such a feel good movie. Even it also have some sensible storyline. Mark Ruffolo, Ryan, Zoe and Jenifer all are great. But oh boy..... the small kid... he is so damn good. Just ignore the ratings and enjoy this movie.

title: Hmmm - it didn't really work
text: Not sure how you do this with so many good people, a fun concept, etc., but it just sorta fumbles around. This had so much potential, but shockingly - it doesn't really work. It just sorta stumbles!

title: Hysterical
text: I loved this movie! Ryan Reynolds never disappoints me (except that one time, but we don't talk about that). The chemistry between Ryan (Adam) and his costar Walker Scobell (young Adam) is truly remarkable. I think people expect a lot out of child actors these days, and Walker really killed this part! I would love to see another film with both of them.If you want a tender, fun, comical movie- I suggest you give this one a shot!

title: As bad as you'd expect it to be.
text: 32/100What would it feel like to have a pre-teen be better at acting than a guy with 55 movies?The Adam Project is anew movie, now part of an acting trilogy by Ryan Reynolds, from director Shawn Levy and, to be honest, I wish it was the last one.For all its glaring flaws, the first 30 minutes of the movie aren't as bad as one would think they would be. For a moment, I completely forgot what the real purpose of the film was and focused on its potential; this may have been a study of the main character's traumas in confronting an older, experienced version of himself. See the contrasts that this age difference brings and, above all, the healing process which the two could have faced together... but, I suppose that was too much to ask for a popcorn movie since, from those 30 minutes, the movie becomes what Back To The Future would be in a current context.The Adam Project becomes a movie like any other that is part of the action genre. She quickly loses coherence and her greatest quality begins to relate directly to how disconnected she feels. Especially, during his action scenes, which try too hard to resemble those of a Kingsman movie.However, where it lacks quality most is in its technical aspects. The color-coding looks like something out of a YouTube video, the editing work feels truly forgotten in the background, especially in the last 20 minutes, and, in particular, there's a deepfaked character, which I can't believe was approved in first place.Literally what else is there to say?

title: Enjoy the time you have
text: This movie may not have a good story, but its final reflection is shocking.This film has a weak story, since it is not captivating and does not seem to have much depth, due to the conveniences and inconsistencies that are in the plot, but the final message about taking advantage of the time you have and always showing the love you feel for the others is very important and impressive. The main conflict takes time to appear, and due to the short time that the characters have been on screen, it is difficult to connect emotionally with them, as well as there is no good construction of the characters or a detailed development. The performances are not stunning as the actors seem to be playing a role we have seen before, the special effects are decent and the antagonist is undeveloped.This movie fails as science fiction and action, but it can work as a family drama by portraying the importance of always showing what we feel for our loved ones, although it is difficult to ignore the plot so poorly thought out and developed, it is interesting and could be emotionally deep but not enough to recommend it.

title: Surprisingly Enjoyable
text: The Adam Project is a time travel film wrapped in a family movie with that typical Ryran Renolds whit. What I didn't expect was how emotionally deep this film hits on the relationship between children and parents without being corny or slowing the overall plot flow. Felt like Free Guy with more appeal to family, recommended.

title: movie for kids
text: I don't understand the average of 6.9, this movie is so predictable and full of lame dialogues, everyone are acting like complete morons, Ryan Reynolds is cracking wise while being shot at, maybe you're entertained if you're 12, for me it was a waste of time.

title: Hilarious, exciting, and surprisingly emotional
text: Comedy: This movie is hilarious at times.Excitement: The Adam Project isn't quite at the point of thrilling, but it's quite exciting.Emotion: At times this movie is very emotional. I was surprised by this, because this didn't look like a good enough movie to be able to do this, but it did.Overall: In the end this is an amazing movie. I didn't expect a lot out of it, but it's from the creators of Free Guy.

title: I regret watching this with my son
text: The adult Adam looked wiser about respecting his parents, until he suddenly punched his dad's face just because his dad was busy talking. After that, he made a lot of lame reasons. You know kids imitating talent is faster than their listening talent. Even though its age rating is 13+. The scene is really not appropriate.

title: Walker Scoobel stole the spotlight
text: The Adam Project is one of my absolute favorites. Glad that 2022 was able to spit out a fascinating story after all the lows brought by covid 2019. While Ryan Reynolds proves to be consistent when it comes to his branding, it was Walker Scoobel who stole the spotlight.

title: Mindless, inoffensive, mediocre
text: I'm not sure what the target demographic for the film is but If I was 12 or younger I would probably love this. As an adult though it feels pretty basic. The plot/science is barely sketched out and the whole thing just hangs itself on Ryan Reynolds' charisma which is fine but it doesn't feel like the film makers are even aiming for anything more ambitious than that. Also for such a big-budget flashy movie with spaceships and soldiers it managed to feel incredibly small which I did not like at all (goes back to things not being fleshed out sufficiently).

title: One of the best movies ever! LOVE the cast!
text: In an age where most movies are putting me to sleep, THIS ONE is one of the best movies ever! Drew me in from the first few seconds! LOVE the cast, especially LOVE LOVE LOVE Ryan Reynolds!! Spectacular SFX: video AND sound!! How does an obviously big-budget, high-profile, class-A cast end up on Netflix?! Oscars, please!! GREAT SCRIPT, GREAT ACTING, editing, directing!!! So great in my 12-foot screen movie theater!! XOXO.

title: Rip off
text: Of Star Wars and marvel, and I'm only half way through. Not sure I want to waste anymore time or brain cells on this one. It's too bad too, good cast gone to waste. Seems like Netflix continues to churn out subpar B movies, not sure why well, other than $$. But considering they're usually good selection of series, I'm surprised at all the terrible movies they produce.Anyway, another wasted opportunity.

title: Poor
text: Why is Netflix so fond of making movies that pretend to be cool, but are actually very humble. Ryan Reynolds is also really not seeking to make progress, indulging in his comfort zone, and repeating his own character indefinitely. Everyone's time is very precious, this kind of bad film is rarely made, and there is really no life to bite the lighter.

title: The Adam Project is a typical movie from Netflix
text: The Adam Project is a typical movie from Netflix. The whole film fits into a beautiful trailer. But there is nothing else in the film. A typical sci-fi film with a completely unscripted script and an even more trivial ending. The Adam Project can only be recommended to fans of the genre and unbiased viewers. Another Netflix passing movie.

title: A very good and family friendly movie
text: This movie is probably one of the best movies I watched in the first half of 2022. The plot is very engaging from beginning to end. The acting is very smooth, even the young actor does a fantastic job. There is some comedy going on throughout the movie which kept the audience fresh, and also some emotional scenes to balance everything out.

title: Wife sucked the energy
text: The Adam Project started out so good... The energy between. Ryan and his little brother was working and very funny. Until... Zoe (Ryan's future Wife) came into the picture. The movie stalled while the fake romance between Ryan and Zoe tried so hard to get us to believe how in love they were. It failed.. No chemistry between the two. This scene was hard to watch and killed the flow of the movie... I thought the writing was good. Especially with his mom and dad. It seemed very sincere.

title: Endearing
text: The plot of the movie hits home. Ryan Reynolds proved once again that he is an amazing actor, opposite Walker Scoobel who is an equally talented discovery of the former. I've never cried this much in a while. Thank you for the brilliant minds who put this movie together.

title: The BORING project!
text: I could not even finish this movie, just was not a story that really drew me in. I know I am not a good judge probably of this film because I should have known I wouldn't like it, because I can't stand Ryan Reynolds. I have never really knew why, but every filmed I have tried to watch with him in it, I just think he is a terrible bland actor. He just always seems like a jerk to me! So if you are a Ryan fan, maybe you will like this but for those of us that don't care for him, don't even try it, yuck....

title: Walker Scobell has so much potential
text: For once Ryan Reynolds wasn't the best actor in a movie he's in because Walker Scobell played young Adam so well. I can't wait for him to be in more movies, he has so much potential.

title: It's sad that cheap works nowadays, but apparently, it does.
text: I often wonder how films like this can devour 116m $. Then I remind myself that even The Room cost 6 million. And yes, I AM comparing this to The Room, because the only difference between those two movies is Ryan Reynolds and bad dad jokes. And The Room made me laugh more. So save yourself these precious hours. If story and quality means anything to you then do not watch this movie, trust me, after watching this movie I would've rather spent my time scrolling through TikTok.

title: Loved it
text: Really easy watch. Both Adams are really funny.Would definitely watch again.Writing more to get to 150 characters.Its still too short.Hopefully this time it's enough.

title: A movie written by a teenager for the kindergarteners
text: I will never trust Netflix movies and their reviews any more.A Quiet Place was highly reviewed despite a number of huge holes staring at anyone capable of thinking. This one is decently reviewed despite dozens of holes making this movie more like swiss cheese than anything else.I don't even want to bother listing everything that didn't make sense because that'd be just way too many. Just a few main things: 1. The script is badly written. No kids talk like the kid in the movie. 2. Multiple family/emotion moments forced into the script, felt like just needed to lengthen the already-weak plot. 3. Full of completely brain dead moments in every action scene (or the whole plot), like bad guys are invisible, but when they get closer to hero, they'll turn self to visible to be kicked by him. They don't use guns or flying scooter either until the hero fled away in a car and their meta armor can't even hold the guy's kick. The guy's huge abdominal wound was not a problem at all second day even after bad guy started hitting on the wound...I mean, for scifis, I usually can ignore one or two big holes and some small holes. But this one treats audiences like complete idiots. Sorry I can't enjoy anything like this. I'll stay away from Netflix movies.
I like it. It was entertaining, interesting, captivating and a bit sentimental. It didn't bore me out at all. The actors did an excellent job! A very good movie!

title: Another Netflix Original that brings nothing new to the table.
text: What is truly enthralling about a sci-fi movie that is made with precision is the ability it has to draw viewers in by encouraging them to watch it as many times as they wish and giving them the opportunity to still find details and connections that portray the vast world that has been created to tell the story. I don't know about you but in my case when a movie catches my attention, the first thing that I do after it ends is to browse the internet and explore more about it. But in the case of "The Adam Project", I can contend that I didn't experience this situation that I'm describing. The movie included plot holes galore and inconsistency. Time-travel is an overused topic, but can still be interesting when the entire plan has been masterminded, characters are brilliantly developed and you can perceive a unique flavour, which this movie lacked. I sincerely love when the cinematic world presents this certain topic, but once again, I was dissatisfied by the fact it didn't need too much of an analysis.However, it is a Netflix Original, and in such a case, I cannot expect that much. This is the type of movie that you would watch with your friends, family or when you are tired of swiping through the selection of titles offered on the platform.But don't get me wrong, I think there are some positive aspects to remark upon. Both Adams, played by Ryan Reinolds and Walker Scobell, had an interesting chemistry and were capable of matching each other's energy. I will not deny that there were moments that a smirk played on my lips. And then, some action scenes were exciting, as well as other scenes where an emotional touch wanted to be displayed.Overall "The Adam Project" wasn't a masterpiece, just a fun and enjoyable, quite cliche, film to watch. In my opinion, I can say it ends up being part of the group of movies that do not manage to enclose such a complex storyline, or that is expected to encounter more details, in the short time that a movie is expected to last, but you can still give it a chance.

title: It s good !
text:
I really enjoyed it and it s good action movie,
great acting and excellent screenplay. For me, it s one of the best Netflix movies by now. I am huge fan of Ryan Reynolds and I absolutely loved it !

title: Cracking family sci-fi / comedy
text: Lovely little film. Family friendly with sparkling dialogue. Okay, if you're expecting a serious sci-fi based on real science you may be disappointed, but if you liked Deadpool, you'll probably appreciate this. Stellar cast all do a solid turn, and the kid is a potential future superstar. Everyone in our house really enjoyed it. Great fun.

title: De-Aging Nightmare Distracts From Good Sci-Fi
text: As if "The Irishman" wasn't bad enough, special effects people are still messing up the de-aging process in films. Catherine Keener looks nothing like her younger self, which is surprising because over 10 years ago David Fincher was able to make Brad Pitt look whatever age he needed to look in The Curious life of Benjamin Button. This could have been a glorious little achievement in sci-fi, except someone dropped the ball in the special effects department and made it a nightmare. The film "Being John Malkovich" is one of my favorites. Everyone who is a fan knows what Catherine Keener used to look like. Whoever did the de-aging of Catherine Keener in this film has never watched her in her previous films and did an awful job of capturing her look her mannerisms and her wit.

title: So Emotional And Educative
text: The start to finish was so in line and towards the ending made me cry i just felt so emotional like it all ended well but the storyline was so in line that who wouldn't love Ryan and this movie cast...they did so well kudos. I would ask anyone reading this to watch this movie, also who wouldn't love it, lol its sci-fi and has two or more known actors, the lil adam also did a great job especially in all this scenes he knew how to react i nevr saw him miss a line i think he was well prepared for this movie not many kids these days would be that smart kudos to him also, i hope we get a part two of this movie.

title: Hmm
text: For some reason i was really bored during some scenes of this movie. And it even took me a few days just to finish watching it. Maybe i just dont like action movies i dont know. But the acting and everything else besides the story were on point hence my 4 stats.

title: The only thing bad was the de-aging
text: Great movie. I laughed, I cried, I watched stuff blow up. Perfect. Ryan Reynolds may play the same character in every movie, but it's a great character, so it works.

title: Disappointing
text: Time travel movies are hard to pull off. If you get too complicated you'll lose the audience. Netflix movie "the Adam project" just about manages to keep it together and is kind of fun. But still loses because of its terrible script.Ryan Reynolds is annoying in the movie. And the kid that's playing his younger smart mouth self is even more annoying. I was looking forward to Mark Ruffelo making an appearance. But then his banter with the two of them is just as bad.The jokes just aren't funny and don't work. Not too mention the strange random music choises and an ending that doesn't make any sense.

title: 80's throwback. Forgettable
text: There is nothing new in this movie to anyone above the age of 30. Which is why I would like to see IMDB adding the age of reviewers on here, because I can think of no other reason than youth for such high review scores.It's an OK movie, nothing to challenge, but also nothing to surprise, apart from the fact that Reynolds is less annoying with the wise cracks in this movie. When writers/directors talk about a homage to the 80's, what they actually mean is that they haven't got a strong original story.No one who watches this will remember anything about it in a couple of months.

title: Heartfelt time-travel comedy
text: The movie knows what it is. It's a family adventure with some quirky moments but it's a pleasure to watch. It looks great cinematically and offers a warm feeling inside after watching. There are too few movies like this. Maybe not an actual 10/10 but seeing this be at 6/10 does not make the movie justice.

title: Enjoyable generally to watch, but not super original
text: If you need a decent, not-super-high-stakes, but also heart-cockles-warming film, this works. It's not super original - there are a few scenes in this that literally come straight out of some Marvel films, and the general premise isn't that original either. But it's not a bad way to spend a hour and some. Also, Walker Scobell is amazing as a small Ryan Reynolds. Err, well, Ryan Reynolds' character.

title: Very good to watch in family
text: Very fun movie. Everyrhing I was expecting. Enough for a family action movie not a scientific máster pie e of course. Very good, very happy of watching it.

title: Just a boring cliche Disney Channel like movie
text: Netflix should stop expending money in actors and cgi and investing in writers and directors. I felt sick, seem watching Power Rangers or a Disney channel series.PS: N also should accept be part of apple bundle.

title: Predictably predictable fun.
text: Ryan Reynolds is his usual reliable self in an easy to watch action adventure which doesn't need the thinking caps engaging - just enjoy!The film is full of beautiful people doing their thing in an all too predictable way, but the simple truth is, predictable can be good! It's a good story with a nice flow from beginning to end, and some great action in between.Easy on the eyes, and easy on the mind. Forget whatever has happened during the daily grind, sit back with a drink and a snack and enjoy.I like predictable sometimes; it's comforting.

title: No thought required
text: Something to watch with the kids. It's a comedic yarn. The kid has some good lines and Reynolds is a good comedy actor. But it's the usual blarney, not original but will pass an hour or so on a wet afternoon.

title: Two Thumbs Up!
text: A fun, light hearted, action filled film. It also has that Ryan Renolds classic banter. Overall it was great to watch. Also love seeing some of the Marvel Cinematic alums in the film.

title: Where is the end of cheap computer movies ?
text: Why 80% of all movies today are made on computer virtual reality which costs 50k ?Kids today are not capable to watch and understand movies like Shutter Island, Godfather, Goodfellas because of this low quality stuff like all those Avengers for 5+ kids.

title: I loved it.
text: The interaction between young Adam and old Adam was hilarious.... Classic Ryan Reynolds humor. And loved the fact that The Hulk, Deadpool, Gamora, and Elektra were all in it. Enjoy it for what it is.

title: Bof
text: Brilliant idea good actors... great special effect buttt not so maybe a small film turned into something Hollywoodian.boring.... it could have been something.

title: I loved every minute of it.
text: Fun, warm, heartfelt, entertaining, action packed and funny. This movie had it all. Very enjoyable. We need more movies like this, in these times. I loved every minute of it.

title: Great movie
text: This is a great movie that reinforces the value of fathers and their relationships with sons. Its a little rough on the edges wirh some language, but for older teens, its nothing they haven't heard. In a swamp of trashy Hollywood productions, this is a welcome change.

title: Feel good movie without ambition
text: Story - which could have been interesting if there had been one. Actually, there were only shortcuts to get straight to the actual topic: Sons and fathers, missed opportunities, healing the relationship.Ryan Renolds - bearable this time, not very annoying. You have to thank him for that.Walker Scobell - you can expect a lot here, he was the best actor in this movie for me. Very good!Mark Ruffalo - a little too cuddly and warm if you took the whining from Big Adam first.Jennifer Garner - had a too small role, why don't they use the potential of this actress?Zoe Saldana - caught in sci-fi space, but came across as sympathetic.Effects - there were some, but those that need to look natural were poorly done. I was even a little upset. Freelancers are better than the "pros" now?Conclusion: It was a pleasant movie, no great pain, no great gestures, no great cinema. Mediocre, unambitious, but nice. Feel good movie sums it up quite well.

title: Don't forget, sometimes simple is great
text: Great movie, it ticked all the boxes for me and completed its aims.It didn't seem high budget or a film about the entire world's capitulation at the feet of time travel, but the title literally reads Adams project, and it was just that; comedic, relatable, desirable and wholesome.As much as it is a family grab for a good night's watch, the only thing I'd say, could be that it was simple, safe and effective. It didn't stand out enough for me or seemed like any risks were taken, which means it'll be likely be less memorable than a bad movie to say the least.Good night's watch..

title: Generic
text: A depressed smart weak boy meets his badass future self, they help resolve each other's & their family's personal life issues (which there's really barely any of tbh) while rescuing the world from a villain time traveler.

title: Fun, easy movie
text: Enjoyed this film thoroughly and laughed throughout. This film is ultimately is about not wasting time life on the unimportant things.Ignore the haters. It's a perfect date night or Sunday movie. Is it perfect, no, but it's been a long time since I've seen a film that didn't have something to pick on. This film left me smiling so give it 2 thumbs up.

title: Who is the target audience?
text: The Adam Project is almost a family adventure in the vein of Spy Kids. There an underlying theme of family reconciliation and growing up with some fun, over-the-top action to keep it going.Alas, it extends a little too far into the PG-13 realm to be comfortable for the younger set. There is profanity throughout and violence that gets a little bit too personal.There are other parts of the execution that could use some work. The special effects and the action sequences strain believability. The soundtrack feels out of place for the movie. It is mostly rock songs from the late 60s until the early 80s. That may make sense if the movie was set at that time. However, it is primarily set in modern times. Some key scenes would do much better with an orchestral score than the songs that were chosen.There is an interesting storyline in the movie, but it was not carried out as well as it could have.

title: As Super Hue-Man, We Shall Have Peace Within.
text: Did you know that we all have the power to close our eyes, travel back in time through the mind and HEAL parts of ourselves that had been hurt or traumatized? Adam did this and his journey happened within. He healed his child Self and therefore his adult Self through the power of his Higher SELF. This is how we have the power to be our very own saviors.

title: Glad it was on Netflix...
text: I'd be upset if I had paid to see this at a theatre & I'm not super pleased having watched it on Netflix, but hey, for a Covid Netflix release, it's fine.It'll be forgotten in a couple weeks.

title: It was fun and enjoyable!
text: It somewhat feels like a short.. Barely felt the length, and the content is quite easy to follow (specially for a time travel movie). Sadly, there's not much to it, and most scenes blend together as one bit set-piece. I do have to say, that the sentimental parts were really well done.. albeit a tad too present, until the end, where it pays off. The action, while cool, doesn't linger.. but this story is focused on messages (sprinkled around) more than anything else, and the context is just a vehicle to get there. It's slick and well produced, good CGI all around, and happens in few locations.Also, does metal stop being metallic while inside of a gun?

title: Great Family Movie
text: The end made the movie great. Anyone who has ever been a father would understand. Not many movies show that connection. Being a father has been my greatest joy, but I will say not as overt rewarding. The end said everything I want my children to know. Fathers love their children too.

title: Put your 'Back To The Future' goggles on and you'll enjoy this movie
text:
Time travel 'paradoxes' that play fast-and-loose with the space/time continuum (and physics in general). Snarky 'buddy cop' dialog. Heartfelt 'damaged family learns how to heal itself' moments. 'Disney-fied' violence where lots of people die but zero blood is shed. Throw them in a blender and out comes "The Adam Project".And although I'm often skeptical of a "Netflix #1" ranking, I *totally* loved it. If you hit PLAY with the same expectations you might've had when you first saw something like "Back to the Future," you won't be disappointed.PLUSES:
MINUSES:
IN SUMMARY, watch this when you are in an all-is-right-with-the-world mood (especially rare these days, I know), look for the good in the movie, and hopefully you will enjoy it as much as I did.

title: Could have been something really good.
text: Too much profanity for a kids movie. Big name cast and special effects. Plot holes are tolerable. Could have been a special movie. Who did they think would watch this movie?

title: Enjoyable
text: I liked it. The Adam Project was fun and entertaining. Acting was good, as you expect from the awesome cast, especially the little 'Ryan Reynolds' (Walker Scobell) who was superb!

title: Extremely unoriginal
text: Its like a Hollywood boomer watched guardians of the Galaxy and just added time travel. The acting is acceptable because that's where all the money went, but it's just such a boring predictable movie sue to it's plot and dialogue. Really just feels like it was churned out with very little effort.

title: Excellent Family Sci-Fi Flick
text: Ryan Reynolds a little more serious in this film, while still being as silly as ever. The directing is good, the cinematography is superb, the acting is mostly on point, and the characters are very fleshed out and believable. The plot isn't the most impressive or innovative, but it does just enough to invite the viewer into an interesting throwback to earlier sci-fi flicks like "Back to the Future" and "Star Wars". The music also did enough to complement the outstanding action scenes and heartfelt, emotional moments.If you want a "Netflix and Chill" movie that doesn't take itself too seriously, but does pack a good punch when it comes to personal growth, family interaction, personal issues, and sentimentalism, then The Adam Project is perfect for you. Watch alone or gather the family and enjoy!

title: No Heart and Rushed
text: Went into this hoping for a good family style film I heard a lot of 80's-90's style feel good, mystery and adventure and what I got was a rushed mess with no great investment in the characters and I really didn't care even when there should have been a lot of emotion towards what was going on with the characters. Aside from the sci-if and action these films feel soo rushed it's like there given a brief and a budget and told make this within 2 months......good actors as well. Streaming services are killing the film industry and classics like The Goonies, ET, The Burbs the list is huge I think if these were made now they would all be absolute garbage and this has nothing to do with the nostalgia factor purely down to the director not taking time and care in their art.....its just down to quick turnaround content for the masses who pay for streaming services and want new movies every week or they will stop their subscription.....it's quite sad really!

title: Really good
text: What more do the critics want? Good acting. Good script. Entertaining. Just enough action. Good amount of humor. Especially well done to Walker Scobell... looking forward to your next movie. Easily 10 stars.

title: The Adam Project Review
text: Definitely better than I thought it was going to be but still weak. There is some really good stuff here. Ryan Reynolds is doing some of his usual stick but he leans into the more dramatic and he's really good. I was very impressed with his performance here. Walker Scobell did a good job at portraying a young version of Ryan Reynolds. The quips and how they are delivered is exactly how Reynolds does it. Mark Ruffalo is pretty good as well. The emotional beats are definitely very effective at points especially towards the end with the final scene featuring the 3 core characters. Really good scene and really good character work throughout. The actual story here is weak. The time travel made some sense at first but fell apart by the end and besides the characters, there wasn't anything about the story that stood out. The third act especially is very weak and anticlimactic. There isn't a strong conclusion and the conflict just kind of ends. There really isn't a great buildup and that was very frustrating. As strong as some of the characters were, others were pretty bad. Zoe Saldana gives a good performance but her character doesn't do anything. She is just there to be Reynold's wife and that's her only purpose to the story and this isn't some flashback. She's essential to the story and then she just kind of leaves. Catherine Keener was a bad villain. Her motivations are confusing and unclear and there isn't any actual character there. Just a stereotypical villain. This definitely felt like a passion project from those involved but it just need its story to be improved and it would have been great. If you like Ryan Reynolds then you'll definitely enjoy this but you could probably pass on this.

title: Family Fun Movie
text: People are being way to critical of this movie. It was a cute entertaining movie the whole family can watch. Don't ask questions about time travel just enjoy the movie. Loved it.

title: Passable Sci Fi Entertainment for an Evening
text: THE ADAM PROJECT (C+) is a passable piece of family/sci-fi that is helped by its quick pace and decent performances. It's clearly meant to ape Guardians of the Galaxy with its wise-cracking lead, interesting future tech, soundtrack choices, and even the focus on mother/father issues. Unfortunately, it's nowhere near as inventive nor does it feature well-built action set pieces like its predecessor. Still, there's enough there (especially if you enjoy Ryan Reynolds style riffing) to justify a viewing. This is the kind of movie you can randomly put on, not worry too much about paying attention, and still get a smile or two out of it.

title: The new Time Cop
text: If you like movies then there is nothing not to love about this movie. It's a popcorn movie at best, most definitely a re-watchable movie. It was fun and exciting. Guess what, time travel is not real so get off your high horse you arm chair Directors and critics. If you're old enough to have seen time cop the plots are similar, but this is way better. It was like watching a 80's/90's movie before everyone had a fricken opinion and Ruined movies for people. It's not a waste of time! Just enjoy it for what it is. Its entertainment, an escape form reality.

title: Generic and cliché
text: Mark Ruffalo makes this movie much more enjoyable however do not watch it you are looking for a good time travel movie. The characters are generic and predictable and the villains have basically no motives or stand out personalities. The action scenes are graphically impressive however not memorable enough.The overall movie has a general lack of style and personality which makes it blend in against the other, better time travel movies.

title: If this is the best Netflix can do, more please.
text: Right out of the gate, I'm an older guy that loves Bruce Willis movies, Mel Gibson & Danny Glover, etc. I don't doubt that producers throw lots of money at movies these days, but modern movies, for the most part, lack the core parts that many older movies never missed on. The Adam Project incorporates action sequences that are stylishly similar to our 89s and 90s favorites, but also has just the right amount of appealing modern movie wizardry as well. Brutally witty dialog wrapped around a gripping storyline will have you watching to the very end, and you won't have to roll your eyes at agenda-centric content, because there is none. So if you've read this much, it's time to stop reading. Hit play, and enjoy.

title: Too cheesy and emotional
text: Why are Ryan Reynolds movies always so cheesy? Love him but any movie of his that I've watched were poorly scripted and as cheesy as a Disney animation. This movie gave out 90's si-fi vibes and I had a few laughs but in general not the great movie i had expected.

title: Very enjoyable
text: The movie is funny, it keeps your attention, the chemistry between the actors is good and the story is interesting. This was actually the first movie in which I liked Jennifer Garner. Good choice for a Sunday night.

title: Warning filthy language
text: I could not finish the movie as all the curing and vulgarity became overwhelming. I am shocked that parents want their children to hear and repeat such filthy language.It shows the times we are living in. No more morals or standards. No wonder our children are killing children.I hope enough parents care not to see this movie.

title: Fun fun fun snd funny
text: This film should be at least an 8. Great story, special effects and Ryan. Plus the kid is a real find. Actually the entire cast really good as is the storyline. Time travel is always fun and tricky but this film really delivers a clear time travel story.

title: Cheesy, but still better than The Power of the Dog
text: As stated, overall a bit cheesy. Some fun CGI and a few brief heartwarming moments. This seems like one of those films an actor agrees to make to payback a friend.

title: Good Movie
text: Would really like to see a sequel or prequel / spin off for this movie. Movie was really good because of the actor Ryan Reynolds as he is hilarious as always.

title: Typical Hollywood sci-fi movie!!
text: The plot is similar to other time travel movies with themes of hero saving the day. But the humour has worked out well. The casting is good. Action scenes don't engage you with those Star Wars sabers. A decent watch!!

title: Great fun, with a top notch cast.
text: Ok, it helps if you are a fan of Ryan Reynolds, and particularly his quirky fun and charm. That was the starting point, along with friends having seen it and recommended it highly.Would always have caught it at some point, but the comments by these friends brought it forward, and so glad they did.Interesting premise, time travel obviously done before, but this felt slightly different, but at the end of the day it has fun writing, some great quips (as you would expect from RR) , exciting, and well, the supporting cast, just excellent. Particularly the young Lad playing, well, the young Ryan character.Couldn't give it 10, because, well, keep that for the classically brilliant films as a rule, but of this type of fun, lighter hearted, part sci-fi, action film, well, could not have enjoyed it more. Ok, Ryan is Ryan, but when you love his stuff, that can only be a good thing.

title: As enjoyable as a tub of no-name ice-cream
text: Watch it with said ice-cream and you should have a perfectly mediocre night, which is what we seem to aspire to as a nation. Or you could watch a Jane Campion movie instead and actually give your brain cells and heart a workout. Up to you.

title: Truly enjoyable flick
text: Loved it for the actors. Funny, interesting, thrilling and also great backdrops.Enjoyed a movie after a long time. Long awaited No way home and Batman disappointed me, but this was a refreshing change. A true entertainer.

title: Honest reaction
text: This is the type of the movie that you can watch with your family or your friend. It got equal amount of goofy stuff and good stuff in it so y'all will probably enjoyed it. Overall this movie have an interesting story, it's about a guy named Adam who find his younger-self and goes on time travel adventure while being hunted by this evil corporation who is related to his familySurprisingly there is also drama in this movie about family and it's good. The interaction between younger Adam and older Adam is really cute and sometimes emotional. Sometimes there is a joke that kinda made me annoyed because it isn't in right place but it's acceptableHowever there is a thing that kinda ruin my experience while watching the movie, the time travel concept. There is some scene that breaks the concept of time travel that is established earlier in the movie (I like when movie have unique and interesting concept/rule in it but it annoyed me when it doesn't consistent with its concept/rule that is established in it)Also the main villain in this movie is hilariously evil and i kinda wish this movie just about Adam's family.

title: Great family movie
text: It was a real pleasure to watch this awesome movie. Dont listen to the ones that tells you its a poor one. Go on and watch it. It will make your day great.

title: Underwhelming w too many misplaced jokes
text: This is another "could have been much better" project.Plot is uneven and clunky and misplaced jokes are inserted everywhere when the context doesn't call for it - seems like the drive to fulfill a draconian joke quota (many bad) overrides having a sensible and compelling script.Eg. You see your future grown son for the first time and u say, "you look like a condom with buttons" ... in what way does it make anything anything? Just pointless crass ... and this movie is full of it. Hardly any near worthy of even a mild giggle.A good cast wasted on a bad script and bad direction.Bland entertainment at best.

title: Very good movie. Has it all...
text: If you watch this movie you will enjoy it. End of story.... But since I just found out that this review HAS to have at least a 150 characters, here goes...Is it the best movie ever made? No... but it is a damn good one; for reasons I can't really put my finger on. It has it all: action, comedy, time travel, beautiful moments, thrilling moments, and scenes that will have you tearing up. This really just has it all. Watch it.

title: Good cast and intriguing possibilities wasted
text: Started out as charming along the lines of The Last Starfighter but quickly gets bogged down in violent CGI sequences that add nothing to the story. Plot holes galore, of course, as there are in any time travel movie, but many of them are unnecessary and make the already rather thin story even thinner. Catherine Keener seems very uncomfortable in a thankless and two dimensional role. Disappointing.

title: I have no words
text: Emotions ,love , adventure and time traveling.i love this movie 🎥🍿. Fantastic 😊. Hulk ,Gamora and Deadpool work together 🤣.i love storylines.how to face it yourself.

title: Too little
text: + RR is just plain good and elevates everything he is in.+ The kid is also good.+ Garner is good, also the only believable character.+ Saldana is good, but blink and you'll miss her.+/- Emotions have potential, didn't work in my case, though.

title: Best Movie Ever
text: The Adam Project is REALLY GOOD at combining Drama, Action, Comedy, and Romance....based on Time Travel.Go watch it!!What are you waiting for??Go...now!!

title: All the FEELS
text: Laughed and cried and laughed and cried again watching this movie. Do not understand why it has a rating of "6.7".. but it is a really really good film. Anything with Ryan Reynolds in it is good.. to a laughing point in my opinion! Definitely a MUST WATCH with the family because it gets you in the FEELS!! So give it a go if you can.

title: Obviously Ryan is great but that's it
text: Ridiculous story and poor structure. Sure Ryan is great and he works well with the kid, but this film is just another poorly put together glossy turd like free guy. Reynolds is just playing himself now in every film and it's starting to get boring. They try to add a lot of emotion to it but you end up not caring because it hasn't done the ground work to get the pay off. Some cool action mixed with some bad. Loads of green screen BS. It lacks any real substance. Too much nonsensical crap like invisible bad guys that disintegrate when they are touched. It's just mind numbingly lazy and bad. Generous 4/10 just because Ryan, the kid and mark Mark are good on screen together.

title: I cried.. Alot!
text: This supposed to be an action comedy movie but actually I had a good cry over it even more than actual drama movies.Perfect casting and perfect deep yet simple writing.

title: A good kids time travel adventure
text: Predecible, siempre predecible.El carisma de Ryan mantiene a flote está película.Otra película de Netflix que después de verla quedará ahí en el olvido y que pocos volverán a ver una segunda vez.Vale la pena verla una vez, dos no.Predictable, always predictable.Ryan's charisma keeps this movie afloat.Another Netflix movie that after seeing it will be forgotten there and that few will see a second time.It is worth seeing once, not twice.

title: NETFLIX Sci-Fi movie
text: In 2050, Adam Reed (Ryan Reynolds) steals a time jet to fix a problem in the past. He winds up in 2022 and encounters his 12 year old self (Walker Scobell). His mother Ellie (Jennifer Garner) is dating a year after the death of his father (Mark Ruffalo). The two Adams are helped by his future wife Laura (Zoe Saldana) in their battle against Maya Sorian (Catherine Keener).I am a huge Sci-Fi nut. So it was a given that I would be watching this one.But I particularly enjoyed the dry sarcasm delivered by Ryan Reynolds, and his interactions his younger self played by Walker Scobell (I shall be watching out for him). It was very believable that they are the same person separated by time.The actor picked to play the dad (Mark Ruffalo) was also impeccably selected.Movies that score high points need to pull my emotion across the spectrum, which this did; making me both laugh and cry.I was genuinely impressed and will have no qualms in watching several times.

title: This film is about Ryan Reynolds
text: I add a 5 star rating because of Ryan Reynolds, otherwise I would give 1.The film is bad, it's sci-fi, comedy wanna be.The only enjoyable parts are the jokes and charisma of Ryan Reynolds, replace the leading role with anyone else and the movie false apart.So a nice hint for Hollywood, try to write a script and make a movie...

title: A great story that may well be a comeback for Netflix.
text: Wow, just wow. I cancelled Netflix due to their dark and cancel culture propaganda they started to push in their productions. I have to say it is really nice to see this movie now. I refused a comeback email due to their dark and awful productions in the last several years, so it was really nice to see this movie. I am shocked that such a well produced, written, and good movie would come out of their studios today. Maybe there is hope for Netflix after all, but I'll still wait to see if the change is permanent. The story is a very moving and thrilling movie. It rivals all the great science fiction movies you could think of. Time travel movies have gotten to the point of putting obstacles in the way of the story and this movie breaks those rules in a very well and thought out manner. I am very impressed with the movie and Netflix.I had to look up Catherine Keener to see which her was the real her. I will not say but I was surprised as much as it should have been obvious. I think they did a great job in the look of her in the ... edited version... to make me guess at which one was the real her. It shows how far they have come in digital editing of a person. You have to wonder, if any of the so called real life videos we make important decisions on, are real?It is certainly possible that the videos we are told are of real events could be digitally edited.

title: Passable entertainment
text: Ryan Reynolds. There. That's the one reason to watch this movie. Its passable and immediately forgettable. I can't find anything more to say about this film but need to say more because IMDB won't let me leave a short review.

title: to all you 'i liked it, butts'...
text:
You might think what i have to say here is a lot of nonsense, but...it could be one of the more important lessons of your life...
instead of comparing something to something else, see if you can appreciate it for what it IS...this movie was HIGHly enjoyable in almost any particular that i might care to dissect it into...so i won't...
learn to enjoy the moment...where you're at. NOW...
i'm going to tell you something else you might not want to hear...this will be the best life will get(unless you're in the middle of something tragic or depressing NOW, but for those of you who this ISN'T true for)...
the future, as you might have already notice, looks a bit bleak...and i'm not just talking because of the pandemic...or variants/mutations to follow...although that started the ball rolling nicely in the wrong/unlikeable direction...in a way that the whole of the human species might actually notice...
but i've been waiting for the OTHER boot to drop for a while...
the economic tidal wave that economists the world over are beginning to talk about...and this situation in the Ukraine ain't helping any...THEY'll tell you that if you just google a bit...
no matter what the govt of the country where i now live might tell their people, the reason they withdrew almost ALL covid rules/restrictions was because the economy was on the brink of failure...
so. The point is...you might be BEGging for entertainment HALF this good in the near future...
but, as it was, it was a LOT of fun...and i'm REALly sorry for you if you can't recognize this...
but DO try and take my advice and appreciate, as best you can, what you have NOW...if you're reading this, trust me, you're not as bad off as sooooo many people...
other than that, i wish you a healthy, long life...whether you like what i said here or not...

title: Funny but why Zoe Saldana
text: It's actually really good but Saldana ruins it.... Why her? She's not exactly the best actress there is. Anyway I'll give it a 5 but would have been a 7 if she wasn't in it.

title: Classic Ryan Reynolds...
text: As a lover of 'good' time travel movies, this is totally worth a watch.Funny, exciting and heart felt storyline...what more do you need from a movie.Just a shame it was brought out in the cinema, so people can leave the house and enjoy movies like we use to!?

title: Young adam
text: Young Adam is the star of this movie. How can a kid be that talented. He has a big future in front of him. The movie is ok for a Netflix movie it's a 5 without the kid.

title: Meh!
text: If looking to scratch an 80s movie nerve itch with a modern movie then this might be for you. It's painfully heavy on the sentiments, often not sticking the landing. More than anything this movie suffers for its writing, in addition to a really bad de age treatment.

title: A(da)mazing!!!
text: Most will call this "Just another time travel movie"...IT ISN'T JUST THAT THOUGH! You'll smile, you'll laugh and while you don't expect it, you might even catch yourself tearing up a bit. Ryan Reynolds really step it up here. Mark Ruffalo...MORE PLEASE!!! Zoe...5-10 minutes of pure badassery! All and all is a project that those who work on it did so with love. And it shows!

title: Blips of fun, but a noisy film and confusing storyline
text: I liked the first half hour, that was pretty much it. It was an incredibly choppy movie, and the action scenes were over the top. They had a decent ensemble cast, but the story wasn't cohesive and the dialogue got repetitive.It did had an occasional fun or emotional moment, but there are so many Hollywood time travel movies that truly raise the bar and that don't over-emphasize scientific concepts. Not a movie to rave about, despite having the charming and strong Ryan Reynolds headlining it.

title: Old-school sci-fi adventure
text: Thoroughly enjoyed this fun, energetic, heartfelt, exciting sci-fi action adventure movie. Felt very 80s in tone, but with all the modern bells and whistles.Well written. Plenty of jokes. Great fight choreography. Perfect Friday night fun movie.

title: Can't go wrong w Ryan Reynolds
text: It was ok. It's not something that I'll text all my friends about telling them it's a must watch. A few good parts. Good music. Few A-Listers. The story itself was just so elementary, for the lack of a better word. It made sense but didn't make sense at the same time. Eh.

title: Just enjoy it, don't think about the science
text: We really enjoyed this film but had to set aside the time travel principles. Ryan Reynolds and the young actor are incredible. Classic Ryan Reynolds one liners, very funny. JUST ENJOY IT FOR IT IS.

title: Podia Ser muito melhor ! Could be so Better !
text: Bad story bur great casting. Feels like it could be a great series, terrible way to explore what could been a great story about time travel. 5/10, good for watch on a sunday, nothing unmissible.

title: The Terminator meets The Kid(2000)
text:
Adam(Walker Scobell) a 12 year old, who's about to get a big surprise when he finds an injured man(Ryan Reynolds) in his late fathers cabin, but is in real surprise it's him from the future, but more trouble comes for them both, that could effect the future, will Adam and his younger self save the timeline before it's too late?A well made
time traveling action film, for kids and adults. Ryan Reynolds and Walker Scobell play off each other quite perfectly, has younger and older self. Katherine Keener is good, so was Mark Ruffalo. Jennifer Garner and Zoe Saldana also good moments when there on camera. Effects are great, and story is well paced.

title: Not worth rooting for.
text: Both the Adam characters are such a-holes. Honestly, they are so unlikeable that you really don't feel like rooting for them one bit. They try to add some emotional aspect wanting you to care at the start, but you just don't feel the connect as neither of the characters act like they are worthy of it. Thereby making the whole movie premise useless.

title: OK but not the best
text: The Adam project, OK but not the best. Ryan Reynolds is brilliant as always, and it is good how the young "Ryan Reynolds" character has the same mannerism as Mr Reynolds himself; clever. It is a simple, easy to watch movie, not the best, but good entertainment.

title: Eh. Not worth a second watch
text: Movie is typical for a Netflix movie. Overall decent production quality, but story falls flat. You can just depend on Ryan Reynolds alone. You have to have some good writing.

title: Cool action/fighting and visuals with the funny antics of Ryan Reynolds! :-)
text: A fun sci-fi ride!While I am a big fan of the Terminator and Back to the Future movie series (among various other time travel-related movies/series), I always struggle with some of the believability flaws in these movies/series - and, this has ruined many of them for me :-( However, with the amount of fun and coolness in this movie, I did not let such flaws - which did exist - ruin the joy ride for me! :-)

title: Next nexflix b.ll.sh.t
text: A fascist, imperialistic, without sense of humour remake of back to the future with cheesy scenes of "inter temporal love". If after 50 minutes you're still watching it you're loosing your time. A reminder on how poor can be Netflix productions.

title: Wholesome comedic Sci fi fun!
text: Wow just finished this one from Netflix and I can't believe it was free on Netflix 😱 when I saw Ryan renolds My hopes were high and boy this delivers.The story is very interesting with Sci fi, time travel, daddy issues and the works. Lots of things that make you quite sad and I did cry at the end. But also lots of things that are wholesome and sweet. There's a main story and a few sub plots so your never bored. Loved the idea this film had and the dynamic the boy and Ryan renolds had was great too. All the characters felt interesting and the actors did fantastic with what they had. Also if you were wondering, yes! This movie is hilarious because it has Ryan renolds. But seriously the kid, Ryan, their parents wow they were great.In summary I think if you have Netflix 1000% this is a good watch. If you like comedy, Sci fi, and family wholesomeness then this movie would be great for you. 8/10 loved it.

title: "Let my love open the door" again???
text: This movie it is so simple. Its looks like a kid movie, cmon. Mark Ruffalo plays his character exactly the same as what he did with the hulk. The little kid actor, he is ok.

title: Delightful and funny
text: I loved the 80's vibes and found it very entertaining. Someone referred to this movie as the new ET, and I can see what they meant. Excellent story, first class acting and weapons better than light sabres. I'm going to watch this with my grandkids for years to come, and I don't even have any yet.

title: "Wow!" From A Guy Whom Hates Movies Like This.
text: Again, "Wow!" From A Guy Whom Hates Movies Like This. I was certain I would turn this off within 15-minutes, but was stunned that it was still on after 30-minutes, and shocked to have watched the entire film. Yes. It's been done before, but this has a depth of love and life that few action films possess. An "8" for the level that this type film was taken.

title: How to make bad movies with A+ actors
text: You have Ryan Reynolds, Mark Ruffalo, Zoe Saldana, Jennifer Garner as your list of cast, Netflix money, time travel story (ok, not all time travel movies succeed) and manages to make a bad movie.First maybe 30 minutes was good, but then it goes downhill. Some of the examples of bad are:

title: WOW! What an enjoyable movie!
text: There have been many disappointments coming out of Hollywood as of late, however, it is surprising and refreshing to say that this isn't one of them.We've all wondered about the concept of time travel, and what we would do if we ever got the chance to travel through time. This movie explores some of the possibilities as well as the pitfalls. It has the love, the loss, the regret, and the hope.The action scenes are top notch, and the quips from Ryan Reynolds are as sharp and hilarious as ever. That being said, Reynolds delivers a performance with layers of depth and emotion, which is a pleasant surprise from Reynolds.Playing the peripheral characters were Zoe Saldana, Catherine Keener, Jennifer Garner, Walker Scobell, and Mark Ruffalo; whose solid performances breathed new life into to a genre we've seen time and again.Whether it's a date night, family night, a night in with friends, or flying solo, this film is built to entertain.Highly recommended.

title: Amazingly funny
text:
Is good.Great sci-fi flick
Good humor, bad science and heartwarming flavor!I loved it! I literall made an account just to write this.You don't want to miss it!

title: Entertaining movie!
text: Ignore those bad reviews. I was pleasantly surprised the movie is quite fun to watch that the 2 hours seem to go so fast. The casting of the little Adam is just perfect. He resembles Ryan and has the same tongue-in-cheek energy. Good CG, good cast, nice dialogue, good family movie.I would give this a 8/10 but upped 2 more stars to even out those unreasonable low rating.

title: Poor attempt to recapture the success of 'Free Guy'
text: Basically, its like a cut rate version of Free Guy, with poor plotting, some quite average acting from some actors, and some rather average special effects.Add in all the sanitized violence (can't see someone not wearing a mask and uniform killed, can we?), and the fact there's surprisingly few truly funny bits, and its really quite mediocre.Don't waste your time unless you really have nothing better to watch.

title: Joyful and emotional...
text: I really enjoyed while I'm watching this movie.. I didn't feel the time. Actually I was hesitating about watching it I thought it's gonna be boring, but I was wrong. Indeed I teared up during some scenes. It really touched my heart. The cast was amazing as well as the script.I love it.

title: Three Reasons
text: So this sci-fi near miss loses 3 stars for three gafs. You can't chop down a Boston classic to match sequence. Then their younger face technology seems like 8 years beyond the Irishman. Finally, when a truck drives full speed through the woods, there are roots, downed trees, branches and other bumps. How much could that have cost? Like a really decent flick. But blatant disregard for the viewer. It's like sime kid needs to understand what happened to a puppy and a frigging pigeon.

title: Disneys The Kid
text: Great concept and good plot but it reminded too much of the Bruce Willis move The Kid. Was this part 2? Haha. Great visuals. I liked how Ryan always has his charisma in his movies I just wish it was more action. But it's just like The Kid.

title: Was okay
text: There needed to be more depth in Adam's and other characters pasts, present and future, and more time given to developing the complex time travel science. As a movie it doesn't come close to Back to the Future. That movie kept it simple but had a lot depth and was great. This would have been a good series to binge after watching Disney Channels, Secrets of Sulpher Springs, also about time travel.Also the language and sex references werent needed for any reason Wouldn't watch it with kids.

title: Nice movie
text: The movie is funny and with a nice ending. Some scenes are unexpected in a funny way, but it's characteristic to Ryan Reynold's way of acting.I gave it 10 in order to improve the current average, I think it deserves more than 6.8.

title: Could be a 7 or 8 but is a solid 5.
text: Since Deadpool 2 I'm not comfortable with Ryan Raynolds anymore. All his jokes in other movies are foreseen and kida the same.This was different. I liked the plot and the powerful dynamic between both of the main characters.So Ryan Reynolds can be funny, again! It's a nice story with well-balanced humor which could let me rate this as a 7 or 8 out of 10.But, the total ugly and cheesy looking CGI fight scenes with the easy predictable "on the nose" ending will let me rate this movie only 5/10.

title: Twice the Ryan Reynold fun!
text: This was a well made time travel movie. They had an internally consistent theory for time travel for the most part. Not sure killing a younger version of someone wipes them out while in the past. That I think wasn't consistent but it worked I suppose. Maybe I need better math to get that part.Overall if you're a Renyolds fan I think you will enjoy it. If you aren't then I know we would never be friends and I don't care.

title: Possibly fun for younger audiences, but hardly watchable for adults
text: Had to endure this today for almost two hours, cause our company hosting friend picked this movie for us to watch (since his wife likes comedies).At first I wanted to give it a 2, cause I found the whole movie terribly boring, full of cliches, lacking basic principles of logic, flooded with pointless dialogues on top of pathetic and laughable action scenes.Then, after giving it a bit of thought, I've decided to grant it 4 stars just in case it might still be fun to watch if you're around 12-15 years old. But if you're an educated adult human being and your IQ is 120 or higher, avoid this movie, you will thank me in the end.

title: Surprising timetravel comedy action
text: A surprise feel good film that makes light of heavy science fiction topics whilst not losing the details and boring the audience- a perfect balance.The casting choice kept it interesting and relatable, and I found yound Adams performance inspirational.

title: Please don't have the same characters in every movie
text: Dear Ryan....we all love your deadpool performance, it's starting fun and great, but over the years you use the very same character in every single movie, like in this one in adam project, the movie is bad enough, and your same characteristic in this one even make it worse.

title: I enjoyed it but wow, some people hate it for no reason
text: Isn't the purpose of a movie to keep your attention and entertain you?This movie succeeds at that.It's a time travel movie, don't try to figure out how it works.Accept it for what it is and enjoy the ride.I've seen worse and better.

title: Terrific fun
text: The Adam Project is a brilliant movie. It brings back hints of Spielberg, Scott, Cameron, Lucas and others with its own twists. Elements of The Terminator and Back to the Future rolled into one.Reynolds is at his best and Scobell is perfect. Enjoy.

title: Terrible story nice budget.
text: We live in a world where movies try to use good acting and big budgets to make up for terrible story, lines, and action choreography.The entire story is not believable, the jokes don't land, every action must be preceded by a zinger. Its just god awful.Even the acting seems overreacting and too big even by movie standards. They try so hard it just looks out of place.

title: Yaaasssss!!!!
text: Ryan Reynolds did it again! What a great movie! I loved it from the start to end. It's the best movie I've watched on Netflix so far in 2022. Ryan picks the best movies to be in and doesn't disappoint! Go Ryan!! Keep it up!!!

title: Great Fun If...
text: If you can overlook some glaring patriarchy/sexism, this is a really fun movie. It takes me back to Definitely Maybe to watch the two Adams interact and there are some moving moments between grown-up Adam and his mom but more effort is put into making the moments moving between the two Adams and their emotionally unavailable dad. There are terrible plausibility and continuity issues that can be overlooked for the sake of fun, but the messages that will/should rankle are, 1) Women can't really understand science and will steal men's great ideas and make a mess of things because they are easily corrupted if given power, (even if, in real life, they've barely had any yet, but let's get busy scaring people about that happening in the future when they might get some), 2) A father is much more likely to instantly recognize his future child than a mom, who's just not as tuned in as a dad is, and 3) Boys and their video gaming will save us.

title: Hilariously brilliant time travel
text: This is so good it's Ryan Reynolds with a mini version of himself! So funny and so great to watch a brilliant time travel movie that keeps you laughing as well. I'm not sure why some reviewers watch films if all they want to do is criticise everything, I'd ignore anyone that seems to focus on how a film is filmed or where it's filmed they've lost the point of watching films!!

title: Ryan Reynolds is always Ryan Reynolds called Adam in this movie
text: Ryan Reynolds is always a friendly character, and they went to extra efforts to get this kid that mimics a mini Ryan but it looks like a skit more than anything. The other characters look like they are those rotary actors you see on all the HBO series but worse like they walked in for a day for the whole shoot holding heir breath and exhaling their lines during no COVID mask shoot time. Along with the Fx and editing this movie looks like a made for TV afterschool special. Forget the time travel aspect it must have been an afterthought while wearing COVID masks and breathing in their own green house emissions. And to me Ruffalo is a one of those talentless and unlikeable actors who is the exact opposite of Ryan Reynolds, and someone who I cannot believe is a star - he must have connections or dirt on someone; he is best as the Hulk, yeah the CG Hulk and not Dr. David Banner.

title: Very good! Loved! 💕
text: I cried a bit. It's really a great movie, I think the casts-- the Big Adam and the dad, Louis, looks similar (face), so that's good choice of casts. The storyline, I love it. I love everything despite the complicated concept of time travel ;---;

title: Not family suitable
text: This would be a good family film if not for extreme profanity throughout, even from the boy. It adds nothing to the film and makes it unsuitable for children.

title: Funny, emotional, warm and full of action
text: The story is simple and the ending is pretty much implied in the beginning. However, this movie is a perfect example of the phrase "it is not about the end, it is about the journey"There are some decent messages, given sometimes not so subtly and the acting performance made me cry my balls out.Ryan is as funny as you'd expect. And the rest of the cast complement him adequately.Acting is top notch.The movie is funny, emotional, warm and full of action.

title: boring
text: I've seen the movie a month ago. I liked is "so much" that today I had to look at the storyline to remember what was it about.Usually Ryan Reynolds is amusing but the only thing I remember from his movies is Morena Baccarin.

title: Fun family friendly movie
text: The Adam Project is a Netflix movie directed by Shawn Levy that stars Ryan Reynolds in three different timeless to try to eliminate time travel. Ryan travels back to 2022 and meets with his younger self to be able to right the correct timeline. Mark Ruffalo acts as the father of time and the boys father while Jennifer Garner is the boys mother. Catherine Keener plays the selfish antagonist who wants to use the timeline to benefit her needs. Zoe Saldana acts as the love interest trapped back in time waiting for Ryan to come back and save her. Overall great storyline with a small cast derived by former Marvel superheroes with beautiful special effects. The script was not as funny but it is a fun family friendly movie.

title: This movie can't decide what it is!
text: Is it comedy? Sci-fi? Drama? Action? It's hard to tell from scene to scene. It's not a terrible movie, but it's not good, either. Too silly for adults, but maybe kids will like it.The only bright spot is Jennifer Garner, who improves every movie she's in.

title: I rate this a solid 10 for a family movie.
text:
Honestly, I feel like this is the best movie Netflix has made to date. It has action, is funny, even had
My eyes water up a couple of times. Seeing how much my teenagers enjoyed this movie made it that much better. I gave it 10 stars because it's a movie of its own kind. It was made for an adult or kid. The nostalgia you get from this movie will give memories of back to the future and star wars at the same time.

title: Generic. Predictable. Boring.
text: This movie did not work for me at all. I guess it was meant to be a loving, wacky homage to iconic time travel and sci-epic movies, but the terrible writing just ruined any chance of me enjoying either the storyline or the characters. It's just very disappointingly average, so I couldn't even view it as a "so bad it's good" type of film. I kinda wished I didn't sit through this one, honestly.The dialogue was so awkward and unrealistic, especially for the main child actor who attempts to sprout off "witty" or "deep" jokes and remarks every couple of minutes that just wouldn't come out of any normal 12-year old's mouth. Ryan Reynolds is in familiar territory, I guess, shooting off his usual brand of "haha XD" jokes that I just don't find funny (granted the guy looks to be having a lot of fun, you gotta give him props for that). The rest of the actors all give performances as well as they could, but the script just doesn't let any one stand out in any shape or form.The storyline mashes up the usual "time-travel to save the world" shenanigans with a healthy dose of space opera action sequences, and it really adds nothing new or interesting to the formula. The fights and effects are all executed competently enough but I wouldn't say it's anything extraordinary, and it does not help that several sequences are riddled with plot holes and logical impossibilities. The movie also tries to blend in some heartfelt family drama with some emotional dialogues and scenes, but once again the execution is so shoddy that it probably could've done itself more favours just sticking with a more focused direction.In conclusion, this movie's inoffensive and light-hearted enough that you could probably just pop it on at a party and pass some time with it, granted you switch your brain off for the duration. But honestly, you would be much better just watching a Marvel movie instead, as it does everything The Adam Project tries to do but much better.

title: Fun to watch
text: People need to take a chill pill. This was a fun movie to watch on a Friday afternoon with family. Highly recommended. Ryan is the heart of the movie for sure and made me feel warm and fuzzy on the inside.

title: Paint by numbers
text: Netflix seem to have the uncanny ability to take all the elements of a good\great films and assemble them into mediocrity.Reynolds doing his PG routine. Ruffalo and Saldana for marvel fanboys. Keener and garner for the dads.
